Name: HP Victus Gaming Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX
review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†Laptop CPU runs hot. Windows11/HP/AMD background software keeps cpu working at 30-40% even at idle. But right when you launch task manager to see which process is taking up so much CPU resources, these processes stop right away and you can't even figure out what processes were running. Suddenly the processor load is at 1 or 2% instead of 30-40%. Something is going on with Windows11. My issue was this background shenanigans kept the CPU/Laptop hot. Even at 30% CPU load, temperature can get near 100C. So what I do now is always keep task manager running, this keeps the unnecessary background processes stopped and lets my CPU be cool when idle. To monitor CPU load and also temperature a software called CoreTemp can be used. Essential if your CPU is being used/hijacked by some unnecessary process which hides itself in the Windows Task manager like in my case.edit: Used a third party software called Anvir taskmanager  and found windows explorer was keeping the cpu at 33% load even when idle, making the CPU temperature reach 100C for no reason. So just restarting the explorer in taskmanager fixed the issue.Initially without any clue as to what was happening, I had to re-paste the CPU/GPU thermal paste, try out a third-party software to control AMD Ryzen temperature. More about that below. Also figured out HP factory setup for the laptop back panel had a plastic sheet which was covering up a huge air vent. So make sure to discard plastic sheet if you are planning to game and want to keep the laptop  as cool as possible.I like my laptop to stay sort of cool even when gaming, so it lasts long and I don't have to worry about replacing it's fan sooner. I re-pasted the CPU and GPU with some Cooler Master MasterGel Pro Thermal Paste. When I opened up the thermal heat sink metal plate, there were two kinds of paste, grey on CPU/GPU and white on some other chips. The white paste is a silicon based paste called CLG-3500 the name you can find in the Maintenance and Service guide for this laptop on HP website. I left the white paste there, it's of lower thermal conductivity so basically lower quality than mastergel. I filled some gaps on it with my higher thermal conducting Mastergel paste, a few drops here and there. These chips are of lower importance in generating heat when compared to CPU/GPU and also Mastergel paste does not conduct electricity.  For CPU GPU I cleaned out entire factory applied grey thermal paste with some iso alcohol/cloth and then repasted with my Mastergel paste. The mastergel/thermal paste only conducts heat to metal plate and it's upto the fans/ventilation to remove it from metal plates.HP factory setting for this  laptop blocks the main air vent on the back panel of the laptop with some kind of plastic/paper sheet thing. You can see attached pics. Don't know why HP would block a huge air vent they made themselves for their gaming laptop with a plastic sheet. This air vent sits right on top of the heat conducting metal plate and so opening this up would conduct away most of the heat from the metal plate easily, letting the laptop run cooler more easily and letting the laptop fan do less work and thus last longer. Any plans to use a laptop cooler stand with built in fans would be more effective if the back panel had lots of holes on it for cooler air to flow in. An MSi bravo laptop that I considered with same processor and graphics card  as this HP victus has a backpanel that exposes most of it's metal plates to air easily with lots of holes. I initially thought this HP model also had air vents from the few pics could find earlier but only found it was blocked once I got it in my hand. So I plucked out this blocking sheet right out of the backpanel and now my airvents are fully open exposing the hot metal plate. I made a DIY laptop stand with a USB table fan and an inverted plastic box with a big hole for the fan to sit in. I put the fan inside the box and the laptop on top of the box so that the fan blows air right at the air vent/metal heat sink plate.With this set up I am able to keep my laptop cool when gaming heavy. I ran God of War game at high graphic settings, which made my CPU consume 80-90Watts and GPU 70-80 watts and produce maximum heat, CPU went to 101 C and GPU to 90C. The frames per second for GOW game was good at 40-65fps in closed settings and slightly laggy in rare occassions. But since I repasted the CPU/GPU, my laptop backpanel air vent was fully open and I also put a table fan blowing air into the metal heat sink ... over all the laptop body was cool underside and slightly warm to touch on keyboard regardless of whether the CPU/GPU was hot. Also monitored the laptop CPU fan speed using Speedfan 4.52 software. The maximum speed is around 4800 rpm (OMEN software can force CPU fan to maximum speed). while idle it's around 2200 rpm without external fan and 0 rpm with external fan. While gaming with my current set up and an external fan, the cpu fan speed is around 3800 to 4000 rpm. It never reaches the maximum speed because over all laptop is cool even when CPU is hot.For experts who know about TDP and want to control CPU wattage and temperature directly, there are two softwares, one is Ryzen controller and other is AMD APU Tuning Utility. Both use another program called RyzenAdj.exe which can directly change certain parameters of the Ryzen CPUs. For this Ryzen 5600H cpu, the max TDP power value it can operate at is around 113 Watts. The max temperature it can operate at is around 100C. Both are factory set and can be found using command line interface with Ryzenadj software. So using one of these softwares Ryzenadj, Ryzen controller  or AMD APU Tuning Utility, you can set these values during a user session. For example you can decrease  the maximum wattage allowed from 113 to 50 watts and maximum temperature can be decreased from 100C to say 70C. With these new values, the Ryzen 5600h CPU will not be able to use more power or will not be allowed to heat up beyond the set value. These settings are always reset upon restart of the laptop provided you do not apply it again.  So I  used these softwares to try to decrease my laptop  temperature. For idle/not gaming setting, I would use a temperature limit of 70C and the CPU would never cross this value. You can also use these softwares to set temperature or TDP wattage values while gaming. For example a setting I used was not allow temperature to cross above 80C  and not allow TDP to cross above 75W. Only one of these values will take precedence over the other, probably the temperature one because CPU heats up really fast even with 30% load. Played a lot using these settings and was able to get good 40-60 fps in Racing game Dirt 5 in high medium mix graphic settings on a heavy rain race track simulating most weather and graphic effects. The CPU temperature never crossed 80-81C. GPu temperature reached near 80C but this cannot be controlled directly by these softwares, only can change and control CPU values. If lacking a Laptop cooling stand and external fan, I would use these softwares to decrease laptop temperature but otherwise it's not necessary.Laptop monitor lacks color, Recommend installing latest AMD radeon drivers and AMD Adrenalin software. I increased the saturation of my monitor. AMD Adrenalin software also has a vivid setting for global display/graphics. Use that to show more colorful display and in game .The Laptop graphics card has 4GB vram which can affect high texture graphics required for some games. Some games like dirt 5 or forza 5 gives vram low warnings. Still for Dirt 5 graphics is pretty great. For Forza 5 it could use a bit improvement. Forza 4 runs great and has great graphics though. Though at this price point this laptop is good , most 6GB vram laptops are selling  at way higher prices. I would recommend a high 6GB VRAM graphic card rather than a Nvidia 3050 as an improvement over this rx 5500mAlso recommend getting another 8GB RAM as it would add more to gaming and multi tasking experience.  I installed two 16 Gb rams to have total 32GB and everything works great, switches programs on the fly, from gaming to work instantly. Some rare games like God of war and Modern warfare warzone battle royale used more than 16 GB ram, up to 20GB. For most other games 16GB should be more than enough.edit: tried out several games, all action adventure and racing games available for  xbox gaming pass and EA play subscription . Over all the impression is this laptop is good for gaming at 1920 x 1080 resolution with greater than 40 fps minimum at high graphic settings. It can go to ultra graphics for games released before 2020. One issue I found was when gaming long hours, the battery seems to be discharging at a slow but significant rate even when power cable was connected. The issue could be either laptop or my home's power lines. No idea.edit2:Due to modifying my laptop cpu's power settings using third party sw, or due to unlocking and using windows ultimate performance/high performance power plans in windows power options, one of those two reasons, Maybe not these reasons at all, but anyway my cpu and gpu together are consuming more than 150 watts  that the power brick can provide and this is what is causing the battery drainage when I play games for over 5 to 6 hours continuously. So I now limit the cpu power limit to around 78W using ryzen controller sw. Rest of the power from power brick is reserved for graphics card. This resolves the battery draining problem I was having and I am still able to play games at more or less same quality, speed and graphics. Constant draining and recharging would be bad for battery life. This makes it seem like the cpu and gpu of this laptop could have performed greater if it were provided a 200W power brick.
review_title: Overall Good Laptop for both medium-high graphic quality gaming and work/anything else

Name: HP Victus Gaming Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX

Name: HP Victus Gaming Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX
review: Review post approx. 5 months of use:Despite the disappointing state of Indian laptop market since mid-2020s, I'd go ahead and say that if you're looking for a laptop for budget gaming or media creation, at the time of writing this review - this is the best you can do in terms of price to performance ratio. This is currently the best performance laptop you can buy in 50k-85k segment. And that's a huge claim, I know, but the Indian laptop market is that screwed at the moment. There are just no fair offerings in that segment and that segment is supposed to be multiple segments (like 50-60k, 60-70k, 70-80k and so on). Of course I'm leaving out RTX3050 laptops but I don't think they're priced well for what they're offering. The only other laptops that make sense would be 3050Ti ones due to their higher performance and even then, their pricetags are not proportional to the increase in performance when compared to this RX5500M laptop. You pay way more than the performance bump you get.Also, please remember to uninstall bloatware and stick to OEM graphics drivers instead of installing Radeon graphics drivers (because every laptop is different and parent companies know better about what drivers would serve their laptops better- speaking from experience with this very laptop).The Victus has a lot of things going for it. Remember, I bought this was like 48k in a sale so the features it has at that price point are a no-brainer.Pros:- Tiny bezel around the screen makes it feel so slick and modern- Screen size is plenty big and the screen quality is quite pleasant to look at- Backlit keyboard (white light only but that's not something I consider a con since I don't like RGB anyways)- Numpad included in the keyboard- Awesome thermals. It plays games like CSGO and Mudrunner on max settings without having to ramp up the fans so the experience is quiet and pleasant. Although, playing more demanding games like Snowrunner do tend to make it run hot so the fans spool up to higher RPMs (in which case you can just use noise-cancelling headphones to offset that issue).- Best in class CPU and graphics card. I added in another 8GB RAM stick and this thing is now unstoppable!-Soild build quality. I was attacked by a dog so hard that I got knocked back while this laptop was in my bag behind my back and when I fell, the bag was crushed under my weight. Not a scratch.- Minimalist design is very much appreciated. I hate loud, flashy, obnoxious designs from other brands screaming, "LOOK AT MEEE!!!1!1!!" so this subtle, subdued but still upmarket design is great for me.- People complain about this laptop's screen wobbling issue, especially while under a running fan. Sure, it's a thin screen so it's bound to happen but honestly, I don't see it. Yeah, it does wobble if you slap the screen gently but that's rare and also, why would you? I just leave the screen alone and do my thing. Haven't had a problem yet.Cons:- It's very heavy. At 2.5 kg, this thing is a behemoth. But I guess, you can't have everything. I'm okay with this being the only con to that many features at this price point.- Can't think of any other cons. In fact, I haven't had any other issues with it during the last 5 months of my ownership at all whatsoever so... that's great!Honestly, this is a great value for money laptop and I recently recommend it and got at least 3 other people to buy it. Not one of them has had an issue either. This laptop was one of the best strategies adopted by HP of late. I look forward to many years of worry-free gaming and 3D animation with this thing.

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) (8 GB/512 GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/4 GB Graphics/NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2050) A515-57G/ Gaming Laptop (15.6 inch, Steel Gray 1.8 Kg
review: I am a linux guy, so after I brought this laptop (16gb) spending 53k on festive season, simply installed Debian on new partition. Found that, hardware is so new that the os can't find it.If you are an average user and willing to use linux you can try linux mint which works perfectly including its graphics card. No issue at all.I knew that the battery backup will not be much more so I am not going to complain here - getting approx 3 hours plus by browsing and coding (not compiling)Good: speed: performance is super. very fast and responsive.Problem 1: keyboard color: on daylight if you don't look the keyboard vertically which you wont - will not be able to read letters written in keys. - very bad. I have enabled keyboard light always on from bios. typing is not so good or bad.Problem 2: touchpad: in windows and linux both - touchpad lags for couple of seconds very now and then. Trust me - this is not a user created issue. It might be the touchpad hardware issue (not Acer's fault) or software (firmware / kernel) issue presents in Windows and Linux both. Its been more than a year now (talking about touchpad hardware, not the laptop).Problem 3: screen bleed: very little screen bleed in the screen. I can live with that.Tips: In bios if you cant see any option to change touchapd driver, for example ps/2 or advance mode - press "ctrl + s" and few new options will be available for that session.

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) (8 GB/512 GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/4 GB Graphics/NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2050) A515-57G/ Gaming Laptop (15.6 inch, Steel Gray 1.8 Kg
review: The Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop is a beast! The 12th gen Intel Core i5 processor with 12 cores and 16 GB of RAM makes for a lightning-fast machine. I can play all of my favorite games at high settings without any lag or stuttering.The design of the laptop is sleek and modern, with a backlit keyboard that makes typing in the dark a breeze. The Windows 11 operating system is a nice touch, with a user-friendly interface that's easy to navigate.Overall, I'm extremely happy with my purchase of the Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop. It's a powerhouse that can handle anything I throw at it, and the graphics are stunning. Highly recommend it to any gamers out there!

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) (8 GB/512 GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/4 GB Graphics/NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2050) A515-57G/ Gaming Laptop (15.6 inch, Steel Gray 1.8 Kg
review: This acer laptop gives good performance without any doubt. For light works, this much weighing laptop is not necessary. This much performance is also not necessary. Go for 14" ones. I expect acer to manufacture this same laptop with 13-14" screen to get good battery backup. 15.6" laptops drain so much battery for no reason. Also, Windows has become battery hungry.Ratings:Battery = 3/5Screen = 3/5Processor = 4/5Ready from Boot = 4/5Sound = 2/5Weight = 3/5Pros:1. Good processor i5-1240p2. Thunderbolt port3. Typing is good. Got Number pad too.4. Fast charging5. Sound Quality is good6. Brightness is good7. No fan sound. It is quiet, surprisingly (for me .!!)5. Received a sealed piece (thanks to amazon)Cons:1. Low sound output. You should put the laptop on a table or pad to get reasonable sound output.2. Low battery backup for heavy works, just 2-3 hrs or even less. Android Studio works just for 2 hrs only. You can get away with 5hrs with light works for sure.3. Display Contrast is not good.4. Key colors are really bad. It is very difficult to spot keys suddenly. If you don't know typing, it wastes lot of time. Black color is the preferred one. I want to see the engineer who designed it :(

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 5 4600H, 4GB NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650, Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Black/2.3 Kg), FA506IHRZ-HN111W
review: I bought it at 50k. After several months of usage, I am writing this review.Pros-1. FHD Display is very nice, better than many other laptops at this range.2. The RGB Backlit keyboard looks very eye-catching especially when the lights are turned off. Even after applying keyboard guard, the keys are visible clearly.3. Anti- glare screen is perfect. This is important because otherwise you would see your face while working on it which could be irritating/disturbing.4. The 144Hz refresh rate makes the display smooth. You can also set it to 60Hz to save battery.5. AMD Ryzen 5 4600H is a powerful processor. For normal use, it is more than enough. Also, this is hexa core processor, so parrallel processing is better than that of many of the intel processors.6. Since it is a gaming laptop, so it has in-built lan port unlike some other laptops.7. The 150W charger is literallyüî•üî•. Other laptops generally have 65W chargers. Charging is not time consuming for this one.8. It comes with 4GB graphics card at this price range. May be good for entry level gaming.9. Again for normal use, 512GB SSD is more than enough. And we all know, SSD is way faster than HDD.10. For coding, it is good.Cons-1. Battery life is poor, which may leave you searching for sockets wherever you go. You would always have to worry about the battery when you carry laptop outside the room. The 48 Wh battery does not last long. At this range, other laptops have comparatively much better battery life.2. Speaker is not so good. I have enjoyed listening to music on other laptops, but this laptop won't give you that 'feel' of a good speaker. But since it is gaming laptop, you can compromise on this part.3. MS Office is not of life time warranty. This is not good if want to work on PPTs or documents. But you can always download other apps like WPS Office for free.4. This is heavy (yes, it makes some difference when you have to carry it with you here and there) . But for a gaming laptop it can easily be neglected.I hope this review was helpful to you.

review:

¬†Laptop CPU runs hot. Windows11/HP/AMD background software keeps cpu working at 30-40% even at idle. But right when you launch task manager to see which process is taking up so much CPU resources, these processes stop right away and you can't even figure out what processes were running. Suddenly the processor load is at 1 or 2% instead of 30-40%. Something is going on with Windows11. My issue was this background shenanigans kept the CPU/Laptop hot. Even at 30% CPU load, temperature can get near 100C. So what I do now is always keep task manager running, this keeps the unnecessary background processes stopped and lets my CPU be cool when idle. To monitor CPU load and also temperature a software called CoreTemp can be used. Essential if your CPU is being used/hijacked by some unnecessary process which hides itself in the Windows Task manager like in my case.edit: Used a third party software called Anvir taskmanager  and found windows explorer was keeping the cpu at 33% load even when idle, making the CPU temperature reach 100C for no reason. So just restarting the explorer in taskmanager fixed the issue.Initially without any clue as to what was happening, I had to re-paste the CPU/GPU thermal paste, try out a third-party software to control AMD Ryzen temperature. More about that below. Also figured out HP factory setup for the laptop back panel had a plastic sheet which was covering up a huge air vent. So make sure to discard plastic sheet if you are planning to game and want to keep the laptop  as cool as possible.I like my laptop to stay sort of cool even when gaming, so it lasts long and I don't have to worry about replacing it's fan sooner. I re-pasted the CPU and GPU with some Cooler Master MasterGel Pro Thermal Paste. When I opened up the thermal heat sink metal plate, there were two kinds of paste, grey on CPU/GPU and white on some other chips. The white paste is a silicon based paste called CLG-3500 the name you can find in the Maintenance and Service guide for this laptop on HP website. I left the white paste there, it's of lower thermal conductivity so basically lower quality than mastergel. I filled some gaps on it with my higher thermal conducting Mastergel paste, a few drops here and there. These chips are of lower importance in generating heat when compared to CPU/GPU and also Mastergel paste does not conduct electricity.  For CPU GPU I cleaned out entire factory applied grey thermal paste with some iso alcohol/cloth and then repasted with my Mastergel paste. The mastergel/thermal paste only conducts heat to metal plate and it's upto the fans/ventilation to remove it from metal plates.HP factory setting for this  laptop blocks the main air vent on the back panel of the laptop with some kind of plastic/paper sheet thing. You can see attached pics. Don't know why HP would block a huge air vent they made themselves for their gaming laptop with a plastic sheet. This air vent sits right on top of the heat conducting metal plate and so opening this up would conduct away most of the heat from the metal plate easily, letting the laptop run cooler more easily and letting the laptop fan do less work and thus last longer. Any plans to use a laptop cooler stand with built in fans would be more effective if the back panel had lots of holes on it for cooler air to flow in. An MSi bravo laptop that I considered with same processor and graphics card  as this HP victus has a backpanel that exposes most of it's metal plates to air easily with lots of holes. I initially thought this HP model also had air vents from the few pics could find earlier but only found it was blocked once I got it in my hand. So I plucked out this blocking sheet right out of the backpanel and now my airvents are fully open exposing the hot metal plate. I made a DIY laptop stand with a USB table fan and an inverted plastic box with a big hole for the fan to sit in. I put the fan inside the box and the laptop on top of the box so that the fan blows air right at the air vent/metal heat sink plate.With this set up I am able to keep my laptop cool when gaming heavy. I ran God of War game at high graphic settings, which made my CPU consume 80-90Watts and GPU 70-80 watts and produce maximum heat, CPU went to 101 C and GPU to 90C. The frames per second for GOW game was good at 40-65fps in closed settings and slightly laggy in rare occassions. But since I repasted the CPU/GPU, my laptop backpanel air vent was fully open and I also put a table fan blowing air into the metal heat sink ... over all the laptop body was cool underside and slightly warm to touch on keyboard regardless of whether the CPU/GPU was hot. Also monitored the laptop CPU fan speed using Speedfan 4.52 software. The maximum speed is around 4800 rpm (OMEN software can force CPU fan to maximum speed). while idle it's around 2200 rpm without external fan and 0 rpm with external fan. While gaming with my current set up and an external fan, the cpu fan speed is around 3800 to 4000 rpm. It never reaches the maximum speed because over all laptop is cool even when CPU is hot.For experts who know about TDP and want to control CPU wattage and temperature directly, there are two softwares, one is Ryzen controller and other is AMD APU Tuning Utility. Both use another program called RyzenAdj.exe which can directly change certain parameters of the Ryzen CPUs. For this Ryzen 5600H cpu, the max TDP power value it can operate at is around 113 Watts. The max temperature it can operate at is around 100C. Both are factory set and can be found using command line interface with Ryzenadj software. So using one of these softwares Ryzenadj, Ryzen controller  or AMD APU Tuning Utility, you can set these values during a user session. For example you can decrease  the maximum wattage allowed from 113 to 50 watts and maximum temperature can be decreased from 100C to say 70C. With these new values, the Ryzen 5600h CPU will not be able to use more power or will not be allowed to heat up beyond the set value. These settings are always reset upon restart of the laptop provided you do not apply it again.  So I  used these softwares to try to decrease my laptop  temperature. For idle/not gaming setting, I would use a temperature limit of 70C and the CPU would never cross this value. You can also use these softwares to set temperature or TDP wattage values while gaming. For example a setting I used was not allow temperature to cross above 80C  and not allow TDP to cross above 75W. Only one of these values will take precedence over the other, probably the temperature one because CPU heats up really fast even with 30% load. Played a lot using these settings and was able to get good 40-60 fps in Racing game Dirt 5 in high medium mix graphic settings on a heavy rain race track simulating most weather and graphic effects. The CPU temperature never crossed 80-81C. GPu temperature reached near 80C but this cannot be controlled directly by these softwares, only can change and control CPU values. If lacking a Laptop cooling stand and external fan, I would use these softwares to decrease laptop temperature but otherwise it's not necessary.Laptop monitor lacks color, Recommend installing latest AMD radeon drivers and AMD Adrenalin software. I increased the saturation of my monitor. AMD Adrenalin software also has a vivid setting for global display/graphics. Use that to show more colorful display and in game .The Laptop graphics card has 4GB vram which can affect high texture graphics required for some games. Some games like dirt 5 or forza 5 gives vram low warnings. Still for Dirt 5 graphics is pretty great. For Forza 5 it could use a bit improvement. Forza 4 runs great and has great graphics though. Though at this price point this laptop is good , most 6GB vram laptops are selling  at way higher prices. I would recommend a high 6GB VRAM graphic card rather than a Nvidia 3050 as an improvement over this rx 5500mAlso recommend getting another 8GB RAM as it would add more to gaming and multi tasking experience.  I installed two 16 Gb rams to have total 32GB and everything works great, switches programs on the fly, from gaming to work instantly. Some rare games like God of war and Modern warfare warzone battle royale used more than 16 GB ram, up to 20GB. For most other games 16GB should be more than enough.edit: tried out several games, all action adventure and racing games available for  xbox gaming pass and EA play subscription . Over all the impression is this laptop is good for gaming at 1920 x 1080 resolution with greater than 40 fps minimum at high graphic settings. It can go to ultra graphics for games released before 2020. One issue I found was when gaming long hours, the battery seems to be discharging at a slow but significant rate even when power cable was connected. The issue could be either laptop or my home's power lines. No idea.edit2:Due to modifying my laptop cpu's power settings using third party sw, or due to unlocking and using windows ultimate performance/high performance power plans in windows power options, one of those two reasons, Maybe not these reasons at all, but anyway my cpu and gpu together are consuming more than 150 watts  that the power brick can provide and this is what is causing the battery drainage when I play games for over 5 to 6 hours continuously. So I now limit the cpu power limit to around 78W using ryzen controller sw. Rest of the power from power brick is reserved for graphics card. This resolves the battery draining problem I was having and I am still able to play games at more or less same quality, speed and graphics. Constant draining and recharging would be bad for battery life. This makes it seem like the cpu and gpu of this laptop could have performed greater if it were provided a 200W power brick.
review_title: Overall Good Laptop for both medium-high graphic quality gaming and work/anything else

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 5 5600H Processor 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/4GB Radeon RX5500M Graphics/B&O/Backlit KB/Win 11/MS Office/Xbox Game Pass),16-E0162ax
review: This laptop excels in display and to some extent in multi tasking . It is heavy ,so def not for those who need to carry the laptop every now & den. The laptop certainly has issues with WiFi,which after repeated follow ups,mails ,calls got Wif card replaced for free as it was under warranty.again after few months of purchase the track pad started to misbehave.Raised complaint &again contacting customer support is a pain .finally got resolved ,dunno what I did but did some r&d .That‚Äôs mostly the cons along with battery backup,hardly I‚Äôd say normal use 4-5hrs of browsing,Utube .The best thing I like is the clarity of the panel,as its IPS the picture quality is exceptional.can play 2k videos.games too play well without any lag .finally the display hinge ,it‚Äôs not bad as most of them complain,it wobbles but doesn‚Äôt bother as long as u don‚Äôt keep fidgeting the surface or if you are sitting directly under fan on high speed .no body does .Camera quality is like that of a 2mp cam of the 90s Nokia ph.also no Windows hello feature avail.doesn t support .no finger print too.any how am happy ,I don‚Äôt care about the finger print or hello feat.
review_title: Not a bang for buck ,but pretty decent for gaming ,browsing ,movies

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 5 5600H Processor 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/4GB Radeon RX5500M Graphics/B&O/Backlit KB/Win 11/MS Office/Xbox Game Pass),16-E0162ax
review: Review post approx. 5 months of use:Despite the disappointing state of Indian laptop market since mid-2020s, I'd go ahead and say that if you're looking for a laptop for budget gaming or media creation, at the time of writing this review - this is the best you can do in terms of price to performance ratio. This is currently the best performance laptop you can buy in 50k-85k segment. And that's a huge claim, I know, but the Indian laptop market is that screwed at the moment. There are just no fair offerings in that segment and that segment is supposed to be multiple segments (like 50-60k, 60-70k, 70-80k and so on). Of course I'm leaving out RTX3050 laptops but I don't think they're priced well for what they're offering. The only other laptops that make sense would be 3050Ti ones due to their higher performance and even then, their pricetags are not proportional to the increase in performance when compared to this RX5500M laptop. You pay way more than the performance bump you get.Also, please remember to uninstall bloatware and stick to OEM graphics drivers instead of installing Radeon graphics drivers (because every laptop is different and parent companies know better about what drivers would serve their laptops better- speaking from experience with this very laptop).The Victus has a lot of things going for it. Remember, I bought this was like 48k in a sale so the features it has at that price point are a no-brainer.Pros:- Tiny bezel around the screen makes it feel so slick and modern- Screen size is plenty big and the screen quality is quite pleasant to look at- Backlit keyboard (white light only but that's not something I consider a con since I don't like RGB anyways)- Numpad included in the keyboard- Awesome thermals. It plays games like CSGO and Mudrunner on max settings without having to ramp up the fans so the experience is quiet and pleasant. Although, playing more demanding games like Snowrunner do tend to make it run hot so the fans spool up to higher RPMs (in which case you can just use noise-cancelling headphones to offset that issue).- Best in class CPU and graphics card. I added in another 8GB RAM stick and this thing is now unstoppable!-Soild build quality. I was attacked by a dog so hard that I got knocked back while this laptop was in my bag behind my back and when I fell, the bag was crushed under my weight. Not a scratch.- Minimalist design is very much appreciated. I hate loud, flashy, obnoxious designs from other brands screaming, "LOOK AT MEEE!!!1!1!!" so this subtle, subdued but still upmarket design is great for me.- People complain about this laptop's screen wobbling issue, especially while under a running fan. Sure, it's a thin screen so it's bound to happen but honestly, I don't see it. Yeah, it does wobble if you slap the screen gently but that's rare and also, why would you? I just leave the screen alone and do my thing. Haven't had a problem yet.Cons:- It's very heavy. At 2.5 kg, this thing is a behemoth. But I guess, you can't have everything. I'm okay with this being the only con to that many features at this price point.- Can't think of any other cons. In fact, I haven't had any other issues with it during the last 5 months of my ownership at all whatsoever so... that's great!Honestly, this is a great value for money laptop and I recently recommend it and got at least 3 other people to buy it. Not one of them has had an issue either. This laptop was one of the best strategies adopted by HP of late. I look forward to many years of worry-free gaming and 3D animation with this thing.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) WQHD IPS Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/Blue Backlit/3months Game Pass/Stingray/2.4Kg), 82JU018YIN
review: Got it for exchange in 92k.Pros: It has advanced optimusCons: Ram is slow with type 1Rx16. It should be 2Rx8 type.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) WQHD IPS Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/Blue Backlit/3months Game Pass/Stingray/2.4Kg), 82JU018YIN
review: Long Review alert:I got this just before the Great Indian sale at practically the sale price. This review is based on usage of almost 20 days. That's more than enough time to cover all the testing that is needed to check whether the product is up to mark or not.I got the WQHD + 1TB SSD model although in the product description it was mentioned as FHD only.Pros:The QHD screen is really great specially while gaming and watching HD videos. Specially if you use it at its full capacity.The Processor/GPU. Lets say no more. It does exactly what it should. The boot time is around 3s so its fast.The keyboard is really good. It feels great to type with the keyboard.All high end games run smoothly without any issues. I tried GTA5 highest settings, PES 19 highest settings, Far Cry 5 highest settings, and it handles them quite great. 130W GPU is a beast in this range.Most people complain about fan noise but my unit runs quite during normal work. And it stays relatively cool.Cons:Battery backup is decent for a gaming laptop. I havent drained it 100% to check the total time but It would last around 4 hrs if you use it efficiently. I usually run it at 60hz refresh rate while using it on power. - Additionally if you limit it to 1080p instead of 1440p battery backup will improve.While playing games at the highest settings in Performance mode, the CPU temps goes above 95 degrees. While playing PES it got to 100 degrees. So I usually play those games in balanced mode with the back raised to allow airflow. Temps stay around 85 degrees.The trackpad sometimes becomes irresponsive. And apparently it is an issue that exists for all legion models. So better to use a mouse.Screen brightness can be an issue for people using it outdoors.1TB can be a problem for people who plays a lot of heavy games like GTA 5. 4-5 such games will take up almost 40% of your storage.Portability is a issue. I hardly take it outside. The power brick is huge lol.Opinion:It definitely lives up to its name specially given the sale pricesIf you are a casual gamer who likes gaming a lot, go for it blindly.If you are looking for mid range laptop that offers great performance for any task, go for it.If you are a student/employee who likes to code/program on the go, you might want to look at the G15/G14 as those are better for carrying around.Before buying this I was in a dilemma whether to buy it or not, or whether to buy this or the Zephyrus G15. Luckily my choice was made easier by the price drop as the g15 2021 is still price around 1.35 l. So if your budget is higher go for 2022 models or the Pro version or g15/g14. But at this range the difference is not that big apart from the form factor ofcourse.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) WQHD IPS Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/Blue Backlit/3months Game Pass/Stingray/2.4Kg), 82JU018YIN
review: Bought at :1,19,990Pros: 1440p display, 130Watt 3060 GPU ,Ryzen 7 5800H 45Watt (Enough to run most of the AAA titles at +60Hz),MUX Switch ,Quick Thermal mode shortcuts built into the Firmware ,165Hz screen enough for eSports gaming, 3 months of XBOX gamepass, Office home and student 2021, Every major ports included for external device, Sturdy and reliable stealthy built, Rapid Charge , Full Size arrow keys, Free sync and G sync support, 3 external displays can be connected, GPU/VRAM Overclocking through BIOS, All ways On USB port for charging external devices.Cons: Heavy built 2.5 kg, Stilly feels buggy due to Win11, Fans goes Vroom with just a little load, Battery is mehhh, Hefty 300W Power brick is pain the arse, Speakers are not that good,Legion claims a Dolby vision display but only Stream HDR is Supported,no Use HDR supported and the Display is 8-bit SDR configuration,720p Camera.Conclusion: Buy it you won't regret as most the major tech Youtubers consider this the best gaming laptop for 2021. Worth the price.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) WQHD IPS Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/Blue Backlit/3months Game Pass/Stingray/2.4Kg), 82JU018YIN
review: PROS:1. I would like to say that this is a perfect machine for all kinds of works especially gaming with 3060 6gb graphic card2. Build quality top notch, premium quality.3. Screen quality is good . Dont compare to QHD Legion Pro because everything comes with a price so if you want QHD then you have to pay 10,000 more4. Heating management is awesome with 3 modes of adjusting the fan rotation.5. Performance of this laptop is butter smooth with all kind of heavy softwares.CONS:1. Battery life is not as expected, my battery drains very fast2. Price is abit high but as said everything comes with a price3. Laptop and charging brick is too heavy4. Buying this laptop from here, you get only with 6 months warranty and not 1 year. Disappointed, I tried contacting Lenovo services 2 weeks to report about this issues but in vain.CONCLUSION:Considering all of this, I want to say that this is a great laptop (S Tier Laptop as reviewed by Dave2D).So, if you want to buy just go for it or wait till you get an  intel 12th gen laptop with good thermal performance as intel 12 gen chips are the fastest compare to Ryzen 2021.
review_title: WARRANTY OF THIS PRODUCT IS ONLY FOR 6 MONTHS OR LESS AND NOT 1 YEAR

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Gray/2.2 kg), FX577ZE-HN056W
review: The laptop is really good for the price and does offer the performance when needed. Thermal performance is also good. The only issue I had was the screen...could have been better for the price we are paying. Speakers are really good... didn't expect them to be this clear and have bass at all. The intel core i7 12700H performs like a beast... definately a major jump from the 11th gen for sure..and the RTX 3050 ti is perfect for some casual gaming and graphic intensive workloads....the 4GB VRAM may seem less for hardcore gamers and professional graphic designers...they should go for the RTX 3060 variant.Overall this laptop is great...build quality is amazing, performance is good for the price, keyboard is also good and durable, and the trackpad has a really big surface area.My only complaint is the screen, it could have been better but considering everything else...it's better than all the laptops competing in this segment and comes in a good package as well.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Gray/2.2 kg), FX577ZE-HN056W
review: Performs amazing. Comes with great specs under the price point. Smooth gaming experience even on ultra settings. Also great for creators as it also has great rendering speeds. Only a con is fans go loud while gaming and rendering, else it gives a great experience overall.

review: I love the laptop for its processing and the design. When I play games with ultra settings the cpu temp raises to above 85¬∞c consistently in turbo mode. When I do cpu instensive tasks like rendering videos in blender it goes to 95¬∞c. I am not sure if it's my product defect or not. The battery backup is very less. Build is excellent. 512 gb ROM seems way too less for me. My main concern is the cpu temperature during intensive work.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Gray/2.2 kg), FX577ZE-HN056W
review: So I bought this laptop for 1Lakh during the Great Indian Festival sales. I also ordered a gen4 ssd by WD in order to run linux. My main purpose wasn't gaming. Bought this solely for development works.I added secondary ssd. Opening the back shell wasn't that hard. One thing to notice is that the screw of ssd is very tight. So if your try to spin it without applying down force will endup in stripped screws. So keep that in mind. I installed Fedora 36. Faced some issues with Nvidia drivers. I would suggest to follow (https://asus-linux.org/wiki/fedora-guide/) if you are planning to install Fedora.I wanted to just try some games on this machine. So I tried pubg & hotpursuit. played PUBG in medium settings. When the heat rises, we can feel a framedrop. Avg temp was 89¬∞C while playing games. When I tried in an AC enviorment, things where smooth. So I would suggest to invest in a cooling pad if you are into gaming.Apart from that, If you have oily hands, the laptop get dirty easily. The audio quality is fine. Anyway I was using headset. You need to login for the first time in asus to get this device registered automatically into your acccount to get 1 year warranty (Dont know if there is any other way).So its too early to give a proper review. So I will update the review later.

Name: LG Gram16 Intel EVO-[12th Gen Core i7/Win11/16GB/512GB SSD Intel Iris Xe Graphics] [Thunderbolt4/USB-C] [FHD Webcam+Built-in AI] 80WH Battery 3Yrs Warranty(Black,1.14 Kg)
review: Pros1. LPDDR5 RAM. Great on paper. Doesn't display the potential because of throttling.2. Good to have thunderbolt 4. Future proof. Have connected camera, microphone, keyboard, mouse, monitor and soundbar. all works at once through a single type c port hub. Loving it. A great upgrade from my non thunderbolt laptop.3. Type c charging is great. If I forget my laptop charger at home, I can charge it with my 65w mobile warp charger. Handy.4. Wifi 6e. Future proof. Works great with my 5ghz router. Desperate to upgrade the router to have a taste of it. For future.5. Very light. Bought a hp wings backpack specially for this laptop which is just 150g. So 1199+150. 1350g approx. I leave my charger at home. The battery lasts the whole day with a weight of just 1350g. Majja ni life.Cons1. Gets hot while doing nothing. You can feel the heat on the keyboard.2. Charger is too heavy for a light weight laptop.3. Wrong information. No 6 month office 365 included. It asks for purchase. Customer care, no help yet.4. Screen is not HDR. I didn't check before purchasing, considering it as an obvious feature for the price.5. Lots of bloatware, i.e. Spotify and others6. Camera is said as 1080p. My USB 1080p external camera is way better than the inbuilt one. Don't know why so much difference. bad camera.7. Speeds up for the benchmark testing, starts heating and slows down (throttle) in less than 10 seconds. Cannot use i7 processor to its full potential because of throttling. Should have better cooling system.8. Keyboard, useless. As I gear up for touch typing screen starts shaking.9. Touchpad. Too big. Disturbs while typing.Update: Amazon and lg both denied providing 6 month subscription of the office 365. Amazon asked to check what is section what is included in the box not to check the description. Lg asked me to connect Amazon. So no such subscription.
review_title: Good product but had higher expectations for the price

Name: LG Gram16 Intel EVO-[12th Gen Core i7/Win11/16GB/512GB SSD Intel Iris Xe Graphics] [Thunderbolt4/USB-C] [FHD Webcam+Built-in AI] 80WH Battery 3Yrs Warranty(Black,1.14 Kg)
review: It still amazes me how light it is whenever I pick it up. It looks greatThis laptop had no battery out of the box so need to plugin before setup. It is an amazing laptop with a great display.It does heat up so recommend to run it in efficiency mode till you absolutely need more power.Miramatrix features are great but enable them only if necessary.Lg smart assistant is good you can use it to prevent battery charging over 80% to prolong battery life, lock the fn key for the top row and also control fan speed.The keyboard is fine. the trackpad response out of the box was not that good for me so had to configure it in the windows setting now it works fine.The battery life is good and can get up to 9 hrs if you are just browsing. However, if you are working have multiple tabs open and 2-3 programmes running it can give you around five hours of backup at 50% screen brightness.Does not have a fingerprint sensor so used face id for windows hello.The speakers are fine don't expect a very high-end experience.After using it for some time it is a very light and capable general-use laptop which will handle most of the tasks that you can throw at it.Not recommended for specific use cases like Gaming or extensive photo and video editing. think of this as a 16-inch ultrabook.
review_title: Think of it as an 16 inch ultrabook

review: This is very portable laptop and too good for programmer who works in hybrid work culture and often travel to office and pack it along with the office laptop. Screen aspect ratio is good enough to code and battery lasts more than 7 hours for causal programming.

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: Appearance :The laptop looks sexy af..but that been said it's a fingerprint magnet any part of the laptop you touch can be traced back. So keep a microfiber with you all time ig.Screen:It's a good 144hz panel not too shabby but it does the job.Its not a 100% sRGB screen so keep that in mind for editors.Performance:It has the 12th gen i5 which is way better than the old i5 gen so that itself is a good performance boost for anything, along with 16gb out of the box it's a good performer for any task.Gaming wise it has the 75w RTX 3050..which can be overclocked to for a boosted 90w tgp .But i don't think that's needed and personally when I tried with the overclock it had game crash issues.Even without the boost the performance was good.Rtx features are working decent but sometimes due to the 4gb card you might not get the most out of rtx. Tested with the new plague and rtx it was looking amazing running smooth ..got some crashed in high dense areas and had to lower rtx settings.Competitive Games will ran pretty good more than refresh rate of the screen with the good CPU GPU pair and fats ram . So no hiccups there.Ports:Bonus point for a thunderbolt c port..with fast 135watt charging . The biggest down side is there is only two USB A ports .Overall:It's a good laptop at the price segment the build is amazing quality and looks great.With good performance all across . If you are looking for RTX 3050 option this is definitely the Top G.PS. There is no RGB but the white lighting  looks amazing with the matte theme .

Name: MSI Crosshair 15, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 40CM QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/NVIDIA RTX 3070 8GB GDDR6/Black/2.47Kg), 12UGZ-1012IN
review: Product Name: MSI Crosshair 15 B12UGZ [1,24,990‚Çπ]Sold by: Appario Retail Private LtdOrdered on: 14 March 2023Delivered on: 16 March 2023Specifications:‚ó¶intel i7 12700h ‚úì‚ó¶Nvidia RTX 3070 8GB ‚úì‚ó¶16GB DDR4 3200MHz RAM, upgradable to 64GB ‚úì‚ó¶1TB NVMe M.2 PCIe 4.0 SSD ‚úìThe GOOD:‚Ä£System boots up in 3-5 sec. Its smooth & fast (you might face few windows 11 bugs here & there but, it's not the laptop's fault.)‚Ä£Tested 'Shadow of the Tomb Raider' & 'Persona 5 Royal' at high graphic settings. No stutters, smooth performance and consistent frame rate. [IMO as far as gaming goes 1080p/1440p @60FPS for the next 7 years guaranteed]‚Ä£Copied 250GB in under 10 minutes from my Samsung T5 SSD [Didn't time it exactly]. Copy speed was about 450-460 MB/s.‚Ä£Only Wifi 6 (No 6e/7) which is fine by me. My steam/epic games store average download speed was around 8-10MP/s. [lowest 5MB/s, highest 11MB/s @ JioFibreNet]. Streamed 1440p Youtube videos with no problems/buffering.THE MEH:‚Ä£Build quality is OK [nothing great about it at this price point], the screen wobbles sometimes and especially when is under a fan.‚Ä£Keyboard is fine, nothing really to rave about & then there's RGB but never really cared about it.‚Ä£Hi-Res audio is supported so, if you have Hi-Res IEM/Headphones then use them. Listened to 16/24bit FLAC audio songs using my FiiO Hi-Res IEM with no problems.‚Ä£With peak brightness and 165hz display mode and performance settings the battery can it 4hrs at best. Can be extended to 7hrs with proper device optimizations (switching to 60Hz, power saving performance profile etc)‚Ä£Thermals are fine as of now. This is a compact laptop and is good for 2-4Hr session of gaming (highly depends on the game/ graphical settings used) for longevity of the hardware. Definitely could've had better cooling systems in place.THE UGLY:‚Ä£Speakers are bad period [low volume levels & lacks clarity].‚Ä£Lacks proper system monitoring/Diagnostics/Gaming software support from MSI. Dragon center MSI center pro are currently having compatibility issues. [hope this gets fixed soon as this is relatively new model in the market]. All the other competitors are doing good to great in this aspect.‚Ä£Display color calibration is off. Colors looks warmer. [I hope that this can be fixed by properly tweaking the settings, again requires software support from MSI]‚Ä£ LED backlight screen bleed issue that causes color inaccuracyNOTE: This laptop uses an industry grade 15/16A power supply cord instead of domestic 5A/6A power supply cord. You need to buy an additional 16A to 6A power supply converter socket.This is my review of this laptop from the experience of the past 2-4 days. Will update it future if the review is actually helpful to others.My suggestion:Buy it only if you want it for GAMING, COLLGE/WORK related stuff.
review_title: Made for the Gamer. Ideal for Games/Office/School work.

Name: MSI Crosshair 15, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 40CM QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/NVIDIA RTX 3070 8GB GDDR6/Black/2.47Kg), 12UGZ-1012IN
review: This gaming laptop contains impressive specifications, including an Intel i7 12th gen processor with 14 cores and 20 threads, an RTX 3070 graphics card with 8GB of VRAM, and a 90Whr battery. The QHD display with a 165Hz refresh rate, combined with the powerful hardware, can easily handle most of the AAA games with 100+ fps.Despite being a gaming laptop, it offers decent battery life when using battery saver mode and the super battery feature in MSI Center. I was able to get around 5-6 hours of screen time while browsing and streaming online content, which is impressive for a device of this caliber. Booting the laptop takes only 3-5 seconds, thanks to the speedy NVMe M.2 PCIe 4.0 SSD.The display is excellent with bright colors, and it can handle 4K HDR videos effortlessly. With a refresh rate of 165Hz, browsing feels incredibly smooth. The speakers are clear and loud, and the backlit keyboard with three brightness levels adds to the overall experience.However, the build quality is not exceptional, but it is acceptable for the price range. Additionally, the webcam resolution is limited to 720p, which may not be sufficient for some users. One significant drawback is that the laptop tends to get warm during extended gaming sessions, and the heat is noticeable through the keyboard. However, turning on the dual fan mode and adding a cooling pad can help dissipate the heat quickly.It is worth noting that this gaming laptop is an excellent value for money option as it is one of the only devices with an RTX 3070 graphics card available under 1.25L. This powerful machine can easily handle any game for the next five years without compromising the performance.To use this laptop optimally, you will require a 16Amps socket, and adding a cooling pad is recommended to keep it cool during extended gaming sessions. Overall, this gaming laptop is an excellent option for gamers who want a powerful machine without breaking the bank.

Name: MSI Crosshair 15, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 40CM QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/NVIDIA RTX 3070 8GB GDDR6/Black/2.47Kg), 12UGZ-1012IN
review: It's a gaming laptop that can provide full 140w on its RTX3070! Outstanding cooling- dual 6000 RPM fans with six gigantic heat pipes.It comes with 2x 8GB DDR4 3200MHz sticks and 1TB Crucial SSD. Excellent screen quality (I have the QHD 165Hz panel)!I have minor issues with the user experience. The first one is with the power indicator LED, it is difficult to understand whether the laptop is in sleep or turned off.  The second one is with the keyboard backlight, which doesn't have a timeout (like Acer nitro/predator has).Note: I had to upgrade the RAM on it so I opened the laptop and took a few shots of its internals.

Name: Lenovo Ideapad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA RTX 3050/120Hz/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg), 82K201ULIN
review: Its the cheapest laptop in the RTX 3050 segment.If your budget is around 65k-75k, then look 5 things in a laptop1) ryzen 5600h(best) or i5 11th gen or ryzen 4800h2)Rtx 3050 4gb(best) or GTX 1650 4Gb3)90hz or 120hz or 144hz screen( best)4)8gb ram or 16gb ram (best,if dual channel)5)TGP of RTX 3050 , 50watt , 75w , 85w , 90w (best)Well according to me this laptop is awesome bcz of ryzen 5 5600H ,which is better than all i5 11th gen laptops in amazon. Also ryzens igpu are faster than intel intel igpu.This laptop has simple look , with no rgb keyboard which cuts theuseless hefty cost of laptops .Build quality is better than Asus tuff as said by my friend.Pros1)ryzen 5600h instead of i5 11th gen2) privacy shutter on webcam3) RTX is love .I underestimated rtx 3050 cz it only has 4gb vram . but i was wrong . games work silky smooth 80+ fps in all games tested by me so far on high /medium settings .Sekiro, pubg pc , bgmi emulator, SGW contracts , valorant(144 fps, can give more if changed settings in valorant for dont lock fps)PuBG PC performance test by meHigh settings outdoor 75-85fpsHigh indoor 80-90fpsUltra outdoor -60-70fps  indorr 65-75fpsMediumOutdoor 65-75 fps indoor 75-85 fpsLow Outdoor 75-85  Indoor 90-100Ver low outdoor -80-90 fps  Indoor -85-95fpsThese are slightly lower fps than asus tufff like 5-10 fps bcz of single channel ram against dual channel.4) its ssd is of better quality(samsung) than most other laptops. 8-10 seconds boot time .Cons1)Battery is not long lasting which is ok for me as a gaming laptop2) The fan exhaust cages(under the laptop) has steel plates which on touching will give shock when laptop is plugged in .So never hold the laptop at the down part while plugged in .3) 16 GB single channel RAM .which is biggest con can drop fps like 5-10fps in some games against dual channel4)Heats . the keypad keys also heats a bit sometimes .if u accidently slip your finger from Esc key , your hand will burn on fire touching the laptop.Well heating is a long time issue for gaming laptops5) simple design6) low system speakeracer ndFinal say -1) if u r an Ryzen lover and budget 65k-75k buy this laptop2) if u r an intel processor lover and budget 65k-75k go for dell,Hp, asus,acer with i5 11th genTho HP and Dell are known for exceptionally long lasting laptops.Tip- If possible buy 8 GB ram variant and then add 8 gb more at a shop nearby it will cost u cheaper than this . cz dual channel ram will boost ur fps(5-10fps) in some games .

review: I have used this product for almost one month now, so this are the things that I observed:1. Screen quality is good, not excellent I would say. Brightness is low, upto 250 nits max, so user can face problems in bright conditions.2. This is the only 3050 laptop with 5600H paired and 16gb ram, in this price range, so price to performance ratio is good, should have been 2-3k less (great if you get it around 65k -70k range)3. Cooling is good till now,not great, temps may go higher in heavy AAA titles, so would recommend using cooling pad for heavy gamers.4. I have livestreamed GTA V for 1-2 hours per day for a week, no issues found till now. But I recommend to use cooling pad for some temp drops.5. Minor lags are there some times in games(maybe it is due to some game settings, idk what is it exactly), but it's not a big issue.Overall a great budget 3050 laptop with great other specs paired, in this price segment.

review: Doing review after one month. I just like the laptop at this price and its worth to buy. it is capable of running all games as far as graphics capabilities and depend on windows support. Armory crate makes it better in performance point.If you have budget then go for it.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 7 4800H, 4GB NVIDIA¬†GeForce¬†RTX¬†3050, Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.3 Kg), FA506ICB-HN005W
review: I Recieved this asus tuf a15 ( ryzen 7 4800h and rtx 3050, 8gb ram ) on 22nd September and started checking if everything is ok.After testing (Running Benchmark, checking cpu and gpu work load and fps during gaming, Screen test, speaker test, etc)  for 4 days continuously, Everything Seems to be working alright but i faced one problem.Problem was sometimes cpu doesn't seem to be working 100% means Even in heavy load cpu usage and its clock speed was very low. Cpu usage was around 50% and even cpu was drawing less power. I Think its because of software as to control thermals but even in cool environment (23¬∞C)  I faced this issue.Due to less cpu usage and low clock speed, i was getting low benchmark.So, I concluded that may be 8gb ram is becoming bottleneck for my laptop.Then, Today on 1 oct , 2022, I upgraded my laptop ram to 16 gb ( G skill 3200mhz ddr4 8gb ram) and now i am facing this problem more.CPU Usage and Cpu power draw reduced more to only 13 watts during gaming ( Valorant ) and Fps count become ( 98 average).During gaming for 30 min, Tdp was set to 13 watts and not increasing a bit and my cpu temperature was locked at 61¬∞C.After All this,My Conclusion - I think Asus Laptop bios have underclocked Cpu to control the thermals and there is no way to change it normally.Edit - After Many Days and Testing, I saw that this low cpu usage problem only happens sometimes when i plug in charger and when i unplug and plug the charger again in laptop, this low cpu usage issue solves automatically.
review_title: LOW CPU USAGE, LOW CPU POWER DRAW ISSUE

review: I purchased this laptop on 29 Sept, 2022 and writing this review after 3 months.This laptop is beast at the price i purchased (68,000). It offer a 8 core processor and rtx 3050 graphics.  It can easily run any software be it autocad, or Adobe premiere pro. It also boots up very quickly 10s due to its ssd. It has gen 3 m2 ssd which offers transfer speed upto 2500mbps. The version i purchased came up with free mc afee anti virus for one year For gaming, it easily runs any game however you must upgrade additional 8gb ram to make it 16gb then it will unlock its true performance. While gaming max temp that reaches in summers is 92¬∞ C.Build Quality of this laptop is also very nice . I personally like the chasis design a lot. The heat exhaust vents works perfectly fine and cools the laptop.If you are getting it at a price less than 72k then you should definitely go for it.

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) Processor (16 GB/512 GB SSD/Win11 Home/4GB Graphics/RTX 2050) A515-57G (15.6" FHD Display, 1.8 Kg)
review: its been almost 20 days since i bought this laptop, i haven't usually get any problem except the touch pad stops working for a minute or two sometimes in between, it's really frustrating. Battery wise, it's good, it lasts a longer time. sound is a bit too low. otherwise it's a good one. but wouldn't recommended.

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) Processor (16 GB/512 GB SSD/Win11 Home/4GB Graphics/RTX 2050) A515-57G (15.6" FHD Display, 1.8 Kg)
review: I am a linux guy, so after I brought this laptop (16gb) spending 53k on festive season, simply installed Debian on new partition. Found that, hardware is so new that the os can't find it.If you are an average user and willing to use linux you can try linux mint which works perfectly including its graphics card. No issue at all.I knew that the battery backup will not be much more so I am not going to complain here - getting approx 3 hours plus by browsing and coding (not compiling)Good: speed: performance is super. very fast and responsive.Problem 1: keyboard color: on daylight if you don't look the keyboard vertically which you wont - will not be able to read letters written in keys. - very bad. I have enabled keyboard light always on from bios. typing is not so good or bad.Problem 2: touchpad: in windows and linux both - touchpad lags for couple of seconds very now and then. Trust me - this is not a user created issue. It might be the touchpad hardware issue (not Acer's fault) or software (firmware / kernel) issue presents in Windows and Linux both. Its been more than a year now (talking about touchpad hardware, not the laptop).Problem 3: screen bleed: very little screen bleed in the screen. I can live with that.Tips: In bios if you cant see any option to change touchapd driver, for example ps/2 or advance mode - press "ctrl + s" and few new options will be available for that session.

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) Processor (16 GB/512 GB SSD/Win11 Home/4GB Graphics/RTX 2050) A515-57G (15.6" FHD Display, 1.8 Kg)
review: The Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop is a beast! The 12th gen Intel Core i5 processor with 12 cores and 16 GB of RAM makes for a lightning-fast machine. The 512 GB SSD ensures that everything loads quickly and smoothly.The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2050 graphics card is impressive and really enhances the gaming experience. I can play all of my favorite games at high settings without any lag or stuttering.The design of the laptop is sleek and modern, with a backlit keyboard that makes typing in the dark a breeze. The Windows 11 operating system is a nice touch, with a user-friendly interface that's easy to navigate.Overall, I'm extremely happy with my purchase of the Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop. It's a powerhouse that can handle anything I throw at it, and the graphics are stunning. Highly recommend it to any gamers out there!

Name: Acer Aspire 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5 12th gen (12-Cores) Processor (16 GB/512 GB SSD/Win11 Home/4GB Graphics/RTX 2050) A515-57G (15.6" FHD Display, 1.8 Kg)
review: This acer laptop gives good performance without any doubt. For light works, this much weighing laptop is not necessary. This much performance is also not necessary. Go for 14" ones. I expect acer to manufacture this same laptop with 13-14" screen to get good battery backup. 15.6" laptops drain so much battery for no reason. Also, Windows has become battery hungry.Ratings:Battery = 3/5Screen = 3/5Processor = 4/5Ready from Boot = 4/5Sound = 2/5Weight = 3/5Pros:1. Good processor i5-1240p2. Thunderbolt port3. Typing is good. Got Number pad too.4. Fast charging5. Sound Quality is good6. Brightness is good7. No fan sound. It is quiet, surprisingly (for me .!!)5. Received a sealed piece (thanks to amazon)Cons:1. Low sound output. You should put the laptop on a table or pad to get reasonable sound output.2. Low battery backup for heavy works, just 2-3 hrs or even less. Android Studio works just for 2 hrs only. You can get away with 5hrs with light works for sure.3. Display Contrast is not good.4. Key colors are really bad. It is very difficult to spot keys suddenly. If you don't know typing, it wastes lot of time. Black color is the preferred one. I want to see the engineer who designed it :(

Name: ASUS ROG Strix Scar 17 SE (2022), 17.3" (43.94 cm) WQHD 240Hz/3ms, Intel Core¬†i9-12950HX 12th Gen, 16GB RTX 3080 Ti, Gaming Laptop (32GB/2TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Stealth/3 Kg), G733CX-LL013WS
review: Within the first 30 minutes of use I noticed that the laptop would spike up to 95C every now and then for no reason, even when sitting idle or the lightest of works like opening excel etc. And when I ran a benchmark such as Cinebench R23, the overheating became apparent - a few cores spike up to 95+ C (couple of E cores hit 99C, at the same time many of the P cores were like 72C, refer attached pic) and this caused overheating, thus slowing down performance to prevent damage.The overheating was so much that this 3.6 lakh laptop is performing slower than even a sub 1.5 lakh legion which has an inferior i7 12700H cpu (18625 points on 14 core i7) with 2 less cores than this i9 12950hx (16990 points on this 16 core i9, refer pic attached) and Legion has normal thermal paste, without any fancy Vapor Chamber.If there is such a big variation in temperatures between the cores, it indicates liquid metal is not applied properly. Doesn't matter if Asus throw everything on paper like liquid metal 'extreme', Vapor Chamber - if you don't apply liquid metal properly, or Vapor Chamber doesn't make good contact with cpu, there's no use. Quality Control is really bad with Asus. Same thing happened with my friend too who bought a Scar 15 2022. Returned it rightfully to where it belongs, but it took way too much time for refund due to delays from Amazon.
review_title: Overheating despite hefty price tag, i9 performing slower than 12th gen i7!

Name: HP Victus Gaming Laptop 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop(16GB RAM/512GB SSD/NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 graphics/144Hz/Backlit KB/Wi11/MSO/B&O/Alexa),16-d0311TX
review: HP has done it yet again. This is my second HP laptop and i can safely say that my next one will be an HP too. I bought it from the OMEN Playground store in Nehru place and as soon as i got my hands on it, i went on to download Warzone 2.0. Right off the bat the performance on this device is mind blowing. I was getting a constant FPS of 90 frames and the gameplay was buttery smooth. This laptop is ideal for college going students who want to game or even work on their laptops.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Laptop 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop(16GB RAM/512GB SSD/NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 graphics/144Hz/Backlit KB/Wi11/MSO/B&O/Alexa),16-d0311TX
review: Oh my goodness, where do I even begin with my review of the HP Victus Gaming Laptop? This product has completely changed my life! I never knew that a laptop could make such a huge difference in my daily routine, but the 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H processor combined with the 16.1 inch (40.9 cm) FHD IPS display has truly blown me away.Let me start by talking about the design. The HP Victus Gaming Laptop is sleek and modern, with a stunning color scheme that is sure to turn heads. The keyboard is comfortable and responsive, and the touchpad is smooth and easy to use. The build quality is top-notch, with a sturdy frame that feels like it can withstand anything.But let's get to the real meat of this product: the performance. Oh my goodness, the performance! The 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H processor is lightning fast, and I've never experienced such smooth and seamless multitasking on a laptop before. Whether I'm streaming a movie, editing photos, or running multiple programs at once, the HP Victus Gaming Laptop handles it all with ease.And let's not forget about the 16.1 inch (40.9 cm) FHD IPS display. The colors are vibrant and true-to-life, and the images are crisp and clear. I've never seen such a stunning display on a laptop before, and it makes every activity from gaming to streaming to work feel like a whole new experience.Overall, I can't recommend the HP Victus Gaming Laptop enough. This product has truly changed my life, and I am absolutely in love with it.If you're in the market for a new laptop, look no further than the HP Victus Gaming Laptop. Trust me, you won't regret it!

A simple game of vice city that also hangs in this laptopAudio for this laptop is very less as compared to my old laptop (hp pavilion).Design is classy but eventually you have to use it and it will give you pains as you have spend so much on this laptop.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop (8GB/1TB+256GB SSD/Win 11/NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg), 82K201UGIN
review: I played watch dogs 2 with high settings @75-90fps (with temporal filtering on), without it 50-61fps @ high. Ultra 28-42fps without temporal filtering onbattlefield 1 @ultra 70-90 fpsForza Horizon 4 @ custom (high-ultra) 78-120state of mind @epic 61 fpsI think these results are decent as it is not a high end GPU.Pros:*The GPU  temperature never reached more than 66¬∞C Even after 2hrs of gaming . So Thermals are Osm. CPU reached nearly 80¬∞C when stress testing but during gaming around 72-75¬∞C. *During working hours the laptop remains silent you won't notice any sound if set to quiet mode. (#peace :) )*What I love about lenovo is their keyboard if ur into coding or some kind of typing stuff u'll be very much satisfied.*Speakers of laptop is loud enough and audio software Nahimic is cooler than Hp's B&O, it tunes audio depends on ur use which is a cool feature.*The Laptop has 135Watt Charger which can bring smile on Overclockers face as it can squeeze extra juice in games and Video-editing. CPU {45Watt}+GPU{50Watt} which makes use of overall usage of 120  watts(rough estimation) including motherboard other components like speakers, display, etc. 15watt which is left can used to squeeze for extra performance of CPU  and  GPU (most Manufactures restricts chargers to 90Watt or 120 watt)*Lenovo vantage provides conservative mode which increases battery lifespan. most laptops OEM don't provide this feature.Cons:*The laptop doesn't have an option to set its refresh rate to 60Hz in settings by default it runs at 120HZ which can be an issue with battery drain as it has low capacity battery. I think it will be fixed with BIOS Update in future.*They could have done better with Battery instead of 45WHr.*Could have Given an extra usb port (as 2 usb port restricts ur workspace to limited options)*From gaming point of view they could have given mux switch which boosts fps (iGPU bottlenecks DGPU) .*Sweaty-wet hands can make laptop dirty with marks, its with build quality. But not a big problem u can avoid it by cleaning time to time.I had an issue while watching movies or youtube as the battery is draining to quickly but I got it fixed by switching to iGPU for VLC and Browsers . it saved alot of battery."""Best about the laptop:One of the main advantage of this laptop out of  all other laptops is that the laptop charger-socket has an unique rectangle pin which helps in longetivity of female of socket. Believe me I used round pin  laptop charger and they are the worst. After, an year of use female socket will be loosened {"""as it gets loosened it doesn't connect to pin properly which creates a power barrier between laptop and charger. By not getting enough power required and the power barrier directly results in performance_drop by running CPU and GPU at lower clock speeds """} and u need to get a replacement for it, which costs around 2K-3k and u should have to open the laptop which can be a riskier job as its not same as adding ram. which is an absolute terrible experience u can have and also "You cannot claim warranty for female socket as it gets counted for improper usage."_""""""BE CAREFUL: IF YOUR UPGRADING RAM DISCONNECT BATTERY OR JUST DRAIN BATTERY COMPLETELY (IF ITS HARD TO DISCONNECT) OR U WILL BE HAVING EVEN AN OPTION IN BIOS TO TURN OFF BATTERY. THEN ONLY INSERT RAM OR SSD OR HDD. EVEN A SMALL SCREW FALL CAN FRY YOUR MOTHERBOARD. AND ALSO DISCONNECT POWER CORD TOO. JUST DON'T IGNORE THIS"""Overall laptop is decent for working and mid level gaming.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop (8GB/1TB+256GB SSD/Win 11/NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg), 82K201UGIN
review: Laptop performance is good but its quite heavy in size (2.2Kg) which is expected. Screen resolution is good. Audio quality is ok but not great. Major concern is with Battery backup, full charged backup will not last for more than 3 Hrs. Recharge (100%) will complete in less than 3 Hrs. Memory SD Card reader not available in this model. USB type-A (2nos), Type-C(1 no) and 1HDMI port available.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop (8GB/1TB+256GB SSD/Win 11/NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg), 82K201UGIN
review: I purchased this model (R5-5600H) for 59k, and to be honest, do not go for this if it is more than 60k. At that rate, the RTX 3050 is superior in every way, and you can leverage RT and DLSS.Now coming to the packaging, it included a 135W charging brick (which was surprisingly compact) and the laptop itself. Nothing else, no case or accessories, but that is to be expected from a budget laptop.Build Quality: The Shadow Black model is made of premium feeling plastic. The hinge seems to be extremely stable, but it is almost impossible to open the lid with one hand, which in my opinion isn't a big deal. Overall, a good package for the price. This wouldn't feel out of place in a professional setting unlike other gaming laptops.Screen: Yes, its only 250 nits and covers only 45% of NTSC, but I did not notice it personally. The brightness at 100% was sufficient for use during the day(indoors), and the screen was usable up to 20% brightness. Colors are vibrant and media consumption is a breeze on this screen.Battery Life: This is one of the few weak points of this laptop, With a measly 46Wh battery, I did not expect it to perform as good as say, the Asus Zephyrus series, but on a whole, battery life was quite disappointing to say the least, but typical for a gaming machine. It lasted for around 5 hours at 50% brightness and with Bluetooth and the backlight switched off, all while performing day to day tasks such as word processing, coding on Python, and watching YouTube. DO NOT game on battery power, as that will severely damage the cells.Performance: The 5600H is an excellent CPU for the money, and with SMT it is able to breeze through most of my requirements, but the same cannot be said of the GTX 1650. Although it is able to reach the refresh rate of the monitor on most eSports titles, it struggles to play through more demanding AAA games such as Cyberpunk 2077, where i was only getting 30fps on Medium settings. Meanwhile, I got 45fps at Medium settings in Control, and 120fps in Crysis. Minecraft, Super Meat Boy, Terraria, Tomb Raider(2013), were all able to max out the refresh rate of the screen at their highest settings. I would strongly advise to upgrade the memory to a dual channel configuration as that would significantly improve the performance. Regarding thermals, the CPU did get quite hot while gaming(90C), but the heat was swiftly dissipated by the excellent cooling system. The GPU never throttled and always stayed under 75C.Keyboard and Touchpad: Lenovo is known for their tactile keyboards, and this one is no exception. Has great travel distance and keystrokes feel snappy. The backlight comes in 2 levels, but I did not notice any difference in brightness between them (perhaps a defect). The touchpad was serviceable for daily tasks, but not for gaming.Verdict: On a whole, the new Lenovo Ideapad Gaming 3 is an attractive options for gamers on a budget, with a sleek and professional design, great thermals and acceptable performance for the price. The keyboard is a stand-out in this price range, while the battery life is disappointing and below average in this class of laptops.
review_title: Decent budget gaming machine with an elegant design.
