review: The Display is above average and better than what others are saying (actually I had compared the display with an IPS Panel HP Laptop and I found the WVA Panel of this laptop more vivid and bright). Just upgrade the RAM to 16GB RAM and it will improve performance drastically, Looks stunning (better than any other boring gaming laptop). Also, the G button is amazing. If you are facing any issues then feel free to ask me. I would also recommend using Cooling Pad as summer is coming.I will update my review after one month of heavy usage.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 12650H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Rs Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
review: I was searching for a laptop which would serve me for long time. My last laptop was HP pavilion 15 and served me for 9 yrs and still running. My requirement was to get a laptop which would serve me for long time. I am not a regular game player. So, I looked for all options. Dell G 15 was on cards however when i was doing research I found out that at same price I was getting an i7 12 gen. I ordered this beast. Specs wise it's an i7 12th gen, RTX3050 4 GB, 512 GB SSD, 8 GB ram, 15,6 inch with a 144 Hz refresh rate. I chose to exchange an old dell laptop and got another discount of 10% on sbi credit card during ongoing sale. Exchange value was also decent.thanks to amazon for amazing delivery and exchange experience. I got the laptop in 3 days.I am not a professional user of a laptop however as soon as I got it, I edited few Go Pro videos and few dashcam videos. Soon after that I handled video editing for some work. This laptop worked like a breeze. It handled all the huge sized videos with ease. I also used it to project the display onto a data wall and to my surprise, it extended the display instead of normal duplication. It made my work easy as i was able to do my work in background without anyone in audience knowing about it. Till now its a great experience, Battery life is obviously lesser due to i7 and GPU but gaming laptops will have lesser battery life anyway. The display screen is also good. It did not hurt my eyes even after long working on the screen. It looks and feels good. Its not flimsy, it looks very dated and has a good venting and cooling system. It has a backlight keyboard as well and comes with office and windows 10 preloaded.Its a must buy and, in this price, its a win win situation.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 12650H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Rs Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX

review: Processor: 12th Generation Intel Core i7-12650H Up To 4.70GHzOperating System: Pre-loaded Windows 11 Home with lifetime validity |Preinstalled Software: MSI Center | In the box: Laptop, Power AdapterDisplay: 40CM FHD (1920x1080), 144Hz, 45% NTSC, IPS-Level PanelMemory & Storage: 8GBx2 DDR5 Dual Channel RAM | Storage: 512GB NVMe PCIe Gen4x4 SSD"NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4050, GDDR6 6GB | Gb LAN 802.11 ax Wi-Fi 6 + Bluetooth v5.2"Gaming Laptop | Laptop weight: 1.98kgKeyboard: Single Backlit Keyboard (Blue)

Name: MSI Cyborg 15, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12650H, 40CM FHD 144Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Translucent Black/1.98Kg), A12VE-070IN
review: MSI Cyborg is not translucent as it claims to be. There are many flaws hidden beneath the translucent chasis. Lets begin:Display - Display is the part we most interact in a Laptop. We constantly watch the screen and paying upwards of 1 lakh for an FHD 144HZ panel with poor color calibration. This means what you see is ain't the good thing.ü´£Processor - The brain üß† of the computer. Here also we get a 12th gen Intel core i5 processor that performs good but does not justify the price.Graphics card - Here is the trick. On paper it has RTX 4050 with 6GB GDDR6 memory but the wattage is 45W with Dynamic boost. Ideally it shall run lower say strt from as low as 15W !üôÅ! It has MAX-Q version of NVIDIA graphics. The performance will be lower than any rtx 3060 and may be an 85W 3050TI surpass this where video memory is not the bottleneck as it has 4GB of VRAM. And 3060 laptops start from 80-85k amd 3050ti can be had with 75k.Keyboard and mouse - Keyboard has good travel bit the keys lack the feel of a good mechanical. But it descent enough for the price.What isn't descent is the track pad. It could have bigger and has a very wobbly feel.Design - Amazing design. They have truly justified the name and it looks quite funky.It is comparatively light at just 1.98 Kg !!Battery - good enough to last 4 hours on normal useVerdict - BUY this only if you need rtx 4050 dearly or the design and weight is a primary need for a gaming laptop. In every other scenario there are better laptops available for lesser price.

review: PROS:  1 ) Great specs in this price range  2) Good screen with 144 refresh rate  3) 500 GB ssd is great with higher I/O speed  4) Additional 1TB HDD is good for a dditional storage  5) 16 GB ram is enough for day to day office/ development / moderate gamingCons : 1) batterly life is poor around 3 hours with moderate use  and 2 hours with gaming  2) It has two ram slot with 8gb in each, so if you want to upgrade you will have to remove  RAM from either of one slot ...its stupid  3) Bulky laptop  4) Finger print magnet  , you will need the cleaner to clean the oil stains sooner or later  5) Back panel design could have been more elegant  6) Fan speed at highest RPM very noisy ...its like sitting in jet engine  7) Temprature in high performacne gaming may hit sometime to 95 degree centigrate with auto  fan mode , it may reduce to little low if i manually set fan speed to highest ( tried with  GTA 5 in max supported performance mode)8) 180 degree flexibility would hv been great,its Marley 130 degree

review: Hi All,I purchased this laptop from Amazon for 55k and Its my third day of using. I see alot of hanging issues with this new laptop which I have never seen a new piece ever. A simple game of vice city that also hangs in this laptopAudio for this laptop is very less as compared to my old laptop (hp pavilion).Design is classy but eventually you have to use it and it will give you pains as you have spend so much on this laptop.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop 8GB/256GB SSD+1TB/ Windows 11 Home /NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg, 82K201Y9IN
review: I played watch dogs 2 with high settings @75-90fps (with temporal filtering on), without it 50-61fps @ high. Ultra 28-42fps without temporal filtering onbattlefield 1 @ultra 70-90 fpsForza Horizon 4 @ custom (high-ultra) 78-120state of mind @epic 61 fpsI think these results are decent as it is not a high end GPU.Pros:*The GPU  temperature never reached more than 66¬∞C Even after 2hrs of gaming . So Thermals are Osm. CPU reached nearly 80¬∞C when stress testing but during gaming around 72-75¬∞C. *During working hours the laptop remains silent you won't notice any sound if set to quiet mode. (#peace :) )*What I love about lenovo is their keyboard if ur into coding or some kind of typing stuff u'll be very much satisfied.*Speakers of laptop is loud enough and audio software Nahimic is cooler than Hp's B&O, it tunes audio depends on ur use which is a cool feature.*The Laptop has 135Watt Charger which can bring smile on Overclockers face as it can squeeze extra juice in games and Video-editing. CPU {45Watt}+GPU{50Watt} which makes use of overall usage of 120  watts(rough estimation) including motherboard other components like speakers, display, etc. 15watt which is left can used to squeeze for extra performance of CPU  and  GPU (most Manufactures restricts chargers to 90Watt or 120 watt)*Lenovo vantage provides conservative mode which increases battery lifespan. most laptops OEM don't provide this feature.Cons:*The laptop doesn't have an option to set its refresh rate to 60Hz in settings by default it runs at 120HZ which can be an issue with battery drain as it has low capacity battery. I think it will be fixed with BIOS Update in future.*They could have done better with Battery instead of 45WHr.*Could have Given an extra usb port (as 2 usb port restricts ur workspace to limited options)*From gaming point of view they could have given mux switch which boosts fps (iGPU bottlenecks DGPU) .*Sweaty-wet hands can make laptop dirty with marks, its with build quality. But not a big problem u can avoid it by cleaning time to time.I had an issue while watching movies or youtube as the battery is draining to quickly but I got it fixed by switching to iGPU for VLC and Browsers . it saved alot of battery."""Best about the laptop:One of the main advantage of this laptop out of  all other laptops is that the laptop charger-socket has an unique rectangle pin which helps in longetivity of female of socket. Believe me I used round pin  laptop charger and they are the worst. After, an year of use female socket will be loosened {"""as it gets loosened it doesn't connect to pin properly which creates a power barrier between laptop and charger. By not getting enough power required and the power barrier directly results in performance_drop by running CPU and GPU at lower clock speeds """} and u need to get a replacement for it, which costs around 2K-3k and u should have to open the laptop which can be a riskier job as its not same as adding ram. which is an absolute terrible experience u can have and also "You cannot claim warranty for female socket as it gets counted for improper usage."_""""""BE CAREFUL: IF YOUR UPGRADING RAM DISCONNECT BATTERY OR JUST DRAIN BATTERY COMPLETELY (IF ITS HARD TO DISCONNECT) OR U WILL BE HAVING EVEN AN OPTION IN BIOS TO TURN OFF BATTERY. THEN ONLY INSERT RAM OR SSD OR HDD. EVEN A SMALL SCREW FALL CAN FRY YOUR MOTHERBOARD. AND ALSO DISCONNECT POWER CORD TOO. JUST DON'T IGNORE THIS"""Overall laptop is decent for working and mid level gaming.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop 8GB/256GB SSD+1TB/ Windows 11 Home /NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg, 82K201Y9IN
review: Laptop performance is good but its quite heavy in size (2.2Kg) which is expected. Screen resolution is good. Audio quality is ok but not great. Major concern is with Battery backup, full charged backup will not last for more than 3 Hrs. Recharge (100%) will complete in less than 3 Hrs. Memory SD Card reader not available in this model. USB type-A (2nos), Type-C(1 no) and 1HDMI port available.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS 120Hz Gaming Laptop 8GB/256GB SSD+1TB/ Windows 11 Home /NVIDIA GTX 1650 4GB/Alexa/3 Month Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.2Kg, 82K201Y9IN
review: I purchased this model (R5-5600H) for 59k, and to be honest, do not go for this if it is more than 60k. At that rate, the RTX 3050 is superior in every way, and you can leverage RT and DLSS.Now coming to the packaging, it included a 135W charging brick (which was surprisingly compact) and the laptop itself. Nothing else, no case or accessories, but that is to be expected from a budget laptop.Build Quality: The Shadow Black model is made of premium feeling plastic. The hinge seems to be extremely stable, but it is almost impossible to open the lid with one hand, which in my opinion isn't a big deal. Overall, a good package for the price. This wouldn't feel out of place in a professional setting unlike other gaming laptops.Screen: Yes, its only 250 nits and covers only 45% of NTSC, but I did not notice it personally. The brightness at 100% was sufficient for use during the day(indoors), and the screen was usable up to 20% brightness. Colors are vibrant and media consumption is a breeze on this screen.Battery Life: This is one of the few weak points of this laptop, With a measly 46Wh battery, I did not expect it to perform as good as say, the Asus Zephyrus series, but on a whole, battery life was quite disappointing to say the least, but typical for a gaming machine. It lasted for around 5 hours at 50% brightness and with Bluetooth and the backlight switched off, all while performing day to day tasks such as word processing, coding on Python, and watching YouTube. DO NOT game on battery power, as that will severely damage the cells.Performance: The 5600H is an excellent CPU for the money, and with SMT it is able to breeze through most of my requirements, but the same cannot be said of the GTX 1650. Although it is able to reach the refresh rate of the monitor on most eSports titles, it struggles to play through more demanding AAA games such as Cyberpunk 2077, where i was only getting 30fps on Medium settings. Meanwhile, I got 45fps at Medium settings in Control, and 120fps in Crysis. Minecraft, Super Meat Boy, Terraria, Tomb Raider(2013), were all able to max out the refresh rate of the screen at their highest settings. I would strongly advise to upgrade the memory to a dual channel configuration as that would significantly improve the performance. Regarding thermals, the CPU did get quite hot while gaming(90C), but the heat was swiftly dissipated by the excellent cooling system. The GPU never throttled and always stayed under 75C.Keyboard and Touchpad: Lenovo is known for their tactile keyboards, and this one is no exception. Has great travel distance and keystrokes feel snappy. The backlight comes in 2 levels, but I did not notice any difference in brightness between them (perhaps a defect). The touchpad was serviceable for daily tasks, but not for gaming.Verdict: On a whole, the new Lenovo Ideapad Gaming 3 is an attractive options for gamers on a budget, with a sleek and professional design, great thermals and acceptable performance for the price. The keyboard is a stand-out in this price range, while the battery life is disappointing and below average in this class of laptops.
review_title: Decent budget gaming machine with an elegant design.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7 5800H Processor 16.1-inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/144 Hz/300 nits/GeForce RTX 3060 6GB Graphics/Backlit KB/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass),16-e0361ax
review: Ships with windows 11, which makes the Ryzen 7 look like a celeron sometimes. And the screen has an extreme yellow cast, so you'll need to color calibrate it if you intend to use it for color sensitive work. And there is a glaring issue with the sound quality from the headphone jack.other than that, the laptop is very nice to use, easy on the eyes with a kind of understated look. the keys and touch pad feel nice and responsive. the 3060 graphics card performs well enough, despite the lower TGP. But no complaints there considering the whole package.If you want a better, pure gaming performance for the a similar price, you should probably go with the Asus TUF rtx3060 model. But that one will not have a good screen. Overall, for all round use, Victus is the better package.
review_title: You get what you paid for.

review: This exact same laptop costs about $4700 in the United States, if you convert that into rupees it comes around ‚Çπ3,85,000. Which is still a lot but now look at this. This model at this point of time in India costs around ‚Çπ6,00,000. Like why? ü§îWhy such unfair prices to Indian customers. I am very curious about how MSI tries to justify their answers. But I won't take away how good the laptop actually is. Even though it will probably drain your battery in less than 5 hours at high performance. It performs better than even a water cooled 3090Ti desktop with a 12900k (the best last GEN could offer). But is slower and less efficient to the newly launched M2 Max by apple in editing and web browsing. Overall the 4k mini-led screen paired with the RGB and cooling would still be of considerable value if sold below ‚Çπ4,00,000 today. As some of the components are only limited to a very small amount of laptops, even some desktops 2 years ago. So I rated it a two star. Please reduce the price if not then don't try to rip-off loyal customers. Apple products are starting to look reasonable at this rate. üòî

review: Very good laptop, all the specs are covered and if you are dell fan its a very good option to buy.The only problem is that not all the games are been played with WASD keys, some games required to be played with navigation keys.I dont know why, but even its a gaming laptop, dell is not providing the full size navigation keys.  A new or professional gamer, the ease to play with full size navigation keys cannot be matched with half size keys.I believe that dell puts half size keys to adjust the keyboard in a rectangular shape to make it look decent, but when your main purpose is getting questioned (the ease of playing games), who would look for the decency.So if you are gamer, think before buying it. Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7 5800H, 16.1-inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/144 Hz/GeForce RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/Backlit KB/Win 11/Xbox Game Pass(30 Days)/MSO 2021),16-e0305ax
review: I was searching for a laptop which would serve me for long time. My last laptop was HP pavilion 15 and served me for 9 yrs and still running. My requirement was to get a laptop which would serve me for long time. I am not a regular game player. So, I looked for all options. Dell G 15 was on cards however when i was doing research I found out that at same price I was getting an i7 12 gen. I ordered this beast. Specs wise it's an i7 12th gen, RTX3050 4 GB, 512 GB SSD, 8 GB ram, 15,6 inch with a 144 Hz refresh rate. I chose to exchange an old dell laptop and got another discount of 10% on sbi credit card during ongoing sale. Exchange value was also decent.thanks to amazon for amazing delivery and exchange experience. I got the laptop in 3 days.I am not a professional user of a laptop however as soon as I got it, I edited few Go Pro videos and few dashcam videos. Soon after that I handled video editing for some work. This laptop worked like a breeze. It handled all the huge sized videos with ease. I also used it to project the display onto a data wall and to my surprise, it extended the display instead of normal duplication. It made my work easy as i was able to do my work in background without anyone in audience knowing about it. Till now its a great experience, Battery life is obviously lesser due to i7 and GPU but gaming laptops will have lesser battery life anyway. The display screen is also good. It did not hurt my eyes even after long working on the screen. It looks and feels good. Its not flimsy, it looks very dated and has a good venting and cooling system. It has a backlight keyboard as well and comes with office and windows 10 preloaded.Its a must buy and, in this price, its a win win situation.

Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11 Gaming Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: First, this laptop comes with i7 H-Series processor which is hungry of power.Second, this laptop has RTX graphics which required too much power, which can discharge the 100% battery of 3 cell and 56 WHr within 100 minutes.But there is option it increase its battery time ( while general purpose like surfing, streaming)1. Go to Device Manager and Disable RTX Graphics under Display Adapter.2. Switch to battery saver mode.I guarantee you will get more than 4 hours of battery life (may vary when you connected with internet).This device is fitted with Realtek Speakers and having Realtek HD Sound driver WaveMaxxAudio which also process on high frequency that means consume lots of power and increases surface temperature, so fans run continuously ( so, use laptop on flat surface for better ventilation ) which consumes battery.3. You can also disable WavesMaxxAudio service through Task Manager under Startup Section, then restart the laptop.Note:- By Disabling WavesMaxxAudio, sound quality will decrease significantly. So, do it on your as per needs.Although, this is great laptop for an Engineering Student, Video Editing, and Even for medium graphics Game Development for 2D Games like Mario.But I'll prefer a PC for Serious Video Editing and Gaming.

Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11 Gaming Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: Expensive price, Dell store offering less with same model, configuration, with bag.Warranty starts from date of customer purchase, not Amazon purchase

Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11 Gaming Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: I did not purchase this laptop from amazon as it was not available at that time here. If someone is looking for a powerful laptop within medium budget then this machine is wonderful.1) The CPU is I7-12700H with 14 cores and 20 threads. Any work is executed smoothly without any hitches. 2) People looking for running multiple virtual machines simultaneously will be very pleased. I have tested with 6 VMs running simultaneously and truth be told, the laptop performs wonderfully well without any lags. 3) 16GB of DDR5 RAM is good enough for most work including latest AAA titled games. There is option to upgrade upto 32GB but it is a very costly affair right now. 4) The RTX 3050Ti is quite good for mid-tier gaming needs. Tons of youtube videos backup this point. However, for high level gaming this is not ideal. 5) The laptop gets noticeably warm even when doing normal tasks. However, while under intensive workload (CPU, GPU or both) the machine does get very hot. So, a good quality cooler is a must for those who intend to do intensive work for long periods of time.6) Alienware command center needs to be running in order to use the Game Shift tech (Fn + F9).7) Display Quality is ok - I expected a better display at this price.8) The integrated webcam does not have a privacy shutter which is drawback at this price point.9) The mouse click on the trackpad is a 2-stage affair. You have to click quite hard and will be able to feel the 2 stage click procedure.10) After purchase, the initial setup process is a quite cumbersome. High speed internet is a requirement it seems. Tons of updates (Including drivers from dell website), windows updates are separate lots of setups (Nvidia panel updates separately), bloatware (McAfee) really is confusing for anyone not well versed with these things.11) The hinges seem quite good. We can lift the lid with one finger. There is very little wobble on the lid.Note - Battery Backup : This is  huge problem. Battery gets drained incredibly fast. Even under almost no workload battery drains out totally in around 90 minutes. This is really not good for laptop costing above‚Çπ1 Lac. If I had any idea about this issue, I would not have purchased this model. I understand that the laptop is powerful, but if battery drains out in less than 2 hours even when machine is idling then it is not good.If someone is willing to work on this machine while connected to AC power, then this is a really powerful machine. In higher end laptops, the GPU and build quality will be obviously better. But, the CPU and RAM is top grade which means that most work is done without problem.
review_title: Very Powerful Laptop but Battery Backup is a big concern.

review: This laptop just does things smoothly for which it is made of. The rtx 3050ti is a beast paired with the ryzen 5 5600h.Pros:  1) Its battery is good compared to other gaming laptops in this price range. But dont expect much as it is a gaming laptop.  2)The cpu does not bottleneck the gpu and together give a good performance.  3) The RTX 3050ti runs all the AAA titles with easy.  4)Good for editing and rendering processes.  5) I think the screen is best in the segment.  6)The exhaust fans are too good.Cons:.  1) The screen wobbles a little more.  2) The thermals are not that good hence i suggest to use a laptop cooler for low temperatures.  3) Thermal vents are less only on the back and not on the sides.If you are planning to buy this laptop just go for it. Worth the price.  I thought that the rtx 3050ti will bottleneck the cpu but it does not and gives a good performance.  At last everyones favourate valorant gives average 250+ fps (most of the times it depends on your internet speed)

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 11th Gen 15.6"(39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SDD/4GB NVIDIA RTX 3050/120Hz/Win11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg),82K101EEIN
review: It's a well made device. Beats our expectations from Lenovo. The RTX 3050 can easily handle heavy games as well as other work load along with the Intel core i5 11th gen. The cooling system also does a great job. The battery is much better compared to other laptops and the 170 W charger charges the device very quickly. The screen is really good and without any stutters. The USB 3.0 and Type-C ports are also very useful. The free Xbox game pass for 3 months and MS Office is also a gret deal. Windows 11 is working very smoothly and efficiently on the device.There are very few and insignificant drawbacks to mention. First is the lack of other accessories like cover and bag in the box. These can be bought seperately for a cheap price. The next is the ram. It is only 8 GB. But for this price, it is a good deal. It can also be bought seperately for a good price. Although the company claims to support maximum of 16 GB of ram, the laptop supports 64 GB of maximum memory. Next is the SSD. More space would have been helpful but it can be added later as well.Besides the above drawbacks, it is an excellent device and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a powerful device in this budget.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 11th Gen 15.6"(39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SDD/4GB NVIDIA RTX 3050/120Hz/Win11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg),82K101EEIN
review: Its a good configuration laptop.Photo and video processing is better.Win 11 has dropped few GUI features that was available in win 10, which user may find annoying.Comes with MS Office pre-installed and requires registration to active it for life time.Laptop doesn't have heating problem, which I find very useful and the reason I choose this brand.It doesn't comes with a HDD, but there is provision to attach either a HDD or SSD as the ports for these device share common place.Comes with single memory card. the memory can be extended using the other available memory slot.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX
review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†Laptop CPU runs hot. Windows11/HP/AMD background software keeps cpu working at 30-40% even at idle. But right when you launch task manager to see which process is taking up so much CPU resources, these processes stop right away and you can't even figure out what processes were running. Suddenly the processor load is at 1 or 2% instead of 30-40%. Something is going on with Windows11. My issue was this background shenanigans kept the CPU/Laptop hot. Even at 30% CPU load, temperature can get near 100C. So what I do now is always keep task manager running, this keeps the unnecessary background processes stopped and lets my CPU be cool when idle. To monitor CPU load and also temperature a software called CoreTemp can be used. Essential if your CPU is being used/hijacked by some unnecessary process which hides itself in the Windows Task manager like in my case.edit: Used a third party software called Anvir taskmanager  and found windows explorer was keeping the cpu at 33% load even when idle, making the CPU temperature reach 100C for no reason. So just restarting the explorer in taskmanager fixed the issue.Initially without any clue as to what was happening, I had to re-paste the CPU/GPU thermal paste, try out a third-party software to control AMD Ryzen temperature. More about that below. Also figured out HP factory setup for the laptop back panel had a plastic sheet which was covering up a huge air vent. So make sure to discard plastic sheet if you are planning to game and want to keep the laptop  as cool as possible.I like my laptop to stay sort of cool even when gaming, so it lasts long and I don't have to worry about replacing it's fan sooner. I re-pasted the CPU and GPU with some Cooler Master MasterGel Pro Thermal Paste. When I opened up the thermal heat sink metal plate, there were two kinds of paste, grey on CPU/GPU and white on some other chips. The white paste is a silicon based paste called CLG-3500 the name you can find in the Maintenance and Service guide for this laptop on HP website. I left the white paste there, it's of lower thermal conductivity so basically lower quality than mastergel. I filled some gaps on it with my higher thermal conducting Mastergel paste, a few drops here and there. These chips are of lower importance in generating heat when compared to CPU/GPU and also Mastergel paste does not conduct electricity.  For CPU GPU I cleaned out entire factory applied grey thermal paste with some iso alcohol/cloth and then repasted with my Mastergel paste. The mastergel/thermal paste only conducts heat to metal plate and it's upto the fans/ventilation to remove it from metal plates.HP factory setting for this  laptop blocks the main air vent on the back panel of the laptop with some kind of plastic/paper sheet thing. You can see attached pics. Don't know why HP would block a huge air vent they made themselves for their gaming laptop with a plastic sheet. This air vent sits right on top of the heat conducting metal plate and so opening this up would conduct away most of the heat from the metal plate easily, letting the laptop run cooler more easily and letting the laptop fan do less work and thus last longer. Any plans to use a laptop cooler stand with built in fans would be more effective if the back panel had lots of holes on it for cooler air to flow in. An MSi bravo laptop that I considered with same processor and graphics card  as this HP victus has a backpanel that exposes most of it's metal plates to air easily with lots of holes. I initially thought this HP model also had air vents from the few pics could find earlier but only found it was blocked once I got it in my hand. So I plucked out this blocking sheet right out of the backpanel and now my airvents are fully open exposing the hot metal plate. I made a DIY laptop stand with a USB table fan and an inverted plastic box with a big hole for the fan to sit in. I put the fan inside the box and the laptop on top of the box so that the fan blows air right at the air vent/metal heat sink plate.With this set up I am able to keep my laptop cool when gaming heavy. I ran God of War game at high graphic settings, which made my CPU consume 80-90Watts and GPU 70-80 watts and produce maximum heat, CPU went to 101 C and GPU to 90C. The frames per second for GOW game was good at 40-65fps in closed settings and slightly laggy in rare occassions. But since I repasted the CPU/GPU, my laptop backpanel air vent was fully open and I also put a table fan blowing air into the metal heat sink ... over all the laptop body was cool underside and slightly warm to touch on keyboard regardless of whether the CPU/GPU was hot. Also monitored the laptop CPU fan speed using Speedfan 4.52 software. The maximum speed is around 4800 rpm (OMEN software can force CPU fan to maximum speed). while idle it's around 2200 rpm without external fan and 0 rpm with external fan. While gaming with my current set up and an external fan, the cpu fan speed is around 3800 to 4000 rpm. It never reaches the maximum speed because over all laptop is cool even when CPU is hot.For experts who know about TDP and want to control CPU wattage and temperature directly, there are two softwares, one is Ryzen controller and other is AMD APU Tuning Utility. Both use another program called RyzenAdj.exe which can directly change certain parameters of the Ryzen CPUs. For this Ryzen 5600H cpu, the max TDP power value it can operate at is around 113 Watts. The max temperature it can operate at is around 100C. Both are factory set and can be found using command line interface with Ryzenadj software. So using one of these softwares Ryzenadj, Ryzen controller  or AMD APU Tuning Utility, you can set these values during a user session. For example you can decrease  the maximum wattage allowed from 113 to 50 watts and maximum temperature can be decreased from 100C to say 70C. With these new values, the Ryzen 5600h CPU will not be able to use more power or will not be allowed to heat up beyond the set value. These settings are always reset upon restart of the laptop provided you do not apply it again.  So I  used these softwares to try to decrease my laptop  temperature. For idle/not gaming setting, I would use a temperature limit of 70C and the CPU would never cross this value. You can also use these softwares to set temperature or TDP wattage values while gaming. For example a setting I used was not allow temperature to cross above 80C  and not allow TDP to cross above 75W. Only one of these values will take precedence over the other, probably the temperature one because CPU heats up really fast even with 30% load. Played a lot using these settings and was able to get good 40-60 fps in Racing game Dirt 5 in high medium mix graphic settings on a heavy rain race track simulating most weather and graphic effects. The CPU temperature never crossed 80-81C. GPu temperature reached near 80C but this cannot be controlled directly by these softwares, only can change and control CPU values. If lacking a Laptop cooling stand and external fan, I would use these softwares to decrease laptop temperature but otherwise it's not necessary.Laptop monitor lacks color, Recommend installing latest AMD radeon drivers and AMD Adrenalin software. I increased the saturation of my monitor. AMD Adrenalin software also has a vivid setting for global display/graphics. Use that to show more colorful display and in game .The Laptop graphics card has 4GB vram which can affect high texture graphics required for some games. Some games like dirt 5 or forza 5 gives vram low warnings. Still for Dirt 5 graphics is pretty great. For Forza 5 it could use a bit improvement. Forza 4 runs great and has great graphics though. Though at this price point this laptop is good , most 6GB vram laptops are selling  at way higher prices. I would recommend a high 6GB VRAM graphic card rather than a Nvidia 3050 as an improvement over this rx 5500mAlso recommend getting another 8GB RAM as it would add more to gaming and multi tasking experience.  I installed two 16 Gb rams to have total 32GB and everything works great, switches programs on the fly, from gaming to work instantly. Some rare games like God of war and Modern warfare warzone battle royale used more than 16 GB ram, up to 20GB. For most other games 16GB should be more than enough.edit: tried out several games, all action adventure and racing games available for  xbox gaming pass and EA play subscription . Over all the impression is this laptop is good for gaming at 1920 x 1080 resolution with greater than 40 fps minimum at high graphic settings. It can go to ultra graphics for games released before 2020. One issue I found was when gaming long hours, the battery seems to be discharging at a slow but significant rate even when power cable was connected. The issue could be either laptop or my home's power lines. No idea.edit2:Due to modifying my laptop cpu's power settings using third party sw, or due to unlocking and using windows ultimate performance/high performance power plans in windows power options, one of those two reasons, Maybe not these reasons at all, but anyway my cpu and gpu together are consuming more than 150 watts  that the power brick can provide and this is what is causing the battery drainage when I play games for over 5 to 6 hours continuously. So I now limit the cpu power limit to around 78W using ryzen controller sw. Rest of the power from power brick is reserved for graphics card. This resolves the battery draining problem I was having and I am still able to play games at more or less same quality, speed and graphics. Constant draining and recharging would be bad for battery life. This makes it seem like the cpu and gpu of this laptop could have performed greater if it were provided a 200W power brick.
review_title: Overall Good Laptop for both medium-high graphic quality gaming and work/anything else

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Laptop AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon RX 6500M Graphics(4GB GDDR6)/144Hz/9ms Response time/Backlit KB/B&O/Alexa),15-fb0777AX
review: Review post approx. 5 months of use:Despite the disappointing state of Indian laptop market since mid-2020s, I'd go ahead and say that if you're looking for a laptop for budget gaming or media creation, at the time of writing this review - this is the best you can do in terms of price to performance ratio. This is currently the best performance laptop you can buy in 50k-85k segment. And that's a huge claim, I know, but the Indian laptop market is that screwed at the moment. There are just no fair offerings in that segment and that segment is supposed to be multiple segments (like 50-60k, 60-70k, 70-80k and so on). Of course I'm leaving out RTX3050 laptops but I don't think they're priced well for what they're offering. The only other laptops that make sense would be 3050Ti ones due to their higher performance and even then, their pricetags are not proportional to the increase in performance when compared to this RX5500M laptop. You pay way more than the performance bump you get.Also, please remember to uninstall bloatware and stick to OEM graphics drivers instead of installing Radeon graphics drivers (because every laptop is different and parent companies know better about what drivers would serve their laptops better- speaking from experience with this very laptop).The Victus has a lot of things going for it. Remember, I bought this was like 48k in a sale so the features it has at that price point are a no-brainer.Pros:- Tiny bezel around the screen makes it feel so slick and modern- Screen size is plenty big and the screen quality is quite pleasant to look at- Backlit keyboard (white light only but that's not something I consider a con since I don't like RGB anyways)- Numpad included in the keyboard- Awesome thermals. It plays games like CSGO and Mudrunner on max settings without having to ramp up the fans so the experience is quiet and pleasant. Although, playing more demanding games like Snowrunner do tend to make it run hot so the fans spool up to higher RPMs (in which case you can just use noise-cancelling headphones to offset that issue).- Best in class CPU and graphics card. I added in another 8GB RAM stick and this thing is now unstoppable!-Soild build quality. I was attacked by a dog so hard that I got knocked back while this laptop was in my bag behind my back and when I fell, the bag was crushed under my weight. Not a scratch.- Minimalist design is very much appreciated. I hate loud, flashy, obnoxious designs from other brands screaming, "LOOK AT MEEE!!!1!1!!" so this subtle, subdued but still upmarket design is great for me.- People complain about this laptop's screen wobbling issue, especially while under a running fan. Sure, it's a thin screen so it's bound to happen but honestly, I don't see it. Yeah, it does wobble if you slap the screen gently but that's rare and also, why would you? I just leave the screen alone and do my thing. Haven't had a problem yet.Cons:- It's very heavy. At 2.5 kg, this thing is a behemoth. But I guess, you can't have everything. I'm okay with this being the only con to that many features at this price point.- Can't think of any other cons. In fact, I haven't had any other issues with it during the last 5 months of my ownership at all whatsoever so... that's great!Honestly, this is a great value for money laptop and I recently recommend it and got at least 3 other people to buy it. Not one of them has had an issue either. This laptop was one of the best strategies adopted by HP of late. I look forward to many years of worry-free gaming and 3D animation with this thing.

review: HP has done it yet again. This is my second HP laptop and i can safely say that my next one will be an HP too. I bought it from the OMEN Playground store in Nehru place and as soon as i got my hands on it, i went on to download Warzone 2.0. Right off the bat the performance on this device is mind blowing. I was getting a constant FPS of 90 frames and the gameplay was buttery smooth. This laptop is ideal for college going students who want to game or even work on their laptops.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Laptop 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm)FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop(8GBRAM/512GB SSD/NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 graphics/7ms response time/144Hz/Backlit KB/Win 11/B&O)16-d0310TX
review: Oh my goodness, where do I even begin with my review of the HP Victus Gaming Laptop? This product has completely changed my life! I never knew that a laptop could make such a huge difference in my daily routine, but the 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H processor combined with the 16.1 inch (40.9 cm) FHD IPS display has truly blown me away.Let me start by talking about the design. The HP Victus Gaming Laptop is sleek and modern, with a stunning color scheme that is sure to turn heads. The keyboard is comfortable and responsive, and the touchpad is smooth and easy to use. The build quality is top-notch, with a sturdy frame that feels like it can withstand anything.But let's get to the real meat of this product: the performance. Oh my goodness, the performance! The 11th Gen Intel Core i5-11400H processor is lightning fast, and I've never experienced such smooth and seamless multitasking on a laptop before. Whether I'm streaming a movie, editing photos, or running multiple programs at once, the HP Victus Gaming Laptop handles it all with ease.And let's not forget about the 16.1 inch (40.9 cm) FHD IPS display. The colors are vibrant and true-to-life, and the images are crisp and clear. I've never seen such a stunning display on a laptop before, and it makes every activity from gaming to streaming to work feel like a whole new experience.Overall, I can't recommend the HP Victus Gaming Laptop enough. This product has truly changed my life, and I am absolutely in love with it.If you're in the market for a new laptop, look no further than the HP Victus Gaming Laptop. Trust me, you won't regret it!

review: Got it at a good price with a discount coupon from Amazon. The item is an old stock and hence the heavily discounted price of Rs 90,000. review: I was looking for a laptop that can handle all my content requirements and gaming demands. The OMEN 16 is perfect as it has the specs that a gamer wants in very clean design. It handles all AAA titles like a dream and stays reasonably cool while at it. It is also great for content creation because of its RAM, powerful CPU and GPU. I can happily say that it's future-proof as well.

review: Too expensive and ms word not even free for 3,4 months or a year.. windows 10 and 11 both were installed and lagging when started. Not recommended for people 1st time having laptop. 3 game limit of High quality. Too low storage.

Name: ASUS TUF  Gaming  F15 (2022), 15.6"(39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 Ti 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Gray/2.2 Kg), FX507ZE-HN038W
review: Laptop feels fine the build and the specs provided are awesome for the price and the display quality is also reliable if not for the screen bleed. After receiving the product I noticed some screen bleed but after increasing the brightness and doing the screen bleed test the screen bleeding felt too abnormal and unbearable for me. As soon as some black or dark background came up I was clearly able to notice the bleed. I immediately called the Amazon technical support and they told me you can opt for replacement. Hopefully the next product doesn't have the same issue.Update on 04 Feb 2023:I received the replacement and the screen bleed is minimal. Satisfactory service from Appario and Amazon. Although more testing is needed. Will update the review after completing the test.
review_title: Good Laptop with the worst screen bleed

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: Appearance :The laptop looks sexy af..but that been said it's a fingerprint magnet any part of the laptop you touch can be traced back. So keep a microfiber with you all time ig.Screen:It's a good 144hz panel not too shabby but it does the job.Its not a 100% sRGB screen so keep that in mind for editors.Performance:It has the 12th gen i5 which is way better than the old i5 gen so that itself is a good performance boost for anything, along with 16gb out of the box it's a good performer for any task.Gaming wise it has the 75w RTX 3050..which can be overclocked to for a boosted 90w tgp .But i don't think that's needed and personally when I tried with the overclock it had game crash issues.Even without the boost the performance was good.Rtx features are working decent but sometimes due to the 4gb card you might not get the most out of rtx. Tested with the new plague and rtx it was looking amazing running smooth ..got some crashed in high dense areas and had to lower rtx settings.Competitive Games will ran pretty good more than refresh rate of the screen with the good CPU GPU pair and fats ram . So no hiccups there.Ports:Bonus point for a thunderbolt c port..with fast 135watt charging . The biggest down side is there is only two USB A ports .Overall:It's a good laptop at the price segment the build is amazing quality and looks great.With good performance all across . If you are looking for RTX 3050 option this is definitely the Top G.PS. There is no RGB but the white lighting  looks amazing with the matte theme .
review_title: Slick Matte Black Laptop with Good Performance

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: The look is decent and not having multicolored backlit...tuf logo also nice in the corner.. bought for its latest specifications.Cons: Having only 2 usb ports (can't connect wireless keyboard, pendrive, external hdd at a time) better have tye c pendrive.screen is having backlit bleeding ( you can notice under black screen especially while Boot)Matt finish catches finger prints very easily...it spoils the look little bit..

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: It's great value for this price. You get 2x 8gb DDR5 4800mhz ram. That's more than enough for gaming and video editing and game development. It had a 512gb gen3 nvme SSD. Think whether it fits your purpose or not. I upgraded it with a Crucial P3 2tb gen 3 nvme SSD. I know that it supports gen4 nvme SSD but I didn't had budget and I don't require much speeds. Came with Windows 11 home single language (21H2) June 2022 update but got a 22H2 update in few days. The machine runs blender, unity engine, unreal engine smooth as hell. Tried GTA 5 70fps @Ultra ,ETS2 75fps @Ultra and 145fps@ low.
review_title: Nice Machine when paired with ROG strix impact II mouse.

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: Keycaps started coming off after one month of use. I have a 10y old hp whose keycaps are in perfect condition

Name: ASUS TUF Dash F15 (2022), 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i5-12450H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050 4GB Graphics,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2 kg), FX517ZC-HN036WS
review: Today I got my product got very excited and started using it to explore every feature as much as I can. One thing for sure there is in build asus software which allows us to change the GPU usage according to your needs. So when i tried gaming I used the Ultimate GPU mode and it was very smooth and in eco optimized mode with 100% battery it can go upto at least 5 hr with internet surfing and maybe more because i never tried to take it to that level but it can definitely go to 8hr. Screen quality is great and the keyboard is soft. The good thing is if it heats up, it doesn't affect the touch pad area. The only thing i would have want if possible was to enhance the speaker seems like the speaker is under the laptop. Sound is good though. Definitely recommend to people who wants to buy this product. In later months will update if any dislike happens otherwise this is good.Update:Yes as i thought the speaker isn't as good as it should be in this price range and the speakers are below the laptop so if you are planning to watch movie or play game, you may need to use headphone even mobile headphone will also do
review_title: Best gaming or normal usage laptop

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 12650H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Rs Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
review: Everything is good from the build to the speakers and performance.The two things that I hate about this laptop is that there is no keyboard blacklight timeout anywhere in the laptop including the BIOS settings and sometimes the backlight could be too much for eyes if you are sitting in a dark room. You have to do an extra work of pressing fn + F4 to turn on/off the backlight.2nd one being the screen wobbling but its not much and you'll probably wouldn't notice it from the front .There are two SSD slots so you need not worry about all the false claims on the internet about it being lacking one.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 12650H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Rs Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
review: The start button works sometimes but not works on sometimes but the issue is on windows 11.Battery is okay for a gaming laptop at this price.Camera is okay for video calls.I played gta v while charging it's really good at high resolution but on battery it get lags sometimes.Euro truck simulator works good bothon battery and on power cord.After trying after effects and premier pro I'll update my review
review_title: There is a bug in start button

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 12650H 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Rs Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
review: I was searching for a laptop which would serve me for long time. My last laptop was HP pavilion 15 and served me for 9 yrs and still running. My requirement was to get a laptop which would serve me for long time. I am not a regular game player. So, I looked for all options. Dell G 15 was on cards however when i was doing research I found out that at same price I was getting an i7 12 gen. I ordered this beast. Specs wise it's an i7 12th gen, RTX3050 4 GB, 512 GB SSD, 8 GB ram, 15,6 inch with a 144 Hz refresh rate. I chose to exchange an old dell laptop and got another discount of 10% on sbi credit card during ongoing sale. Exchange value was also decent.thanks to amazon for amazing delivery and exchange experience. I got the laptop in 3 days.I am not a professional user of a laptop however as soon as I got it, I edited few Go Pro videos and few dashcam videos. Soon after that I handled video editing for some work. This laptop worked like a breeze. It handled all the huge sized videos with ease. I also used it to project the display onto a data wall and to my surprise, it extended the display instead of normal duplication. It made my work easy as i was able to do my work in background without anyone in audience knowing about it. Till now its a great experience, Battery life is obviously lesser due to i7 and GPU but gaming laptops will have lesser battery life anyway. The display screen is also good. It did not hurt my eyes even after long working on the screen. It looks and feels good. Its not flimsy, it looks very dated and has a good venting and cooling system. It has a backlight keyboard as well and comes with office and windows 10 preloaded.Its a must buy and, in this price, its a win win situation.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad  Gaming  3 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg), 82K201UNIN
review: I've had it for just over 24 hours now and I've been putting under all kinds of stress tests and benchmarking tests to ensure there is no throttling or defects of any kind - so far everything works as expected. The display is definitely good (better than equivalent ASUS models). Will have to use it for a while to comment about its battery performance. The Lenovo vantage app didn't work at first, but a quick uninstall and reinstall fixed the issue and from there on I was able to fully test all three performance modes. The display has very minor backlight bleed towards the bottom, the rest appears just like regular IPS glow to me. The trackpad is pretty good. As far as games go, I've only tried Rocket League so far. Will update after trying some AAA titles in a week or so.Update: I've had it for 2 weeks now. Just want to post a quick update. The device has been great so far. It handles anything you throw at it effortlessly plus it stays relatively cool even when put it under stress (games, rendering etc.). I use a basic vertically elevated cooling pad with shitty fans and for me the CPU temps have never gone beyond 87-88 degrees even with air conditioning turned off. On cooler days or with A/C on, the CPU temps (under stress) with cooling pad stay right below 80. Battery backup for normal tasks is 4-6 hours. At this point, the only drawback I feel is the lack of extra USB ports - it has just 2 (might have to use a hub if you've got more USB devices to connect).
review_title: Just had it for one day so far.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad  Gaming  3 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg), 82K201UNIN
review: Using it since past 2 weeks. no problem face till now. 165hz display 1080p with 300 nits very nice colour accuracy with 100% srgb working smoothly. Thermal is great. Ryzen 5800 performing well. Getting fine battery backup around 4-5hrs for normal usage with 60 wh battery. keypad is best. mouse is ok. Sound quality is good and lenovo nahimic driver software provide customisation. Extra ram slot and ssd slot added advantage. web cam qaulity is average.  laptop build quality is good with hard plastic material.Received the laptop with manufacturing date of july 2022. I purchased it in October 2022 and initial warranty start date was from September 2022.Don't worry you have to register your laptop on lenovo website then it will update start date of warranty as per the purchase invoice.Cons -No RGB backlight on keyboard.Type C port not support for charging.Quit heavy in weight.Overall its best purchase under 90k. will update the review in long run.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad  Gaming  3 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg), 82K201UNIN
review: So this is my second gaming laptop, first one being the Legion Y520 (i5 7th gen, GTX 1050). That laptop lasted 6 years for me and is currently being used by my sister.Few reasons why I opted for this laptop in particular:CPU and GPU combination - Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3060 @90W TDPDisplay - 165Hz, 100% SRGBPrice: Got it for 89,990Originally I wanted the MSI Alpha 15 Advantage edition that has the same CPU, but comes with 8GB Radeon 6600M. It was slightly expensive and delivery by Flipkart was quite slow for my address, so I didn't go for it. There were 2 other options from MSI that have RTX 3060 and shipped with i7 CPU, but they did not have color accurate displays (45% color gamut). For these reasons Ideapad gaming 3 became the perfect pick for me and I am impressed with my purchase. Boot times are of course great and games load significantly fast, of course. I am planning to  add a 1TB SSD and additional 16GB RAM later which will improve the performance even further!Following games have been tested by me so far on ultra to medium settings:World of Warships - average FPS 100-120 @ ultra settingsWitcher 3 - 60 FPS on ultra settings. For some reason the FPS for this game are locked at 60A Plague Tale: Innocence - 90-120 FPS on medium to ultra settingsForza Horizon 4 -  did not have FPS enable at that time so could not see the actual FPS, but it looked great so I'll assume it was in the range mentioned aboveI am planning to try out more games and will update my review accordingly. But so far I am happy with my purchase and can recommend this laptop to future buyers with confidence. Trackpad is quite awesome too,  don't know though which driver it is using. Keyboard is great as well, but I use an external keyboard anyway so it does not matter to me. Speakers are satisfactory. They are placed at the bottom and deliver good sound both in terms of quality and loudness.The device is surprisingly lightweight which is a good thing! Build quality could have been better, but it is definitely not fragile. Keyboard is white backlit only, so no RGB lighting available. I am not into the fancy RGB lighting so it does not bother me at all. I am also thankful that it does not come with red lighting on the keyboard!Thank you Amazon for quick delivery (16 hours) and thank you Lenovo for this good product.Edit: I forgot the mention that I played for three hours straight and did not experience any kind of performance throttling. Boot up is almost instant which is expected. Note that it comes with 1x 16GB RAM and my laptop came with WD SN530 SSD. You have one more slot for RAM and SSD each and I've read somewhere that the laptop can support NVMe Gen 4 SSDs, but not sure whether that's true.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad  Gaming  3 AMD Ryzen 7 5800H 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/6GB NVIDIA RTX 3060/165Hz/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit/3months Game Pass/Shadow Black/2.25Kg), 82K201UNIN
review: Edit:DONT BE FOOLED BY 2 RAM SLOTSIT CAN TAKE A MAX IF 16GB RAM. SO THE ONLY UPGRADE POSSIBLE FOR THE 1x16GB MODEL IS CHANGING IT TO DUAL CHANNEL 2x8GB.Found out the hard and sad way, also confirmed with Lenovo.Old:The other review covers it very well, it will run whatever you throw at it.I left Red Dead Redemption 2 running for 20 hours straight. resumed playing still ran like butter.It comes with 2nd NVME slot but no screw so you'll have to procure it separately.Others count lack of RGB as a con, but I'll say White looks professional, wich goes with the overall look of the laptop, making it suitable for use in professional environments if you don't want everyone around you knowing you're a gamer.not being able to charge via the USB C is understandable with 170 W in the adaptor.90W TDP is boost TPG it will show lower but boosts it to 90W. remains cool without throttling even for longer heavy workloads, hint 20hours of RDR2.I recommend buying a 2nd NVME along with your purchase as you'll run out of 500 gigs quick.The included disk is a WD BLue SN530, not the best but good performance, not something you'll find slow in your daily usage unless your work is copying > 200 gig everyday.2Gig of the 16GB included ram go to VRAM .
review_title: Best buy for the money you spend < 90K

Name: ASUS TUF  Gaming  A15, 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 5 4600H, 4GB NVIDIA GeForce¬†GTX 1650,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.3 Kg), FA506IHRB-HN079W
review: Hello everyone here is the detailed review of Asus A15 TUF base variant I have extensively used it for more than 15 days now.1.) Performance/hardware - when it comes to Performance this machine is a real beast I simply have no complains as I did almost everything in it from editing huge videos to playing heavy games like GTA 5 on max settings for almost 5 hours continuously and haven't seen any lag in performance Ryzen 5 4600H coupled with Nvidia GeForce 1650 4gb graphics is a perfect combination for a midranger one could ever dream of in 2020 and best part is the new 512 gb SSD which is really superfast and give me an instant bootup in 7-8 seconds which is really impressive I simply have no complains with the hardware and the slots everything is perfect, the speakers are also quite good which really gives you a good listening experience and I gurranty you won't find all this at this price of 61K or even nearby this as most of the laptops till 75K are almost the same offering more or less same specifications like HP pavilion gaming or HP omen.2.) Display- my first impression when I saw this display was simply wowwwww believe me guys this laptop has got the one of the best Displays at this price bracket don't listen to the fake hype created on its display that it isn't good actually there is nothing like that yaa on paper this might not seem good to few guys especially sRgb value etc but believe me when you use it you fall in love with it actually one day when I was using my laptop suddenly my brother who is a professional creator came to see me he saw the new laptop and after that he started moving the cursor his first reaction was woww man this is 144hz display he was shocked as getting 144z display with this great specs in this price range was almost impossible then I compared my display with his Asus Rog I don't remember model name but it costed him almost 1 lakh 2 years back and you won't believe me mine display was much better than his in terms of everything he himself admitted this yaa this display isn't that color accurate so unless you are a content creator it won't affect you Infact you would fall in love with it see this laptop comes with a price of 61k and I gurranty you all laptops in this price range upto 85k comes with almost same display so there's isn't much difference now most of the guys are expecting an OLED 4k display at this price bracket which is almost impossible to get but yaa what you are getting is totally worth it.Rgb lighting keyboard takes your experience to next level it just makes this machine more beautiful especially when working in low light or dark.3.) Heating issues- see when you are buying a Lamborghini you won't complain that it makes big noise obviously when you have bought such a powerful machine it would heat up and that's normal with almost all the gaming laptops during heavy tasks they all go upto 85-90 degrees which is normal and these machines handle it well especially the AMD processors can bear upto 105 degrees few guys said that this laptop goes upto 95 degrees while gaming or doing heavy task I must say to them that there is an application called ryzen controller in which you can set temperature limit for 85 degrees and I gurranty it won't cross this limit ever without any loss in performance or gaming and it won't affect life of this laptop too I personally played GTA 5 on max settings for 4-5 hours continously and almost daily but I never faced any lag or performance drop even the temperature never crossed 80 degrees in my case when using ryzen controller and I was happy with it.4.) Battery life- yaa this that part which I hate the most about this laptop I didn't got that great battery life maximum 4-5 hours on normal minimal usage 2.5-3 hours watching movies and 1.5 hours max on gaming which I personally didn't liked but remember it's a gaming laptop and the day you decide to buy gaming laptop you have to make compromises with battery life as none of the gaming laptop would give you battery life equivalent to a professional laptops or notebooks when it comes to this laptop if you are doing gaming then I will only suggest you keep the turbo mode on and charger always connected with balanced battery settings from asus app this would be perfect combo if you try to do hardcore gaming without turbo mode then you might get some lags so make sure turbo mode is on and charger is always connected this is a big con in almost all the gaming laptops which I hate as I personally prefer big battery life in any device.5.) Webcam- it's not that good yaa keeping its price and specs in mind it won't affect you especially if you are a gamer but to be honest camera is ok not that good so unless you have to use the camera extensively most of the time it will work for you but if you are always busy up with camera I think then it would dissappoint you and you might need a new Webcam with it but I don't think this will be a deal breaker for you.6.) Build quality and looks- this machine is damn strong with military grade build which can bear a lot also its design is damn good and I would say if you planning to take it to college or any other place then you can easily carry it although it's bit heavy like most of the gaming laptops but to be honest I don't have any issues with its design and build quality I simply love it.7.) Brand value- at the end you get a brand value of asus and 1 year of warranty and as we all know how perfect and good asus laptops are it's another factor which convinced me to buy this beast.Final verdictüî•Believe me or not this is the best budget gaming laptop to buy in the current market steal this deal up as soon as possible and you won't regret in life even if you have 75k budget I would suggest you go for this as it would not only save your money but also give you almost same experience at a better price.

Name: ASUS TUF  Gaming  A15, 15.6-inch (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 5 4600H, 4GB NVIDIA GeForce¬†GTX 1650,  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.3 Kg), FA506IHRB-HN079W
review: I will skip on the repetitive comments in different reviews and mention only the things which were not mentioned there or didn't apply to the unit I received.1. In the user manual it is mentioned to charge the laptop 3 hours before the first use. This is to calibrate the battery and you will get decent battery backup. Gaming laptops have low battery backup because a major chunk of power is consumed by the dedicated GPU. Checked the MyAsus app on the laptop. They suggest using the laptop on direct power as much as possible, and for the maximum lifespan of the battery, they recommend max 60% charge, which the app can manage if you select the option.2. The display is bright enough, but there is some backlight bleeding, which is okay. You can check how much your unit has if you sit in a pitch dark room and are displaying only black colour on the whole screen, at full brightness. But know that you are not gonna get the best quality panels supporting 144 Hz Adaptive refresh rate at this price. Colour accuracy is only slightly off but looked good enough.People getting confused with the "IPS level" can set their minds at ease. "IPS" is a trademark of LG Philips which not everyone can use, but this is practically an IPS panel. It has great viewing angles. Keep it side by side to a TN (normal LCD) panel to see the difference. Blacks are way better than the normal LCD.3. Tried Hitman and PUBG Lite in max settings, and got no lag or ghosting. The air from the vents was hot while playing Hitman, but the laptop didn't feel warm anywhere except near the top intake vents where the VRMs are. Do note that I never turned on the turbo mode, as I don't think it makes sense to use overclocking on a device that is susceptible to heat too much.Also, nearly every GAMING laptop touches 90¬∞C, even the Intel ones. Nothing to worry, as AMD processors can take 5¬∞C more than Intel processors considering the maximum temperature limit.Update: Tried Watch Dogs 2 today, in Very High preset (ultra not supported in 4GB graphics). The CPU got to 94¬∞C for a second, in performance mode. Started Turbo mode, which pushes the fans to 5700 rpm, and brought the temperature to 80-82, with occasional spikes to 90¬∞C for 5-6 seconds. Didn't feel the fans were too loud. There were no throttling or frame drops, and the CPU was at 4 GHz and GPU was at 1695MHz throughout.Felt the air vents during this. There are intake vents even in the keyboard (check Asus launch video in CES). The vent at the back, in the centre, is also an intake vent.Along with the top intake vent, the keys 6,7, T and Y was also lukewarm to touch.4. No sticker bombs, no laptop bags included. Sticker bombs are only in Fortress grey model, and Asus is not giving bags with TUF A15 in India by default.5. The SSD in my unit is a WD SN530 NVME SSD, which is faaaaaast! One thing to note here that your unit may come with an SSD which is similar performing, but from a different manufacturer. This is a standard practice, as some part are supplied by multiple vendors and they are not advertised for the same reason. But they deliver similar performance.6. Remember registering the product at Asus warranty registration portal to update the warranty coverage period as per the date you bought it, and also to claim ongoing offers from asuspromo.in.7. While ordering it the serial number is updated in the printable order summary once your order is dispatched. Check the serial number on Asus warranty information portal to verify you are getting the right model. I had ordered this laptop before (17 Sept) and checked the serial number the day they dispatched. It was showing FX505, so I cancelled it the same day, and ordered again. I got the correct model now.8. Asus has allowed upgrading RAM, SSD, WiFi card and Hard Disk in warranty. Upgrades limited only to these components will not void it.9. Webcam is not good. Luckily I don't need it as much, and better than not having one at all.10. Facing a weird drivers issue, my usb 3 enable phone does not get detected on USB 3 ports. A combination of USB 2 & USB 3 device and port is working on all the ports. External hard disk which is USB 3 also works. (Update: Issue gone after system reset)11. It does have an inbuilt recovery partition. So in case you need to reset, no need to get into the clumsy process of creating a bootable usb and booting from it.
review_title: I had expected a good gaming laptop. Got a good gaming laptop.

review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†I searched for the highest end laptop I can find in this price range, and this was by far the winner after a week of searching. Nvidia RTX 3060 and AMD Ryzen 7 6800H (Latest version in the 6000 series yet, released just a few months ago) together make for a great gaming experience. I didn't have to use a cooling pad even on the highest game graphics settings, as the GPU temperature never reached maximum. I also use it for rendering images and animations in Blender, and the GPU performs unbelievably fast. The RGB keyboard changes colors constantly. This along with a sleek finish gives the laptop a premium feel. It comes with lifetime Office and Windows 11. It has USB Type-C ports in addition to the USB 3.2 ports, so you can easily connect your phone if you have a Type-C one. The GPU can serve any graphic intense work, so it's perfect for learning animation, working with animation professionally, or using it for daily college work. The battery is 90 WHrs, so it lasts for a long time and charges to full in minutes.
review_title: The best you can get for this price range

review: This exact same laptop costs about $4700 in the United States, if you convert that into rupees it comes around ‚Çπ3,85,000. Which is still a lot but now look at this. This model at this point of time in India costs around ‚Çπ6,00,000. Like why? ü§îWhy such unfair prices to Indian customers. I am very curious about how MSI tries to justify their answers. But I won't take away how good the laptop actually is. Even though it will probably drain your battery in less than 5 hours at high performance. It performs better than even a water cooled 3090Ti desktop with a 12900k (the best last GEN could offer). But is slower and less efficient to the newly launched M2 Max by apple in editing and web browsing. Overall the 4k mini-led screen paired with the RGB and cooling would still be of considerable value if sold below ‚Çπ4,00,000 today. As some of the components are only limited to a very small amount of laptops, even some desktops 2 years ago. So I rated it a two star. Please reduce the price if not then don't try to rip-off loyal customers. Apple products are starting to look reasonable at this rate. üòî

review: This is, hands down, the best decision I've ever made. And the box it came in is incredibly roomy too, which is a huge bonus, because I live in it now after buying it. Ghar walon ne nikaal diya.

Name: (Renewed) HP Victus AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 16.1 inches FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/4GB RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free Display/Windows 10/MS Office/Mica Silver/2.48 Kg), 16-e0076AX
review: The Laptop's build quality is solid deisgn is minimal, it doesn't have that gaming laptop's rainbow look. Which personally I don't like. Which makes this laptop blend in with office setting easily.RTX3050 with Ryzen 5600H is a killer combo! Although I would recommend to get the RAM upgraded to 16GB for heavy works and for games I haven't faced any issue with 8GB ram so far.Battery Backup is really good I average about 3-4hrs with miltimedia work, office works and browsing battery lasts upto 8-9hrs with brightness set to 50%. Thanks to 200w charger laptop gets fully charged in 1hr and 10min.The only let down is Display color accuracy this being a 45% NTSC I opted for IPS and 60fps because of Color Accuracy. Then I find out there is another version that has 72% NTSC. I mistakenly ordered the former one. Just keep this in mind while ordering.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: See if you were looking for a laptop that has good processor and a dedicated gpu but does not looks like a gaming laptop and gives premium looks and finish then this is the perfect option you are looking for.Pros :1. i5 12450h under 65k2. Keyboard and trackpad are amazing3. Has all the necessary ports4. Display is really great and 144hz is just awesome.5. Ram is upgradable to 16gb ( it has one 8gb and the other slot is empty so you just have to buy an 8gb ddr4 3200mhz ram and intall it)6. Read and write speeds are also good as it has a Gen 4 Nvme SSD. ( upgradable to 2TB)7. Games also run really smoothly as it has a dedicated gpu GTX 1650. I tried Valotant and GTA 5, both gives great fps and lag free performance.8. Charging is really fast as it comes with a 150 Watt fast charger.Cons :1. The screen wobbles which sometimes feels annoying.2. Fan noise is present when you are gaming which can be turned off but you will get low performance after turning off fan noise. But cooling is really nice.Note : If you are looking for good battery life in a gaming laptop it is very much impossible as 99% gaming laptops use H-series processors that consume power and does not give good battery backup.If you play games simply connect to the adapter and play any game you want.Doing normal task and buying it for college life, then you can get decent battery backup.  No problem in that.No major cons apart from these two.You can go for it. It is worth buying and you will not regret after buying it.

review: I recently got this laptop and I am beyond impressed with its performance.Firstly, the design is sleek and modern. The display is absolutely stunning, offering a clear and vibrant image with excellent color accuracy. The anti-glare feature is also a bonus, as it minimizes reflections and glare, making it easier to use the laptop for extended periods.The performance is where this laptop truly shines. This laptop is incredibly fast and can handle even the most demanding tasks with ease. The SSD provides ample storage space for all my games, files, and applications, and the graphics card delivers exceptional performance for gaming and other graphics-intensive tasks.The refresh rate and brightness make the screen incredibly responsive and provide a smooth and enjoyable gaming experience. Additionally, the laptop comes pre-installed with Windows 11 and MS Office, making it easy to get started with work or play right out of the box.
