Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11  Gaming  Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: First, this laptop comes with i7 H-Series processor which is hungry of power.Second, this laptop has RTX graphics which required too much power, which can discharge the 100% battery of 3 cell and 56 WHr within 100 minutes.But there is option it increase its battery time ( while general purpose like surfing, streaming)1. Go to Device Manager and Disable RTX Graphics under Display Adapter.2. Switch to battery saver mode.I guarantee you will get more than 4 hours of battery life (may vary when you connected with internet).This device is fitted with Realtek Speakers and having Realtek HD Sound driver WaveMaxxAudio which also process on high frequency that means consume lots of power and increases surface temperature, so fans run continuously ( so, use laptop on flat surface for better ventilation ) which consumes battery.3. You can also disable WavesMaxxAudio service through Task Manager under Startup Section, then restart the laptop.Note:- By Disabling WavesMaxxAudio, sound quality will decrease significantly. So, do it on your as per needs.Although, this is great laptop for an Engineering Student, Video Editing, and Even for medium graphics Game Development for 2D Games like Mario.But I'll prefer a PC for Serious Video Editing and Gaming.

Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11  Gaming  Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: Expensive price, Dell store offering less with same model, configuration, with bag.Warranty starts from date of customer purchase, not Amazon purchase

Name: Dell G15 5520 Windows 11  Gaming  Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 16GB, 512Gb, NVIDIA RTX 3050 Ti (4GB GDDR6), 15.6" - 39.62Cms FHD WVA AG 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange, Shadow Grey, 2.81Kgs - D560823WIN9B
review: I did not purchase this laptop from amazon as it was not available at that time here. If someone is looking for a powerful laptop within medium budget then this machine is wonderful.1) The CPU is I7-12700H with 14 cores and 20 threads. Any work is executed smoothly without any hitches. 2) People looking for running multiple virtual machines simultaneously will be very pleased. I have tested with 6 VMs running simultaneously and truth be told, the laptop performs wonderfully well without any lags. 3) 16GB of DDR5 RAM is good enough for most work including latest AAA titled games. There is option to upgrade upto 32GB but it is a very costly affair right now. 4) The RTX 3050Ti is quite good for mid-tier gaming needs. Tons of youtube videos backup this point. However, for high level gaming this is not ideal. 5) The laptop gets noticeably warm even when doing normal tasks. However, while under intensive workload (CPU, GPU or both) the machine does get very hot. So, a good quality cooler is a must for those who intend to do intensive work for long periods of time.6) Alienware command center needs to be running in order to use the Game Shift tech (Fn + F9).7) Display Quality is ok - I expected a better display at this price.8) The integrated webcam does not have a privacy shutter which is drawback at this price point.9) The mouse click on the trackpad is a 2-stage affair. You have to click quite hard and will be able to feel the 2 stage click procedure.10) After purchase, the initial setup process is a quite cumbersome. High speed internet is a requirement it seems. Tons of updates (Including drivers from dell website), windows updates are separate lots of setups (Nvidia panel updates separately), bloatware (McAfee) really is confusing for anyone not well versed with these things.11) The hinges seem quite good. We can lift the lid with one finger. There is very little wobble on the lid.Note - Battery Backup : This is  huge problem. Battery gets drained incredibly fast. Even under almost no workload battery drains out totally in around 90 minutes. This is really not good for laptop costing above‚Çπ1 Lac. If I had any idea about this issue, I would not have purchased this model. I understand that the laptop is powerful, but if battery drains out in less than 2 hours even when machine is idling then it is not good.If someone is willing to work on this machine while connected to AC power, then this is a really powerful machine. In higher end laptops, the GPU and build quality will be obviously better. But, the CPU and RAM is top grade which means that most work is done without problem.
review_title: Very Powerful Laptop but Battery Backup is a big concern.

Name: HP Pavilion AMD Ryzen 5-4600H, 15.6 Inches 144 Hz Fhd Screen  Gaming  Laptop (8 Gb Ram, 4 Gb Nvidia 1650Ti Graphics, 1Tb HDD + 256 Gb Ssd, Windows 10 Home with Advanced Thermal Management, 1.98Kg)
review: Upon lot of deliberation gone with this one and thankfully so, I am happy with what I got! Did lots of research and found out that we must compromise on something in 70K range. This is a value for money deal I believe. Found out there are some issues in competition like screen bleeding, so thought to stay away from other brands in this price range.You get Ryzen 4600h 5th gen (don't ne fooled by previous gen offers from others), 8gb RAM, SATA+SSD hard drives, backlit keyboard and important of all 144Hz screen. Initially my thoughts were what is the use of 144Hz screen but boy, it does make difference! Everything from browsing, gaming, typing and all windows animations look butter smooth. Very happy that I went for 144Hz screen! it's a bang for the buck and if you think it's a useless feature I beg to differ. I quiet like the design as well, before buying I was skeptical but in fact it works. Screen has a floating feel to it, and it is a tad bit taller than other laptops because of thicker chin. This makes the screen taller and it is in fact much better. You don‚Äôt have to slouch lower to stare at the screen. I would say the design elements are very ergonomic for day to day use. Additionally, with the processor, RAM and GPU combo highly unlikely that you will face a problem with processing power. No complaints there! The laptop is a bit heavy and feels bulky, but I guess that is Ok since it is a gaming laptop. Heat sinks are nice as well. The fans and the design keep the laptop cool. You feel the fans working with heavy processing, though it is not too intrusive. Backlit keyboard is a boon if you want to keep working and/or playing through the night without disturbing others. I like plain white backlit keyboard as in this one, it is classy and works best rather than any other very flashy color. Power button is backlit too. There are no glossy bits and I prefer that way; it looks clean and doesn‚Äôt feel fingerprint magnets. My previous laptop was glossy, and it used to attract everything. WebCam is okayish, can‚Äôt complain or write anything positive about it. It does the job.Surprisingly, keyboard is very nice to type on, decent travel and feels sturdy without worrying too much you can exploit it for fast typing. Although the build is all round plastic, overall the build feels sturdy. Let‚Äôs see how it fairs in the long run! Overall the impressions are positive for the laptop.I would advice to go with this one since there are no compromises at this price range. You get good processor (hexa core), GPU combo with decent RAM (can be upgraded later to 16Gb), combo hard disks SSD+SATA (SATA is clocked to 7200 rpm which is fast, others are providing 5400 rpm)! Plus, you get Wi-Fi 6 and Bluetooth 5, competition offers Wi-Fi 5 and Bluetooth 4! Although with my old router, I thought, I wouldn‚Äôt be able to notice net speed, but internet feels snappy on this device than my wife‚Äôs last year purchased Lenovo laptop. Only downside is, it has only 2 USB ports, I solved this by buying 220 rupees USB hub üòâ Type C, card reader slots however work fine, you get an ethernet port as well which is missing from so many recent laptops. Though the prices of laptops are going up with work from home being the norm now, I recommend investing in this. This would work another 4-5 years minimum for sure.

Name: HP Pavilion AMD Ryzen 5-4600H, 15.6 Inches 144 Hz Fhd Screen  Gaming  Laptop (8 Gb Ram, 4 Gb Nvidia 1650Ti Graphics, 1Tb HDD + 256 Gb Ssd, Windows 10 Home with Advanced Thermal Management, 1.98Kg)
review: Probably the best rig for its price range, especially if this is your first gaming setup, or . After weeks and weeks of searching for the right laptop, I came across this and saw that 64,5k was getting me what sounded like a blistering experience (even with my limited knowledge of computer hardware at the time).ProcessorThe Ryzen 5-4600H this laptop comes with is currently 1 generation behind the latest lineup sold by AMD, but nonetheless it is an absolute bang for buck. It works flawlessly- everyday applications load at an instant, and performance-heavy games (Destiny 2, Control, Rocket League, Just Cause 3) load in about 20  seconds or less. This processor also has a huge market share, and is very popular. Of course, it's also blisteringly fast. It's even said to outperform previous-gen Intel core i7s!Graphics Processing Unit / GPUThe GTX 1650 is an excellent entry-level graphics card. AAA titles run fine on medium settings, Minecraft with shaders can run at 80-120 FPS on average. It won't run all games at the best graphic settings, but considering what you get, it's phenomenal. I personally think the investment for the1650Ti isn't worth the 8k-10k additional spending. The performance improvement for the Ti is not worth the money, as far as I've seen from reviews on Amazon.StorageThe laptop comes with a hybrid-drive storage setup, where you have the faster but smaller SSD and the slower but larger HDD. In this case the setup is a 256 GB SSD with a 1 TB HDD.SSDs ensure faster (in this case extremely fast) computer boot-up times, and the hard disk, while slower in terms of storage, gives you the opportunity to store more games. So the total storage space is around 1100-1200 GB, which will get you by for years if you keep your storage usage in check.Other factorsScreen/monitor - 144 Hz refresh rate! Extremely smooth. There is a very noticeable visual difference between 60 Hz and 144 Hz. It's amazing, and it really adds to the gaming experience. Everything looks better. If you play fast-paced FPS titles, you will find that the higher refresh improves your success rates (admittedly only marginally) because the monitor will visually update more often and you'll be able to see more of what happens in front of you in-game.Sound - Good, better than what you'd expect from standard, in-built speakers. Plenty of base, reasonable clarity. The B&O audio control app comes standard, which is a nice-to-hav,e though personally I don't use it much.RAM - 8 GB is good enough for many games, though obviously for optimal performance you may like to install another 8 GB stick for a total of 16 GB. However with a browser like Chrome open, memory usage can hover between 60%and 80%.The only disadvantage here is that the maximum supported memory is 16 GB, making it unsuitable for very high-end editing, 3D modelling and other creative work. The standard for laptops is 8GB RAM nowadays, and naturally upgrading your RAM will give you an edge.AestheticsThe laptop is made of plastic, but it looks good overall regardless. The back-length of the laptop is angular, and there's a cool looking polygon motif around the speaker area in front of the keyboard. It's a nice touch. The keys are backlit with white lights. Sadly there is no RGB option, unlike the competing Acer Nitro laptops. I don't think I need to mention this but Windows 10 is a nice-looking operating system.TLDR/conclusionAll in all, if you're an emergent gamer, this is an excellent purchase and a laptop seriously worth considering. While in terms of hardware it doesn't compete with top-of-the-line gaming rigs, it has excellent value for money. Buy it either standard or on-sale, as I feel both are worth your money.
review_title: It feels illegal to buy something this good for such an affordable price range

Name: MSI Katana GF76, Intel 11th Gen. i5-11400H, 43CM FHD 144Hz Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GTX1650 4GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), 11SC-847IN

Name: MSI Katana GF66, Intel 12th Gen. i5-12450H, 40CM FHD 144 Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia RTX3060 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.25Kg), 12UE-1001IN
review: The first item I received had a touchpad issue and amazon replaced it with another one which doesn't have any issue. Let's come to the pros and cons of this laptop.Pros:1. You can play all latest games. I've tested GTA V, God of war, uncharted 4, Red dead 2, AC Valhalla.2. Display is good3. Touchpad is smooth4. Battery backup is good5. i5 12th gen provides excellent performance. If you're confused between i5 12th gen and i7 11th gen, you can go for i5 12th gen as you can get similar performance at a lower price.Cons:1. Speaker is bit low. You can use Nahimic app to raise the volume a bit higher or use headphones.2. Heating issue is there while playing games. But it's expected considering it is a gaming laptop with rtx 3060. Cooling pad is must (I bought winplus cooling pad with 6 fans which is quite powerful and sturdy).Overall, this laptop is a bang for the buck.
review_title: This is the best RTX 3060 laptop you can get at this price

Name: MSI Katana GF66, Intel 12th Gen. i5-12450H, 40CM FHD 144 Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia RTX3060 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.25Kg), 12UE-1001IN
review: It comes with a rtx 3060 which at this price point is a great deal....initially I thought the gpu runs at 85 w TDP but after checking properly it's runs at 105 w TDP which helps run any modern AAA games at 70-120 fps ultra settings......ok and apart from gaming  you can easily program ,do office work,edit 4k video etc...it also has pcie gen4 ssd which is really fast for transferring files.....the display of this laptop is average it has 144 hz full hd panel with 350 nits brightness....the only downside about this laptop for me is the battery life.with normal usage like programming or watching YouTube it completely drains out within 2 hrs....And one more thing I would like to mention is that ,it comes with a 16 A charging adapter for the 240 W charger.
review_title: Best gaming laptop you can buy

Name: Honor MagicBook 14, AMD Ryzen 5 5500U 14-inch (35.56 cm) FHD IPS Anti-Glare Thin and Light Laptop (16GB/512GB PCIe SSD/Windows 11/Fingerprint Login/Metal Body/Backlit KB/1.38Kg), Gray, NobelM-WFQ9AHNE
review: Design-sleek metallic body, incredibly thin and lightweight, love the designs and the colour finish is great too.Keyboard and trackpad-decent amount of travel in the keys, the trackpad is large enough to with use substitute a mouse.Display-HD display colours look vibrant and brightness is good too , could get a bit hard to use out in the open especially in a sunny day but works perfectly fine indoors in any lighting condition. Matt finish on the screen does a good job of avoiding glare.Speakers-average could've improved on it, you won't get much bass through it, better to be paired with headphones.System-pretty fast laptop can handle multiple tasks at once even run heavy games at medium settings, haven't tried running editing softwares on it yet, will update after I do.Add.-fingerprint sensor works almost instantlyCamera quality is ok too, I don't use it much so not a deal breaker for me but something to know.In all great budget laptop will work plenty well if you're a student or a normal office worker.
review_title: One of the best laptops you can get at these price range.

review: I purchase laptop after many years. This is the best buy. Believe me i searched almost many laptops on flipkart and amazon. I am impressed with the build, performance. People are writing bed reviews but this is my suggestions to go for this laptop. The laptop looks is very premium. The laptop also supports PD charging. I played PUBG on this laptop and there are only few frame drops.

Name: Honor MagicBook 14, AMD Ryzen 5 5500U 14-inch (35.56 cm) FHD IPS Anti-Glare Thin and Light Laptop (16GB/512GB PCIe SSD/Windows 11/Fingerprint Login/Metal Body/Backlit KB/1.38Kg), Gray, NobelM-WFQ9AHNE
review: Got it for 41000 during a deal. I had been looking for a laptop in the price range of 1-1.2 lakh for some time now. Was waiting for AMD 7040U series to come to India. I bought this laptop for a relative and after using it for a week before handing it over to them i was just blown away. My main concern was battery life and this laptop gave 10 + hours of mixed world uses on battery everyday. I never thought that in something this cheap the battery life could be this good. the CPU is excellent specially the integrated graphics. played Valorant on this. Had a similarly priced core i3 10th gen laptop for comparison with equal ram size. I was getting around 90 fps on the intel version and battery life of 4 hours only. On this i got 150 fps on average and many of my general tasks which are based on CAD based application run very well. I was actually inclined to just buy this again for myself as its well within half of my budget and is capable to handle my daily workflow but decided to wait for zen4 based laptop because ryzen zen4 is even more efficient.
review_title: In this price range nothing comes close.

Name: Honor MagicBook 14, AMD Ryzen 5 5500U 14-inch (35.56 cm) FHD IPS Anti-Glare Thin and Light Laptop (16GB/512GB PCIe SSD/Windows 11/Fingerprint Login/Metal Body/Backlit KB/1.38Kg), Gray, NobelM-WFQ9AHNE
review: Well when I received this laptop I noticed it had already new drive (d) of 314GB which I didn't create and when I checked the BIOS version date, I got to know it was opened 11 months ago also so I'm about to replace this but still this is best laptop at this price of under 45k
review_title: I recieved a used one so always cheak Bios version date or u will get less warranty

review: I bought this laptop thinking there would be HDD port but sadly there is none... Not even a SSD or extra nvme port... So now I'm stuck with using it with just 512gb and an external HDD... The screen is nice but not too bright, the keypad and track pad feels nice, the laptop is fast with good specs but the battery loses juice very fast... 2 and half hours during laptop setup the battery went from 90% to zero... All in all if you're planning to buy this laptop, remember that there is no extra port for HDD or nvme and the battery runs out fast so you will have to be connected most of the time... Also, the camera is not working...AFTER FIVE MONTHS: Sadly the battery deteriorated fast... It went from 100-0% after watching just youtube videos on Chrome for 1hr 30mins...

review: 60 days review:Had read reviews of people saying screen was not good and service was not good product was not good so, was skeptical about buying this at first and was hesitant as well but given the configuration and my desperate need to upgrade I bought it anyways as I could depend on Amazon to return it if it was defective. And let me tell you I'm glad I made this purchase. It is a beast that can handle anything that you throw at it the screen is pretty decent for its price range and compared to its competitors. Plus the additional warranty that I got due to promotion offer helps alot. As far as the online customer  care service goes, they were agreeable with response time. The only issue I face is with software as I updated windows right after I got it (big mistake) now my laptop doesn't recognize headphone mic (aux port only) even after trying to update drivers. Everything else is golden includingbuilt-inmic and Bluetooth mic. Hopefully it'll get fixed with next window's update.
review_title: Was skeptical about buying at first...

Name: MSI Gaming Pulse GL66, Intel 11th Gen. i7-11800H, 40CM QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 10 Home/Nvidia RTX 3070 8GB GDDR 6/Grey/2.25Kg), 11UGK-431IN
review: Finally I have fulfilled my dream of purchasing a proper gaming laptop. Earlier, I had Asus TUF FX505 laptop. But with latest games, it struggles. So after lots of research, i purchased this one. Here are my impressions :1- Screen is amazing and beautiful to look at. A QHD screen with 165 hz screen which has 100 % DCI-P3 coverage is fantastic to look at.2- Silent operation during normal work3- Powerful gaming performance at 4k. With most latest games, I am getting 60 fps even in high & ultra settings.4-Laptop itself is very light weight for the configuration. But charger is very heavy.5- MSI is providing 3 Years Warranty is registered now. So total protection for at least 3 Years6- Build quality is fantasticOnly thing missing from this laptop is HDMI 2.1 or Thunderbolt 4 supported Type C  port. That would have made it perfect.Getting a i7 11800H CPU & RTX 3070 laptop with QHD screen is a fantastic deal at this price.Highly recommended

Name: MSI Gaming Pulse GL66, Intel 11th Gen. i7-11800H, 40CM QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 10 Home/Nvidia RTX 3070 8GB GDDR 6/Grey/2.25Kg), 11UGK-431IN
review: ‚Äú THINK TWICE before choosing MSI products due to SUBSTANDARD PRODUCT QUALITY & HIGHLY UNRELIABLE HARDWARE COMPONENTS ‚ÄúI had purchased MSI Gaming Laptop Pulse GL66, Intel 11th Gen. i7-11800H in the month of July‚Äô22 and within a very short time of normal usage, LCD & LVDS display issues were encountered in the month of Oct‚Äô22 to which MSI India customer care & service team informed that the entire display unit has to be replaced under warranty.As I have shelled out a huge penny to purchase a 'defect free product' & not a 'defect prone product' and when a manufacturing / product defect is noticed within a short time of usage, I cannot simply accept for a product repair as per MSI policy as currently I have already lost the value for this product since the factory seal has been opened, minor scratches can be noticed post repair, laptop screen open & close feel is completely different from what it was before the repair & finally the factory fit & finish is hampered. As a customer, why should I bear all these losses when there is no fault of mine.It was not a small issue to just let it off & get repaired under warranty, whereas the entire display unit & lvds was kaput within this short-time of usage which questions me on the MSI product quality & reliability and now post warranty repair, the product has lost its value as mentioned above.Note: As per the mail communication, MSI policy states "As per MSI policy, refund or replacement can be done within 7 working days from the point of purchase. We do have only after repair services only."Also, even if the product defect / fault is from MSI‚Äôs end, their policies are in such a way that they are all favorable to the company and not the customer who is at no fault as in my case. "ETHICALLY" speaking why should I accept a faulty repaired product when I have paid, purchased and trusted on MSI product considering it to be a defect free.‚ÄúHence, I would suggest all the prospect buyers to rethink on your decision before purchasing MSI products so that you would not regret post purchase after shelling out your hard-earned money.‚Äù#msi_india #MSI #MSICare @MSICares @msitweets #MSIupdates #MSItips #gaminglaptop #GamingLaptop #MSIGAMING #laptop #premium #Laptop

review: Hello friends, I bought in GIF sale 16gb variant, and I bought 1tb ssd as well. Now coming to the performance... So lets go1. Ryzen 7 4800h is fantastic processor I must say it boots up in 8-9secs.2. 90whr battery is beast. will get good backup than any other gaming laptops. We get Armoury crate, and can customise it as per our needs.3. Rtx 3050 is capable processor of almost handling anything no doubt.4. Display viewing angles is good. 144hz refresh rate is upto the mark.5. Sound is good, if you not getting good than you can customise on Dts sound app.6. Rgb keyboard is looking cool.Now my opinion- Under 75k it is the one of the best laptop with military grade built and all the features, I suggest you to purchase 1tb ssd because 512gb ssd is  ot enough. 16gb samsung dual channel ram is great. It can handle everyrhing easily. So anyone want to buy laptop under 70k, I recomend you to increase 2k more and get this. you will get all round performance. I f anyone facimg any issue, than dont worry it is temporary you will get solutions on youtube. Even any laptop can have that issues because sometimes they are software bugs.I hope it helps.
review_title: Best in this price. Mind Blowing!!

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6"(39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 7 4800H, 4GB NVIDIA¬†GeForce¬†RTX¬†3050 Graphics, Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.3 kg), FA506IC-HN005W
review: Hardware is good . Display specifically  is great  but it has too many software issues (kinda regretting buying this now)  .  It is great on paper . good display , good refresh rate  and all that stuff you need for gaming ( and can handle everything else )  but then I gradually  started finding a lot of defects with user experience .All of these occur  at random instances but never once while gaming1. System freezes completely  . only option to force a restart2. Wifi disappears -  wifi disconnects and the button including the network adapter settings from the system settings disappears completely as if it wasn't present at all . network status shows " not operational"3 . lockscreen takes too long to respond . - I keep pressing keys , moving the mice to wake up the system from sleep mode but sometimes it takes too long to suspect a freeze on lockscreenAll of these can be fixed with software updates from asus and god knows when they'll provide one
review_title: Great when it works but has software issues

Extreme Gaming needs better cooling , either buy a cooling pad or use in AC environment (24¬∞C to 27¬∞C is good) .Till now I have used :-‚Ä¢ Blender (created a forest, Donut, on Cycle Engine with enabled OpticX ) Thanks to RTX .....render speed is good but needed more RAM for processing...suggestions- 32 GB if using Blender or any other 3D software.‚Ä¢ Days Gone (High settings)[without any cooling]‚Ä¢ Forza Horizon 4 (Maximum settings)[in AC room]‚Ä¢ Battlefield 1 (Maximum settings)[without any cooling]‚Ä¢ Ace Combat 7 (Maximum settings)[without any cooling]‚Ä¢ Call of Duty MW Remastered (Maximum settings)[without cooling]Conclusion:-Pros1. Processor is a overkill.2. Graphics is upto mark (Price = Hardware)3. MUX is a relief as for battery saving. (Radeon Graphics is also works pretty fine)4. Webcam (0.9 mp) is .....ah....better than most Gaming laptops at this price range .( atleast some laptop doesn't offer webcam)Cons:-1. Screen bleed2. Should Better cooling system3. Should have added more RAM and storage (8 GB is the new normal in today's world and 512 gb of SSD is never enough)Wow you reached here So it's upto you my fellow review reader ....... Screen started to catch sticky dust.4. Screen bleed now doesn't affect me any more .5. It was heavy to use the laptop in my lap at the start but I got a habit of it now and no worries.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 10th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA GTX 1650/120Hz/Windows 10/Backlit Keyboard/Onyx Black/2.2Kg), 81Y401APIN
review: Damn good product for 47000 rupees. I bought in big billion day sale. Also exchanged my old VAIO for 10000 rupees so effective price was 37k which was outstanding. AAA rating high quality PC games run comfortably under low to mid settings in 1280√ó720p under a safe temparature of 78¬∞C. But if u want to play it in FULL HD and high settings the game will run without any issue but temparature is going beyond 90¬∞C which is very unsafe. So practically play in low/mid settings with 720p resolution. Video/photo editing or rendering 3D designing is not an issue, it controls all those application like a boss. So within 50k budget in Oct 22 this is the best budget alrounder. Built quality, display and speakers are top notch.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 10th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA GTX 1650/120Hz/Windows 10/Backlit Keyboard/Onyx Black/2.2Kg), 81Y401APIN
review: Overall its a great laptop if you are a college student and a casual gamer.Pros- 1) Performance wise its a descent device, AAA tittles run smooth AF without noticeable lag. 2) 120 hz is a bliss, I mean after using this display you just hate the normal laptop and you will notice lag in 60hz.3) Sleek design and minimalist look will give it a nice touch.4) overall a good buy and good gaming laptop, you wont need other anytime soon.Cons-1) Its heats alott, especially if you play AAA tittles it just sounds like its gonna take off, but yeah keyboard is also so hot to touch and forget about touching the back of laptop.2) Display brightness is okayish, it should be more brighter.3) They should provide MS Office along with it but I didnt get it so yeah.Final verdict-If you are a student who plays casually, just buy a good bluetooth mice and thats it.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 10th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA GTX 1650/120Hz/Windows 10/Backlit Keyboard/Onyx Black/2.2Kg), 81Y401APIN
review: Gaming experience is fantastic

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad Gaming 3 Intel Core i5 10th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Gaming Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA GTX 1650/120Hz/Windows 10/Backlit Keyboard/Onyx Black/2.2Kg), 81Y401APIN
review: I purchased this laptop for 55k, you can even wait if the price drops to 53 or 54 k also. Literally, this is a beast gaming laptop at this amazing price segment. The battery drains a bit faster but that isn't a big issue untill you are using a gaming laptop for office or college work. The worst part about this is it's speakers. They are just pathetic. I have a six year old lenovo laptop that still has double sound than this one. But yeah, using headphones while gaming would neutralise this untill you are watching movies or web series. Also I have tried premiere pro, blender and after effects, they work fine. Not even a bit lag when used 3 -5 layers. I haven't tried more than this. Fans are impressive and yes the best thing is the single blue colour backlight keyboard.Conclusion: If you want gaming laptop at 55k budget then surely go for this. AMD is surely a beast but not for long term guys. Intel is way more long lasting and good in terms of heat dissipation.
review_title: Nice Laptop for a decent price

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax
review: Ok thanks for good service

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax
review: Bought HP Victus 16-0351AX for 81,990 INR on 26.03.22The seller was Appario and the delivery was fulfilled by Amazon. Extensive packaging, fast (less than 48hrs) and safe delivery.Cons:1) The YouTubers were right when they said the display wobbles. My high-speed ceiling fan was enough to make it wobble. If that's a deal breaker for you, skip the Victus lineup.2) The display rendered colours too warmly. White web pages were rendered cream-coloured. This isn't a problem cuz we could calibrate it ourselves from the display settings, but it's odd that this wasn't done out of the box.3) The backlight on the keyboard is blindingly bright. I couldn't find any option to adjust the brightness.4) The battery life is mediocre. Need to charge it at least twice a day if you're gonna spend most of your waking hours on it.Pros:1) The specification on both Amazon and HP's websites claimed this specific model (16-0351AX) had the RTX 3050 GPU. But the one I got was the RTX 3050 ti (the more powerful version of the 3050).2) The keyboard has a clean style (I like the font of the letters on the keys) and is well spaced. Good tactile feedback. The touchpad is large, smooth, and functional.3) The processor, Ryzen 7 5800H, is unbelievably powerful. Did some light gaming (Football Manager 2021, and Counter Strike: Global Offensive). Checked HP's built-in Omen software to see how the GPU, CPU, and RAM were faring. The GPU (avg around 45¬∞C) and RAM were at 50%, but the CPU was barely troubled (around 10-15%, avg around 38¬∞C). Unbelievably powerful. The thermals are designed well, nothing got too hot. The fans are set to 'auto', and I could barely hear them. They're pretty quiet and non-intrusive. I toggled the fan speed to 'Max' from HP's Omen settings just to check if they run. When set to max, they're loud and powerful enough to be used as a table fan.I intend to play more demanding games, will update this review after a while.4) HP's calling this the Mica Silver colour. It's matte black. They should just call it matte black. It's neat, understated, and minimalistic. When most gaming laptops look like they're part of the traffic signal lights, you can carry this variant to business meetings and not look like a clown.5) Comes with Microsoft Office 2019. I wasted a few minutes looking for a product key on the laptop and its packaging. But that's not necessary. Just open the Microsoft Word application and it'll auto-verify the in-built product key.6) The anti-reflective coating on the display is great.7) The 512GB SSD here is fast. There's a vacant NVME slot in the laptop too, so can add another 512GB SSD if necessary.8) HP collaborated with Dropbox to give 100gb free cloud storage for a year for those who bought this laptop.
review_title: If you're okay with a wobbly display, then this laptop is a phenomenal purchase.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax
review: Best Gaming laptop ever .No words needed to explain such beast

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax
review: This is the only review you all need to come across.Build and Design - The build quality is good, and the materials used are fine. There is some flex at the center of the keyboard but nothing major. The design is very understated and looks clean in my opinion. The screen wobbles but not as much to render it unusable. The HDMI port connects directly to the NVIDIA graphics, bypassing OptimusScreen - Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra for the 100%srgb variant of the display, you will seriously thank your eyes. The display is very nice with good colors and solid brightness. The 250 nits variant will disappoint you guys, it's not *just* 50 nits less than the 300 nits variant. Nit count is not linear, it's logarithmic. The display out of the box had a slightly yellow tinge but than can easily be fixed in the AMD software.Performance and thermals - The R7 5800H does not break a sweat no matter what you throw at it. It's so darn fast that it almost bottlenecks the RTX 3050. In other words, the RTX 3050 would be sweating at 100% usage while the r7 5800h would be chilling at 25% usage. Talking about thermals, the CPU does reach 100 degrees Celcius if you are playing a demanding game(Ryzen chips go up to 105 degrees) but it's nothing to worry about. The WASD area stays cool. The fans will make noise and if you are in a quiet environment, I would recommend a pair of headphones for a better experience.Battery Life - Don't expect wonders here, 4-5 hours on light usage. Maybe 6 hours if you change it to 60hz but nothing too special.Some things I did not like: 1. The bottom bezel could have been smaller 2. The keyboard backlight is blindingly bright, there is no option to toggle the brightness of those LEDs, It's just on or off. 3. 2 USB ports on the right side 4. It's heavy (but that's subjective)Software Included - MS Office 2021 [Lifetime] Dropbox 100GB [1 year] ExpressVPN [1 month] AlexaAll in all, a solid laptop. 8.5/10
review_title: Good laptop for 1080p gaming but not on ultra, it will hit its VRAM limits

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest AMD Ryzen 7-5800H 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/ 512GB SSD/4Gb RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free/144Hz Display/B&O/Backlit Kb/Win 11/MSO/Xbox Pass) 16-e0351ax
review: Its the very first laptop of my life and it didn't disappoint me as I find it the smoothest and fastest gaming machine with an excellent display, lag free usage and monster gaming performance which one can further tweak for extreme gaming. It dessipates huge amount of heat though, which can be around 90-99¬∞C while playing games at ultra settings (RDR2 for eg.) and requires power adapter to be plugged in. Can understand this as battery alone cannot withstand the energy consumption by all components. The battery performance is average and can last to around 4-5 hours without gaming. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.

Name: ASUS ROG Strix G15 Advantage Edition, 15.6-inch (39.62 cm) WQHD 165Hz/3ms, AMD Ryzen 9 5980HX, 12GB RX¬†6800M Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2.5 Kg), G513QY-HQ032WS
review: Review after 9 months of usage. Got it from the Asus website in Jan 2022 specifically for Elden Ring (my 5yr old laptop was slowing down). Was able to play Elden Ring at the highest settings after recent game updates.I was able to play most games at highest settings possible, for certain games you'll have to learn to optimize the settings on your own though. eg. Red dead redemption 2, had to optimise the graphics settings to get a consistent frame rate at 75fps even though the game is optimized for AMD cards. Older games run absolutely smooth.Usage info: you need to have an understanding of drivers and how to install/re-install them to make this laptop work for you.Make sure to buy a laptop stand with fans as this one generates a lot of heat.Even the ambient room temp can cause problems especially above 30¬∞, so sometimes you'll have to run the AC to cool things down.Since it doesn't have a camera you should buy one separately (inbuilt cameras are bad either way). I got a good deal on an Asus promotional site for a HP module, check YouTube videos for thr info. Also got extended warranty from there at a big discount. The Asus store listing is 155k but 10k higher on Amazon for some reason (scalping probably )Pros: because of the AMD cards it is quite cheaper compared to intel+Nvidia laptops,12GB of graphics ram is overkill and worth it in the long run.Solid build and good design.Asus rewards available at times for redemption for games.Cons: 1) this comes with a Mediatek wifi card which tends to stop working and take lower internet speeds than what is available. eg i have a 150Mbps connection yet it was maxing out at 10Mbps when i first used it. You'll need to solve this problem on your own through upgrading the driver software and using certain cmd commands to reset some settings.2) Asus software optimizations are lacking compared to its Lenovo Legion counterparts.3) Most games you play are Nvidia optimized.4) You have to be a bit tech savy to make this laptop work in an optimal manner.Make sure to watch JarodTech's vidoes on YouTube on how this laptop compares to others in different games.Simplified verdict, if you dont know how to solve computer problems or have extra money to spend, then buy the Lenovo Legion series. And if you are good at solving computer issues and want to save some money without compromising on performance buy the Asus Advantage Edition laptop.
review_title: Worth buying, very good performance while gaming, lacking software optimizations though

Name: ASUS ROG Strix G15 Advantage Edition, 15.6-inch (39.62 cm) WQHD 165Hz/3ms, AMD Ryzen 9 5980HX, 12GB RX¬†6800M Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Black/2.5 Kg), G513QY-HQ032WS
review: Good laptop, Ryzen 5980hx with 6800M is awesome. But Amazon is giving ability to write review even without buying it.Edit: I have bought it and now it's being shipped.Edit 2 (Review) :  This laptop is a beast! The GPU, Display is damn awesome. Those who are going to buy this one already knows all the pros of this laptop fron reviewers, as it's priced as high tier 3060 but performs close to 3080 or 3070Ti.  But I will list some cons about this machine.1. You need to be a Tech Savvy to optimize this laptop. Asus's own Performance and Turbo mode is bad and you will get Thermal Throttling if you use them. Instead you need to use Manual Mode to unlock the potential of laptop.2. The Fan of this laptop can go 7500 to 8000 RPM, but asus has locked tohe fan speed to 6500 RPM max via bios update, and this is a bad move from Asus Side. This one needs adequate cooling (if you want best performance) but the worse thing is you can't get full 7500 RPM even via Manual Mode. Asus must fix this.3. Don't panic if you see 95¬∞c CPU temps as it's Max Limit is 105¬∞c, but you can certainly limit it via Manual Mode (by lowering CPU tgp and increasing fan speed).4. Keyboard is very good for gaming but not for heavy typing (As I am not used to big size keys, but it's personal opinion, not a con) These were a few cons i faced (tho I solved it after lots of Reddit and YouTube Guide), but thr performance I get after that is unbelievable! Also an added bonus: Unlike Nvidia, AMD's graphics driver gets better day by day and support their customer for a long period of time. Whereas Nvidia stops caring for their old gpus after a few years.Also AMD is lot better for Linux as they are way more open source than Nvidia.Final Verdict: Go for it!
review_title: This one is Hell of A Beast

review: I recently got this laptop and I am beyond impressed with its performance.Firstly, the design is sleek and modern. The display is absolutely stunning, offering a clear and vibrant image with excellent color accuracy. The anti-glare feature is also a bonus, as it minimizes reflections and glare, making it easier to use the laptop for extended periods.The performance is where this laptop truly shines. This laptop is incredibly fast and can handle even the most demanding tasks with ease. The SSD provides ample storage space for all my games, files, and applications, and the graphics card delivers exceptional performance for gaming and other graphics-intensive tasks.The refresh rate and brightness make the screen incredibly responsive and provide a smooth and enjoyable gaming experience. Additionally, the laptop comes pre-installed with Windows 11 and MS Office, making it easy to get started with work or play right out of the box.

The build quality should be definitely improved as most of it is plastic and fibre. Keyboard doesn't have Per key RGB and it's fine. Trackpad is large. Laptop hangs a lot ig due to Windows 11. Decent buy for 1.65 lakhs.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro AMD Ryzen 7 5800H40cm 500Nits QHD Gaming Laptop(16GB/1TB SSD/RTX 3060 6GB GDDR6 Graphics/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/RGB Backlit/3mnth Xbox Game Pass/Storm Grey/2.45Kg)82JQ00JCIN
review: The laptop is just awesome. Although would have preferred Win10 instead of 11, the system is fast and smooth.I am a pro fortnite player and gaming was awesome on Fortnite, gta5 and wk22.I must warn that the hot air blow from the 4 vents is too hot. I use it to warm my hands. Gpu runs at around 70 to 80 degrees during gameplay. I got the 3060 version.Update : The games run smooth only when charger is plugged in, once it goes to battery mode (during power cuts) the FPS drops drastically and the GPU just cant handle the games without stuttering.Although a laptop, it needs to be plugged in for gaming.Also, I have a Zebronics UPS (600VA I think), the laptop charger is so bulky that the UPS goes off in 30secs when the laptop charger is on UPS. Good luck during power cuts.Nonetheless, the laptop is a best buy.

Name: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro AMD Ryzen 7 5800H40cm 500Nits QHD Gaming Laptop(16GB/1TB SSD/RTX 3060 6GB GDDR6 Graphics/165Hz/Windows 11/Office 2021/RGB Backlit/3mnth Xbox Game Pass/Storm Grey/2.45Kg)82JQ00JCIN
review: This laptop is a complete all rounded package and ticks all the boxes. Its powerful with 130W TGP RTX 3060 and will deliver upwards of 100 fps for most AAA titles on high and ultra settings. It delivers quite a punch in SketchUp, Vray, Lumion, Photoshop and Premier Pro. The keyboard layout is good and keyboard feel and typing comfort is also very good. The best part is 16:10 aspect ratio ultra bright 2K screen. Just amazing display honestly. Very sturdy build quality and good looks.The only cons is that this is a pretty heavy laptop to carry around. Also the speaker volume is low even on the highest point. But barring those, this is just a really wonderful and powerful machine.

review: The laptop is just awesome. ¬†I recently purchased this laptop from amazon, and I am extremely disappointed with my purchase. review: First of all this is a sleek and stylish looking laptop. I love everybit of it. Though it's too expensive compared to the other brands with same configuration, I still love the design and build quality of this laptop. It looks premium.The OS is really buggy. Very unreliable. It either doesn't shutdown well or doesn't start well. Always bluescreen and hard reboots. Really pisses me off. Only good thing is I'm using it for gaming only for now so no big issue. But with this kind of unstable OS, I don't prefer it for work.When I purchased this, there were couple of offers listed on in here from Dell. But when I try to claim them after purchasing of the laptop, dell simply rejected my claims. Even the customer support from dell promised me I'm eligible for the offer, after dragging it for couple of days, they simply closed my claim saying dell rejected my service tag.Dell and the Dell back to collage offering company both acted like they both don't work under DELL. This is really poor response from Dell.
review_title: Sleek stylish laptop with a lot of bugs and false dell promises

Name: Dell Alienware x14 Gaming Laptop, Intel i7-12700H, 14" (35.5cm) FHD 144Hz 400nits GSYNC+ Advanced Optimus,32GB DDR5,1TB SSD,Nvidia RTX 3060 6GB,Dolby Atmos,Windows 11,Lunar Light(1.84 kgs) D569939WIN9
review: Yes, it is overpriced, but oh boy, am I impressed.Pros:- Fast 12th gen i7 (no i9 options due to TDP)- Decent RTX 3060- 32GB of fast RAM- Head turning colour and design that just grows on you- Sleek and lightweight- Integrated Windows Hello with dual IR cameras- Beautiful display with Dolby Vision- Speakers punch above their weight with Dolby Audio- Excellent thermals with almost no throttling even in Indian conditions- Dell's legendry warranty and after sales, including full accidental damage coverage- USB type C charging- Fast SSDCons- Loud and screechy fans due to small blades and form factor- Averagish battery life, but hey it's an ultra portable gaming laptop- Limited IO ports and their location at the back can be a hit or a miss, especially for audio- Expensive, especially against competition that can give you more for the price or cost less in general- Relatively large charger, even if it is sleek for the power it drives- No large storage (1TB runs out fast with 30-50GB games)All in all, I'd still say it's one of the best package possible. If you have the money, do for it blindly, you won't be disappointed for at least the next 3 years.
review_title: You are paying for design, integration and reliability

Name: Dell Alienware x14 Gaming Laptop,Intel i7-12700H Windows 11,14"(35.5cm) FHD 144Hz 400nits GSYNC+Advanced Optimus,16GB DDR5,512GB SSD,Nvidia RTX 3050 Ti 4GB,Dolby Atmos,Lunar Light(1.84 kg) D569938WIN9
review: First of all this is a sleek and stylish looking laptop. I love everybit of it. Though it's too expensive compared to the other brands with same configuration, I still love the design and build quality of this laptop. It looks premium.The OS is really buggy. Very unreliable. It either doesn't shutdown well or doesn't start well. Always bluescreen and hard reboots. Really pisses me off. Only good thing is I'm using it for gaming only for now so no big issue. But with this kind of unstable OS, I don't prefer it for work.When I purchased this, there were couple of offers listed on in here from Dell. But when I try to claim them after purchasing of the laptop, dell simply rejected my claims. Even the customer support from dell promised me I'm eligible for the offer, after dragging it for couple of days, they simply closed my claim saying dell rejected my service tag.Dell and the Dell back to collage offering company both acted like they both don't work under DELL. This is really poor response from Dell.
review_title: Sleek stylish laptop with a lot of bugs and false dell promises

Name: Dell Alienware x14 Gaming Laptop,Intel i7-12700H Windows 11,14"(35.5cm) FHD 144Hz 400nits GSYNC+Advanced Optimus,16GB DDR5,512GB SSD,Nvidia RTX 3050 Ti 4GB,Dolby Atmos,Lunar Light(1.84 kg) D569938WIN9
review: Yes, it is overpriced, but oh boy, am I impressed.Pros:- Fast 12th gen i7 (no i9 options due to TDP)- Decent RTX 3060- 32GB of fast RAM- Head turning colour and design that just grows on you- Sleek and lightweight- Integrated Windows Hello with dual IR cameras- Beautiful display with Dolby Vision- Speakers punch above their weight with Dolby Audio- Excellent thermals with almost no throttling even in Indian conditions- Dell's legendry warranty and after sales, including full accidental damage coverage- USB type C charging- Fast SSDCons- Loud and screechy fans due to small blades and form factor- Averagish battery life, but hey it's an ultra portable gaming laptop- Limited IO ports and their location at the back can be a hit or a miss, especially for audio- Expensive, especially against competition that can give you more for the price or cost less in general- Relatively large charger, even if it is sleek for the power it drives- No large storage (1TB runs out fast with 30-50GB games)All in all, I'd still say it's one of the best package possible. If you have the money, do for it blindly, you won't be disappointed for at least the next 3 years.
review_title: You are paying for design, integration and reliability

Name: HP 14(2021) 5th Gen AMD Ryzen 3 5300U 14 inches(35cm) FHD Gaming Laptop with Alexa Built-in (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office), Natural Silver, 1.46Kg, 14s-fq1029AU
review: Best Laptop you can get under 40kEverything is great. No Major Issues in my 1 month of useBuild Quality 3.5/5  - Nice and Compact, really light weight. Looks gorgeous However, there is a bit of creaking here and there. The lid does wobble a bit when you open the hinge. Maybe I am nitpicking because my previous laptop was a ThinkPad and I am used to that level of build quality.Display 4/5 - Really bright, excellent ips panel. Viewing angles excellent. Probably you can't get a better display even with a 60k laptop in terms of quality. However, one con is that it is not anti-glare. It is highly reflective. Need to apply an anti-glare coating which costs another 500. Smudges also accumulate very easily. It is very easy to scratch the display, so I would advise you to get an anti-glare screen guard as soon as possible.Performance 4.5/5 - No issues at all. Ryzen 3 5300 is at par with i5 10th gen and the iGPU is even better than that on the i5 10th gen ones. i3 11th gen is not even a competitor to this cpu.  I always use it in battery saver mode and use 2-3 apps like notepad, MS Office, Chrome, with 10+ tabs and it hasn't lagged even once in 1 month of use. I mostly use it for office work and haven't done any intensive task at all (don't plan to do so too). Will probably handle all kinds of softwares, coding and stuff. My advice would be to not use it for gaming at all. Even though you will probably be able to play high-end titles in medium settings, don't tax the laptop. This isn't meant for gaming and you are just reducing the life of your laptop. Just invest 5-8k more and you will get dedicated gaming laptops with same or better performance.Battery 5/5 - Honestly can't expect a better battery backup from any laptop across any price range. As I told, I use it in battery saver mode with low brightness (I use it indoors) and it can give me 10 hours of battery life with wifi and office work (no bluetooth also as I don't use any bluetooth mouse or bluetooth earphones) so, battery is your prime concern, you really can't go wrong with this laptop. Another cool thing is the charging time. It is rapid. Can charge the laptop 0-100% in 90 minsCamera 4/5 - No issues here also. Perfect for video calls, meetings. Honestly, I have seen other reviews mention camera quality isn't good but I honestly don't think so. Maybe they are expecting quality like their phone front cameras which isn't necessary at all for online classes or office meetings only. There is a small flash too which you can turn off if you want. I think that's a handy touch. Mic also works very well. I am clearly audible to everyone in the meeting.Keyboard and Trackpad 4/5 - No major issues here also. Keyboard does look a little flimsy and keys wobble slightly but nothing major at all. Typing experience is very good. Backlight is a major bonus. There are two modes of backlight, the dimmer version will suffice for 90% of the time. Trackpad is excellent and detects even the smallest of movements. Sometimes it is too sensitive. There is slight creaking in the right click and left click buttons but that's excusable I think.Conclusion 4/5 : You really can't get a better deal than this for 40k. Ryzen 3 5300 + HP brand and after sales service + Insane battery make this a no-brainer decision to make if you are looking for a laptop in this price range.PS : Look for laptop maintenance tips and battery maintenance tips on YouTube to get the most out of your laptop in the long-run
review_title: Best Laptop Under 40k - Detailed Review After 1 Month of Use

Name: HP 14(2021) 5th Gen AMD Ryzen 3 5300U 14 inches(35cm) FHD Gaming Laptop with Alexa Built-in (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office), Natural Silver, 1.46Kg, 14s-fq1029AU
review: Here is my review for the product after 4 days of usage.Pros:Terrific FHD Display, quality is really good.8GB Ram, which can be upgradeable.512GB SSD from Samsung, this is the best perk. Even premium laptops do not have a Samsung SSD, while this one does.It has a beautiful Backlit keyboard.Screen to body ratio is decent.Camera quality is decent, do not expect way too much.I could open 20 tabs on chrome, 5 Excel worksheets and the system worked fastest ever, thanks to SSDBoot is way too quick. 8 secondsBattery backup is solid as it lasts 5 to 7 hours depending on your usage.It has a Ryzen 3 5300 processor, with a 7mm nano technology. This is way too good in comparison with i5It has a built in Alexa :)It comes with pre installed Windows 10 and MS Office Student and home 2019, don't forget to activate it.Cons:Build quality is average. The body is full plastic, could have been better but you can't really complain for this price.Anti glare is a con provided by everyone, but you can overcome this by applying an anti glare screen guard. I don't think it matters too much.SSD usable storage is only 434 GB, as windows 10 consumes decent amount.Trackpad using is a bit uncomfortable I felt due to the plastic body, I use a wireless mouse.I wouldn't recommend heavy gaming as this is not a gaming laptop, however you can go for mild gaming sport. Conclusion: Overall this is a terrific purchase, if your budget is within and around 40k, go for it blindly. I read tons of reviews for tons of devices before buying, I am sharing the honest review. This is value for money.Also, just a tip- you'll need to get your warranty updated because HP calculates warranty period from the date when unit was shipped.All you have to do is contact HP support on Chat, share your proof of purchase via email and your warranty is updated in 24 to 48 hours. Solid customer support.Go for this laptop and enjoy! Hope This helps.
review_title: Perfect laptop for professionals and students within 40k

Name: HP 14(2021) 5th Gen AMD Ryzen 3 5300U 14 inches(35cm) FHD Gaming Laptop with Alexa Built-in (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office), Natural Silver, 1.46Kg, 14s-fq1029AU
review: The outer package in which it was delivered was completely open, I was sceptical if the laptop is ok, but inside the laptop was fine. Here is a quick review after spending couple of days with the laptop. Build quality of the laptop is not so great especially the keyboard, I am comparing it with hp ProBook 440 G4 which I'm already using. Battery backup is approx 7-8 hrs with light work and screen brightness to midium and backlit keyboard off. Laptop hardware is very good no doubt about that. It's very reasonably priced on this date when I purchased, in future price may increase. You get performance almost equivalent to i5 11th Gen which cost approximately 15k-20k more. Only drawback is, it has Bluetooth is 4.2, it should have been at least Bluetooth 5. It has WiFi 5 and very much compatible with 5ghz dual band home routers, so I don't consider this as a drawback. Screen is very reflective it dont have matte finish like my ProBook has, it has colour only upto 45% NTSC gamut with 6 bit detail as compared to stand alone monitors which are much better with 72% NTSC gamut and 8 bit detail, so basically it justify the price at which it's available. Ram is upgradable to 16GB, Samsung NVME SSD is provided and it's upgradable, but no extra slot for SSD or 2.5 inch sata HDD available in this laptop. If you do normal office work or teams and zoom video sessions you will not be able to observe any huge difference in processing with i5 11th Gen or AMDs own 5500u where both of the laters cost 10k to 20k more. So in my opinion this is the most value for your money laptop in today's date.
review_title: Very reasonably priced value for money
