Name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 ACRNM AMD Ryzen 9 4900HS 14 inches QHD Gaming Laptop (32GB/1TB SSD/MS Office/RTX 2060 Max Q 6GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 10/Crossover Gray/Anime Matrix/1.7 Kg), GA401IVC-HA275TS
review: I love the cyberpunk theme of this laptop. I'm a graphic designer and was instantly intrigued with the unique color palette on the keyboard, custom glyphs & logos etched all over.I saw it, and I wanted it. In hindsight, it might've been an emotional decision splurging 10% extra just for the design, but no regrets so far.Would highly recommend the G14 line. The keyboard and trackpad feel exceptionally good. The glass trackpad is almost at par with that of a MacBook, only smaller.Have had no trouble with the fan noise so far. I'm not a gamer, but have used it for UI/UX softwares, and motion graphics and the fans didn't even kick in.Overall, feels like a solid machine which I plan on using for the next 4-5 years.

I can assure you one thing you won't be disappointed like you are in yourself. I bought this when it was first released and it still works as fast as when I bought it. This is again hands down the best starting gaming laptop you could buy.

Name: (Renewed) HP Victus AMD Ryzen 5 5600H 16.1 inches FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/4GB RTX 3050 Graphics/Flicker Free Display/Windows 10/MS Office/Mica Silver/2.48 Kg), 16-e0076AX
review: The Laptop's build quality is solid deisgn is minimal, it doesn't have that gaming laptop's rainbow look. Which personally I don't like. Which makes this laptop blend in with office setting easily.RTX3050 with Ryzen 5600H is a killer combo! Although I would recommend to get the RAM upgraded to 16GB for heavy works and for games I haven't faced any issue with 8GB ram so far.Battery Backup is really good I average about 3-4hrs with miltimedia work, office works and browsing battery lasts upto 8-9hrs with brightness set to 50%. Thanks to 200w charger laptop gets fully charged in 1hr and 10min.The only let down is Display color accuracy this being a 45% NTSC I opted for IPS and 60fps because of Color Accuracy. Then I find out there is another version that has 72% NTSC. I mistakenly ordered the former one. Just keep this in mind while ordering.

review: It's a very good laptop for gaming with good build quality.Over Heating is the only problem iam facing.Even after gaming for 10 to 15 min temp reaches above 80¬∞c.
review_title: Overall good package with a lot of heating

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop, FX577ZE-HN056W + VP5700 TUF 17" (43.18 cm) Backpack (Black)
review: The laptop is really good for the price and does offer the performance when needed. Thermal performance is also good. The only issue I had was the screen...could have been better for the price we are paying. Speakers are really good... didn't expect them to be this clear and have bass at all. The intel core i7 12700H performs like a beast... definately a major jump from the 11th gen for sure..and the RTX 3050 ti is perfect for some casual gaming and graphic intensive workloads....the 4GB VRAM may seem less for hardcore gamers and professional graphic designers...they should go for the RTX 3060 variant.Overall this laptop is great...build quality is amazing, performance is good for the price, keyboard is also good and durable, and the trackpad has a really big surface area.My only complaint is the screen, it could have been better but considering everything else...it's better than all the laptops competing in this segment and comes in a good package as well.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop, FX577ZE-HN056W + VP5700 TUF 17" (43.18 cm) Backpack (Black)
review: Performs amazing. Comes with great specs under the price point. Smooth gaming experience even on ultra settings. Also great for creators as it also has great rendering speeds. Only a con is fans go loud while gaming and rendering, else it gives a great experience overall.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop, FX577ZE-HN056W + VP5700 TUF 17" (43.18 cm) Backpack (Black)
review: I love the laptop for its processing and the design. When I play games with ultra settings the cpu temp raises to above 85¬∞c consistently in turbo mode. When I do cpu instensive tasks like rendering videos in blender it goes to 95¬∞c. I am not sure if it's my product defect or not. The battery backup is very less. Build is excellent. 512 gb ROM seems way too less for me. My main concern is the cpu temperature during intensive work.
review_title: The laptop specs are very good. But heating issues for gaming.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop, FX577ZE-HN056W + VP5700 TUF 17" (43.18 cm) Backpack (Black)

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD 144Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3050¬†Ti 4GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop, FX577ZE-HN056W + VP5700 TUF 17" (43.18 cm) Backpack (Black)
review: So I bought this laptop for 1Lakh during the Great Indian Festival sales. I also ordered a gen4 ssd by WD in order to run linux. My main purpose wasn't gaming. Bought this solely for development works.I added secondary ssd. Opening the back shell wasn't that hard. One thing to notice is that the screw of ssd is very tight. So if your try to spin it without applying down force will endup in stripped screws. So keep that in mind. I installed Fedora 36. Faced some issues with Nvidia drivers. I would suggest to follow (https://asus-linux.org/wiki/fedora-guide/) if you are planning to install Fedora.I wanted to just try some games on this machine. So I tried pubg & hotpursuit. played PUBG in medium settings. When the heat rises, we can feel a framedrop. Avg temp was 89¬∞C while playing games. When I tried in an AC enviorment, things where smooth. So I would suggest to invest in a cooling pad if you are into gaming.Apart from that, If you have oily hands, the laptop get dirty easily. The audio quality is fine. Anyway I was using headset. You need to login for the first time in asus to get this device registered automatically into your acccount to get 1 year warranty (Dont know if there is any other way).So its too early to give a proper review. So I will update the review later.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: See if you were looking for a laptop that has good processor and a dedicated gpu but does not looks like a gaming laptop and gives premium looks and finish then this is the perfect option you are looking for.Pros :1. i5 12450h under 65k2. Keyboard and trackpad are amazing3. Has all the necessary ports4. Display is really great and 144hz is just awesome.5. Ram is upgradable to 16gb ( it has one 8gb and the other slot is empty so you just have to buy an 8gb ddr4 3200mhz ram and intall it)6. Read and write speeds are also good as it has a Gen 4 Nvme SSD. ( upgradable to 2TB)7. Games also run really smoothly as it has a dedicated gpu GTX 1650. I tried Valotant and GTA 5, both gives great fps and lag free performance.8. Charging is really fast as it comes with a 150 Watt fast charger.Cons :1. The screen wobbles which sometimes feels annoying.2. Fan noise is present when you are gaming which can be turned off but you will get low performance after turning off fan noise. But cooling is really nice.Note : If you are looking for good battery life in a gaming laptop it is very much impossible as 99% gaming laptops use H-series processors that consume power and does not give good battery backup.If you play games simply connect to the adapter and play any game you want.Doing normal task and buying it for college life, then you can get decent battery backup.  No problem in that.No major cons apart from these two.You can go for it. It is worth buying and you will not regret after buying it.

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: Writing after 4 months of usePros:-1. Loud speaker with good quality sound.2. Smooth Performance with i5 12gen H service processor.3. Bigger screen size with 144hz panel.7. High speed usb port.8. Fast charging9. No heating at all.10. Good quality keyboard.Cons:-1. Screen Wobbling issue2. Somewhat heavy3. Less number of slots4. Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: I bought this for work (development, coding, R&D) and not for gaming. I use it mostly on a vertical dock, so do not open the laptop. Boot on Lan with external Keyboard, mouse and display.Enjoying on a daily basis. Update after 4 months of regular useHardware update: bought with 8GB RAM, added 16GB additionalPros:- Powerful processor- Can handle a lot of work - simultaneous running Docker Desktop, multiple instances of Visual Studio, SQL Server- Keeps cool - did not see it heating up- Has dedicated RJ45 for LAN cableCons:- A little bulky to carry along- Power consumption is high at times - comes with 150W charger/adapter- HP support is pathetic, do not call them unless you are stuck completely- BIOS does not have an option for "Boot on Power" - so need to enable Power-on-LAN and use an external app to boot up if you do not want to open the laptop

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: Good and best loptop..

Name: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: Plus points about this laptop are:-1)Powerful latest generation i5 (12450H) processor.2)sleek and professional design. Sturdy build. Comes with a fast 150watt adaptor.3)Fast gen 4 SSD.4)Glare free 144hz display.5)A powerful enough gpu to play games and render videos.6)LOUD speakers. I didn't expected this. Although bass is a bit less.7)Nice keyboard with a separate numpad and powerful enough Back light.8)Latest wifi version 6E is packed in it.9)Office 2021 is included for lifetime.10)Comes at a nice price point.A few cons are:-1)Upgradability. You won't be able to upgrade ram over 16 Gb and no additional SSD/HDD slot provided.2)Ports. Even 2021 version has 3 USB A Ports. This one has only 2.3)Screen wobble is less as compared to 2021 version but is still present. Battery is as much as expected from a gaming laptop.(*) I have an additional complaint against HP. You can't set a maximum charge limit (like 80% or 90%) at which charging would automatically stop. (Asus, lenovo, acer all provide this feature in some way. Even most smartphones support it.) So why a 65k+ laptop can't support it. HP MUST provide that feature if customers want it.FINALLY, How good is it against Asus vivobook pro 15 OLED, as both costs somewhat around the same.->See if you are going to consume alot of movies, web series, videos etc. on your laptop. Buy Asus eyes closed as the difference in display picture quality is same as the difference between day and night.->If you want a more powerful laptop. Asus stands nowhere against HP Victus. Its a nice and power packed laptop for students(coders and casual gamers).->If your main purpose is to play latest game titles on your laptop, then buy HP Pavillion (ryzen 5 5600h, rtx 3050, better 72%ntsc display).
review_title: great for professionals as well as for gamers.

Name: ASUS ROG Strix Scar 17 SE (2022), 17.3" (43.94 cm) WQHD 240Hz/3ms, Intel Core¬†i9-12950HX 12th Gen, 16GB RTX 3080 Ti, Gaming Laptop (32GB/2TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Stealth/3 Kg), G733CX-LL013WS
review: This laptop is a powerhouse, top of the line specs in the market right now! Razer, Alienware and MSI have similar range specs but with a few features/specs different, and costing 1-2 Lakhs more. You cannot get more value for product than with this model.32GB RAM, 16GB VRAM 3080Ti, i9 12th Gen 12950HX Processor, 2TB SSD Storage, 17 inch - 1440p/2K display with 240hz refresh rate. Honestly, the RAM and VRAM are overkill, and this is the latest 12th Gen Intel Processor variant available, the CPU also has 16 Core/24 Threads compared to 14 Core/20 Threads of other models. It also comes with 1yr McAfee, 1 Month XBox GamePass and an MS Office subscription. These specs are all you need for your gaming/work purposes, it can easily play any game in the market at max settings, and should be future-proof for at least 5 years. Also included in the box are, a 1080p 60fps webcam, an awesome wired headset with mic, a standard wired mouse, and a cool looking laptop bag.If your budget is around 3L, buy this one without hesitation. At this price, it offers more value and better specs than similarly priced models from Razer, MSI, Alienware and other brands.PS:-Concerning the negative from Piyush, who hasn't even bought the laptop. He is completely wrong about the specs and the apparent value of it. Please ignore similar baseless reviews from people who haven't actually purchased the relevant products.About the negative review about the overheating from Suman. Now this is also incorrect, at least for me. The laptop does tend to peak around 90'C for a few secs when running intensive tasks, but this is in the acceptable range for the hungry i9 12th Gen processor. My laptop never had any heating issues on initial boot-up, when sitting idle, or in daily usage, it normally runs around 60-70'C. You have to fiddle around with the settings and performance modes to optimise your system, use a decent cooling pad, and lower the ambient temperature if possible. Gaming Laptops tend to run hotter, and the advised ambient temperature for this model is below 35'C. Maybe, Piyush received a faulty/damaged product, because I have not encountered similar heating issues.

Name: ASUS ROG Strix Scar 17 SE (2022), 17.3" (43.94 cm) WQHD 240Hz/3ms, Intel Core¬†i9-12950HX 12th Gen, 16GB RTX 3080 Ti, Gaming Laptop (32GB/2TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Stealth/3 Kg), G733CX-LL013WS
review: Do not buy it, it isn't worth 4 lakh rupees. That's some serious hard earned money, for a lot of people that's equal to 2 years of salary. Asus is giving 16 gb ram in a 4 lakh laptop. That's very less. They could used 64 gb motherboard and easily given 64gb ram and still make profit. Also 2tb ssd is looking fancy but it's not. That will only make 4 partition of 500 gb that's very less considering today's generation pc games are over 100+ gb in size. Rtx 3080 ti is fine that's the only sensible thing in this laptop. I own a Tuf A17 and it has 16gb ram and i got it for 65k so now you can understand you aren't getting good specs or much difference besides paying a lot.

Name: ASUS ROG Strix Scar 17 SE (2022), 17.3" (43.94 cm) WQHD 240Hz/3ms, Intel Core¬†i9-12950HX 12th Gen, 16GB RTX 3080 Ti, Gaming Laptop (32GB/2TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Stealth/3 Kg), G733CX-LL013WS
review: Your review was really wrong saying that the ram is 16gb ur wrong about that the ram is freaking 32gb ddr5 4800mhz which is the flagship ram and 32gb ram is really enough for atleast 6 years considering its ddr5 its like got 10 years in itThe gpu got 16gb vram not the ram got 16gb and 16gb vram is already overkill for 4k or even 8k resolution right now even 8gb is enough for 4k resolution in maxed out settings and ur asus tuf got 16gb 3200mhz ram which cost 6k inr(the ram) and this laptop ram would cost 24k  which is triple the price considering the cheapest 4800mhz ddr5 ram is 6kAnd the thing u mentioned that 2tb isnt enough yes ur right it got 2tb ssd but its enough Even if a games consumes 100Gb+ storage nobody would download this heavy games in the quantity of 20 that consumes 100+GB i they even do they would delete it later to download different games we wont call it adjust still cuz 20 this heavy games no one will download like thisand u can always upgrade the ssd when needed upto 6tb by installing 2x2 tb gen 4 ssd at like 12k price each 2tbSorry but i saw in many flagship laptop review i had to point your mistake of spreading misinformation

Name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus Duo 16 (2022) Dual Screen Laptop, 16" (40.64 cm) QHD+ 165Hz/3ms, AMD Ryzen 9 6900HX, 16GB RTX 3080 Ti, Gaming Laptop (32GB/2TB SSD/Win 11/with Office/Black/2.60 Kg) GX650RXZ-LO227WS
review: Pros:I bought this system and used it for a couple of days. There is nothing I can pinpoint as a flaw. It is a beast of a system. Screen quality is fantastic, throw any load at the system and it never hangs. For its specs and the load the system can take, it doesn't heat as the cooling system is really good.Cons:The battery life is miserable. Against what ASUS claims (8 hour runtime on a 100% charge) - while gaming the system didn't give me an 88 minute runtime on a 100% charge. The sound quality could have definitely been better, I wasn't impressed with it. When you over clock the CPU the fan noise which cools the system can get really loud.When you go to Armour Crate and switch the Aura Desktop mode on - it is visually so so beautiful but it just sucks out the life in the battery.This machine is like a supercar that does 0 to 100 in 3 seconds but when you reach the top speed you suddenly realize the fuel in the car is over. What a shame!
review_title: A BEAST - Both in Performance & Battery Draining

review: My first gaming laptop and I'm already loving it. Quality is top notch and not that I can play Pubg and get to use RGB Backlit keyboard I'm super excited. Refresh rate is 144Hz which is gold for a gamer. Just go for it guys. No regrets. Bought warranty for additional 2 years and now I'm good to go

Name: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel core i7 11th Gen (16 GB/ 512 GB SSD/NVIDIA¬Æ GeForce RTX 3050 Ti/Windows 11 Home/144hz) AN515-57 with 39.6 cm (15.6 inches) IPS Display / 2.2 Kgs
review: If you want to keep the laptop for just the warranty period, then go ahead and buy it. But, most of us like to keep our laptop in working condition for atleast more than 5 years. It is very likely your laptop will start having issues after warranty expires. And if you get any problem related to your motherboard (very likely, because they make cheap quality motherboard) then they will charge you more than a new laptop to replace your motherboard. And, it's motherboard is not even available in major markets outside. So, you just have to dispose off your new laptop and buy another laptop, but this time from some good company (learning from your mistakes).
review_title: They have worst after sale services when the warranty expires

Name: MSI GF75 Thin Gaming, Intel Core i7-10750H, 44cm IPS-Level 144Hz Panel Laptop (8GB/512GB NVMe SSD/Windows 10 Home/Nvidia GeForce GTX 1650/GDDR6 4GB/Black/2.2kg) 10SCXR-654IN
review: ** Invoice / pslip does not contain serial number of the product. Amazon says it's ok. MSI too says it's ok. (contacted both Amazon and MSI online). According to them, warranty will not be an issue.**Only MSI provides (consumer grade) laptops with RAM expansion capability upto 64GB. Normally, its possible with workstations only.Build Quality - I will say OK. Not for very rough use. Mostly plastic. Top surface brushed aluminum is for only aesthetics, I think. Screen / keyboard flex is on the lower side.Design - Only one thing is pretty bizarre. Both front exhaust vents are covered by the screen as you open it, thus rendering their usability almost null. Side vents are also small.Screen - Loved the screen! Not sure about color accuracy though. Enough bright / dark.Keyboard - I'm enjoying it. Key layout is a bit different. Only red backlit. Backlit can be turned off. Brightness can be adjusted.  Keys are black with letters marked in red. So you will be mostly keeping backlit on.Ports - As advertised.Performance - Again everything is fine but one. Heating! If I run two virtual machines, consuming 7GB of RAM, 35% of cpu, with FAN settings AUTO and Performance settings at HIGH, average CPU temperature is around 80 degree C. You will have to turn ON Cooler Boost mode in the middle (it will run fans at max RPM). Then you will get around 65-70 on an average. Think of external cooling solutions!Everything else is awesome regarding performance. I can't comment about gaming. I use it mostly for virtualization.All in all, it is a machine with good specs, avg build quality with normal heating issues.PS: It's charger is 150W at 7.7A. It may cause issues in some PGs / Hostels (where they don't allow to use Iron / electric kettle etc).Edit1: Yesterday my laptop screen got a single vertical line of dead pixels. It was sudden. Disappointed. Will update soon.Edit2: I visited the service center. It was an outsourced vendor SysNet. Little bit of initial "glitches". But believe my words, they helped a lot! Screen replacement was ordered. It took three days for the screen to arrive. Brand new screen! They called and i went to the service center. It took 1 hr to replace. Then there was exhaustive testing (done by them). Then the sign-off. That particular service center did help a lot (idk about other centers). I was able to track the repair status on MSI website too (some details). All in all, really satisfied with the service.Note: Heating will not be an issue if you can simply raise the laptop a bit from the table (to support air circulation). Sometimes i use a small fan (:P) , if it is really hot weather.All in all, after an year of use, it's a laptop worth buying. Heating is normal for an i7 processor and the given GPU. Keyboard feel is good for me (some prefer hard keys, some soft). Can't comment much on touched because i use external mouse. Upgraded RAM and added HDD. Speakers have good range and nice output.Revising stars to 4.

Name: HP Omen AMD Ryzen 7-6800H 16.1 inch(40.9cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/8GB AMD Radeon RX 6650M 8GB Graphics/144Hz/7ms Response Time/Win 11/MSO 2021/Backlit KB/B&O Audio/Alexa),16-n0079AX
review: Great performance @ pocket friendly price.

Name: HP Omen AMD Ryzen 7-6800H 16.1 inch(40.9cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/8GB AMD Radeon RX 6650M 8GB Graphics/144Hz/7ms Response Time/Win 11/MSO 2021/Backlit KB/B&O Audio/Alexa),16-n0079AX
review: The review is based on 2 week usage of OMEN so far:1) AMD Smart Shift intelligently shifts power to either lower or higher based on need.2) Smart Access allows to access memory for increased performanceIf you are manually shifting high performance or APU, then that era is over. MUX works flawlessly. This machine based on 3 power modes, a) power efficiency, b) balanced, c) performance, uses the GPU smartly to get the framerate or GPU loads that you need.If you need full control on your side to get most performance, keep connected to power, then select performance mode in power settings, and select high performance graphics under display settings for particular application. Gives you best framerates, but warms the hardware. Either find cooling pad or right environment to keep this machine life longer.Also, to run the laptop cooler when doing low level tasks or every day computing on word processing, browsing, videos, etc., keep it on battery, so your CPU and GPU works in low power mode to save energy and longer life of hardware. Laptop stays cool. Also change the power efficiency to Best Power Efficiency mode or balanced.Windows 11 + Omen all AMD is well thought machine for best performance per watt.Overall, its a great all rounder machine, whether you edit or play game, you get what you need even in high/ultra settings for 1080p screen given.
review_title: Beast of 2022-2023 for Mid to lower High End Gaming Laptop

Name: ASUS ROG Flow X16 (2022), 16"(40.64 cm) QHD+ 16:10 165Hz/3ms Touch, AMD Ryzen 7 6800HS, 6GB RTX¬†3060, 2-in-1 Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Win 11/with Office/Gray/2 Kg), GV601RM-M6054WS
review: Good things first:- Build quality is awesome, chasis looks rock solid, weight distribution is good. Feels good to hold.- Keypad and trackpads are comfortable- Capable to handle all the tasks without any hassle- Display is good, Touch screen is helpful, Pen input works fine and a delight.- Comes with preloaded MS Office package, Win 11 OS. No bloatwares.- Eats up battery pretty fast, still haven't tested hence will update laterCons :- Heats up like an iron box- Definitely not worth the money paid for.Brought it for 1,86,650. Price dropped to 1,76,000 within few days from the same seller. I feel robbed.- Charger plug is of 16A, so need a 6A adopter to be compatible with regular sockets at home. This can be manageable.- My exchange was rejected and I had to pay all the money, Delivery experience was worst. I regret buying through Amazon.

Name: ASUS ROG Strix G15, AMD Ryzen 7 5800H, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 300Hz/3ms, 8GB RTX¬†3070 Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/90WHr Battery/Gray/2.3 kg), G513QR-HF302WS
review: The WiFi isn't working properly and gets disconnected every time the lid is closed or when the system goes to sleep. Having to restart the system every single time. Also, the screen is flickering frequently.The issue persists even after updating BIOS. Waiting for engineer's visit to check the reason for these issues. Will update this review after that.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6"(39.62 cms) FHD 300Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3060 6GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/90WHr Battery/Win 11/Office¬†2021/Gray/2.2 Kg) FX507ZM-HF068WS
review: Pros -- Best features in the price point beacsue of newly launched 40RTX series GPU.- Intel's 12700H is way better than Ryzen 6800H in terms of performance. That said, Ryzen CPU is more efficient and is a better choice for a laptop.- GPU performance is good. MUX switch is great.Nitpicks -- RGB keypad is of low quality. Not very precise and clear.- If you buy from Amazon you get only one year warranty while from Asus site you can get 2 years warranty.- Only 2 USB type A ports. One will be occupied by mouse reciever, leaving only one.- DDR5 memory is good but instead of giving two 8gb sticks could have given one 16gb. Or could have given DDR4 and lower the price a bit more. Virtually no difference will be there.- Also 1TB PCI e 3 memory given instead of PCIe 4 which has double the read write speeds.- Also next gen hardware is just around the corner. But these new laptops won't come until the year end in India and they will be much expensive.So if you can wait for an year or 2 then don't buy it. If not then go ahead. But try Asus site 1st.Overall this is a wierd laptop. Could have saved costs on RAM and added faster SSD.

Name: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2022), 15.6"(39.62 cms) FHD 300Hz, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX¬†3060 6GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/90WHr Battery/Win 11/Office¬†2021/Gray/2.2 Kg) FX507ZM-HF068WS
review: Laptop performance is good, but a little costly. Only 60Hz and 300Hz refresh rate option.It has a 15A plug in its charger, so it won't fit in 5A socket, which are normally used in home.You'll need point socket for this charger.

Name: MSI Gaming Vector GP66, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 15.6" QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia RTX 3070Ti 8GB GDDR 6/Black/2.38Kg), 12UGS-234IN
review: The best gaming laptop you can buy for under 2 lacs, provided you are ready to make a few small concessions.The performance is amazing, one look at Jarrod's laptop review and you can see it is competing against high-end laptops above the 2 lac range. The 150W GPU makes it on-par with Desktop 3070 builds (BUT AT WORSE THERMALS OF COURSE). Ray tracing at 60 fps on High-ultra can be done. The per key RGB are also a plus point. The screen is also impressive. Little to no backlight bleed and a gorgeous 1440p 165Hz panel.The cons are the poor battery capacity and performance. You will not get more than an hour with its tiny 65Wh battery on regular tasks, so forget gaming. The build quality is not that great and the back panel is really hard to open if you want to add another SSD or replace the RAM. But the fact that you can upgrade it is a plus point. It has also the DDR4 ram instead of the latest DDR5, but you honestly are not going to notice a huge difference. It is also chunky and on the heavier side.USE ONLY AS A DESKTOP REPLACEMENT, WHERE YOU SOMETIMES WANT TO MOVE IT. IT IS NOT A DAILY TRAVELLER.
review_title: Best value for money Gaming laptop

Name: MSI Gaming Vector GP66, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 15.6" QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia RTX 3070Ti 8GB GDDR 6/Black/2.38Kg), 12UGS-234IN
review: Using it for 1 week -one of a kind laptop it has powerful 3070ti 150W. -very good for gaming. -consider getting a cooling pad for good coolingWill update review after more usage

Name: MSI Gaming Vector GP66, Intel 12th Gen. i7-12700H, 15.6" QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia RTX 3070Ti 8GB GDDR 6/Black/2.38Kg), 12UGS-234IN
review: The performance of the laptop is great and it can handle 1440p 60fps in most new aa games, the gpu is pretty close to a desktop 3070 which is pretty great for a laptop gpu. Intel 12th gen as well is pretty incredible I have yet to use a real world program that can maximize the cpu.Somethings that could be improved are the trackpad and the lack of a thunderbolt port as well as an additional usb c port which I think should be the minimum for an intel laptop in 2022.Probably the best value deal for a 12th gen gaming laptop right now.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest AMD Ryzen 5 5600H Processor 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop & 805 Black Original Ink Cartridge
review: The laptop CPU runs hot. Windows11/HP/AMD background program keeps the CPU working at 30%-40% even when it is idle. Task manager is launched to determine which processes are taking up CPU resources. However, the processes stop immediately and you cannot even identify what processes they were. The processor load suddenly drops to 1 or 2 percent instead of 30-40%. Windows11 is having some issues. This background activity kept my laptop/CPU hot. Temperatures can reach close to 100C even with a 30% CPU load. Task manager is now running. This keeps unnecessary background processes from happening and allows my CPU to cool down when it's not being used. CoreTemp software can be used to monitor the CPU load and temperature. It is essential if your CPU has been hijacked by an unneeded process that hides in the Windows Task Manager, as in my case.Edit: I used Anvir taskmanager, a third-party software that found windows explorer kept the CPU at 33% load when it was idle. This caused the CPU to reach 100C. The issue was solved by restarting taskmanager.I was initially unsure of what was going on, so I had to re-paste CPU/GPU thermal paste and use a third-party program to regulate AMD Ryzen temperature. You can read more about this below. We also discovered that the HP factory setup for laptop back panel had a large air vent covered by a plastic sheet. If you plan to play and keep your laptop cool, make sure to throw away the plastic sheet.My laptop should stay cool, even while gaming. It lasts a long time and I don‚Äôt have to replace it as often.I used Cooler Master Master Gel Pro Thermal Paste to re-past the GPU and CPU. The thermal heat sink metal plate had two types of paste. One was grey for the CPU/GPU, and one was white for other chips. The silicon-based paste CLG-3500 is the white paste. It can be found in the Maintenance and Service Guide for this laptop at HP. The white paste was left there because it has a lower thermal conductivity and is therefore less quality than mastergel. It was a little bit too thin so I used some Mastergel paste to fill in the gaps. These chips generate less heat than CPU/GPU, and Mastergel paste doesn't conduct electricity. The CPU GPU was made by cleaning out the entire factory and applying grey thermal paste to it with iso alcohol/cloth. Finally, I reconstituted my Mastergel paste. Mastergel/thermal paste conducts heat only to metal plates. It's up to the fans/ventilation how to remove it.The HP factory setting for this laptop blocks out the main air vent on its back panel with some type of plastic/paper sheet. See attached photos. I don't understand why HP would cover a large air vent that they created for their gaming laptop with plastic sheets. The air vent is right above the heat conducting plate. By opening it up, the heat from the plate would be conductive away. This will allow the laptop to run cooler and the fan to work less. It also allows the fan to last longer. If you have plans to use a laptop cooler with built-in fans, it would be more efficient if the back panel had many holes to allow cooler air to flow in. A backpanel on an MSi bravo laptop with the same processor and graphics card that this HP victus had exposes most of its metal plates. This allows air to flow in easily through many holes. From the photos I had seen, I thought this HP model had air vents. However, I discovered it was blocked when I actually held it. This blocking sheet was removed from the backpanel. Now my airvents are open and the hot metal plate is exposed. I created a DIY laptop stand using a USB table fan, a plastic inverted box and a large hole to allow the fan to rest in. I placed the fan in the box, and then the laptop was on top of it. This allows the fan to blow air directly at the metal heat sink/air vent plate.This setup allows me to keep my laptop cool while gaming. My CPU consumed 80-90Watts, GPU 70-80 Watts, and produced maximum heat. CPU reached 101C and GPU at 90C. GOW game displayed frames per second of 40-65fps with closed settings, and was slightly slower on rare occasions. However, since I had to repast the CPU/GPU, the backpanel air vent of my laptop was open. I also placed a table fan blowing air into its metal heat sink. Overall the laptop was cool underneath and slightly warmer on the keyboard, regardless of whether it was hot or cold. Speedfan 4.52 software also monitored the CPU fan speed. Maximum speed is approximately 4800 rpm. OMEN software can increase the speed. It idles at around 2200 rpm (without external fan) and at 0 rpm (with external fan). With my current setup and an external fan, the fan speed of my cpu is between 3800-4000 rpm while gaming. The fan speed never exceeds the maximum because it is cooler than the CPU.Two softwares are available for experts who want to directly control the CPU temperature and wattage. RyzenAdj.exe is another program that can modify certain parameters on Ryzen CPUs. The Ryzen 5600H CPU's maximum TDP power is 113 Watts. It can only operate at temperatures up to 100C. Both can be found via the command line interface to Ryzenadj software. These values can be set during a session using Ryzenadj or Ryzen controller softwares. You can reduce the maximum wattage from 113 to 50 Watts, and decrease the temperature from 100C to 70C. These new settings will ensure that the Ryzen 5600h CPU is not able to use any more power or heat up above the preset value. If you don't apply the settings again, these settings will be reset every time you restart your laptop. These softwares were used to lower my laptop's temperature. I set a temperature limit at 70C for idle/not gaming settings. The CPU would not exceed this level. These softwares can be used to adjust the temperature and TDP wattage while gaming. One example of a setting was to not allow the temperature to exceed 80C and to not allow TDP to exceed 75W. The CPU heats up very quickly even under 30% load, so only one of these values is going to be preferred. These settings were very helpful. I was able to achieve 40-60 frames per second in Racing game Dirt 5 at high medium mix graphic settings. This track simulates most weather effects and graphics. The CPU temperature did not exceed 80-81C. The GPu temperature was close to 80C, but these softwares cannot control it directly. They can only change or control the CPU values. These softwares can be used to reduce the temperature of your laptop if you don't have an external fan or a laptop cooling stand.The monitor lacks color. Recommendation to install the latest AMD Radeon drivers and AMD Adrenalin Software. I increased the saturation on my monitor. AMD Adrenalin software has a vibrant setting for global display/graphics. This setting can be used to display more vibrant graphics and in-game displays.The 4GB VRAM of the Laptop graphics card can cause problems with high-quality graphics in some games. Some games like dirt 5 or Forza 5 give vram low warnings. The graphics for Dirt 5 are still very good. It could do with a little more work for Forza 5. Forza 4 is great, and it has amazing graphics. This laptop is a good value for the money, but 6GB VRAM laptops sell at much higher prices. As an upgrade to this rx5500m, I recommend a 6GB VRAM graphics card over a Nvidia3050.I recommend adding 8GB RAM to your gaming and multitasking experience. To have 32GB total, I installed two 16GB rams. Everything works perfectly. It switches between programs instantly, switching from gaming to work, and it all works seamlessly. Rare games such as Modern warfare warzone war royale and God of War used more than 16GB RAM, sometimes up to 20GB. For most games, 16GB should be sufficient.Edit: I tried several games. All action-adventure and racing games are available for EA to play subscription and Xbox gaming pass. Overall, the laptop can run at 1920x1080 resolution and at 40 fps at high graphics settings. For games that were released prior to 2020, it can run at ultra graphics. The problem I noticed was that the battery was discharging slowly but steadily when gaming for long periods of time, even though the power cable was connected. It could be my laptop's power line or my home.
review_title: A good laptop for gaming, work/anything

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest AMD Ryzen 5 5600H Processor 16.1 inch(40.9 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop & 805 Black Original Ink Cartridge
review: Okay so let me be blatant and true regarding this laptopI ordered this on 27th November and received this on 29th. For 65k.If you're able to exchange your old laptop for even about 10k the deal is gold.Now the Pros :1. Perfect CPU+GPU setup. Too powerful. It takes barely 3 seconds to boot running all the softwares from NVIDIA, AMD, HP right from startup.2. MS OFFICE 2019 is free. But the 5GB plan only. Pretty efficient.3. Windows can be updated smoothly right from first start up or later. Windows 10 Home Single Language comes pre-installed with a digital license. And no major bugs in Windows 11 on this device.4. Screen is absolutely big. Feels great. If you want to run softwares or processes where you need more screen size it is definately a good choice but the quality is standard. Read CONS. I personally love big things and FL STUDIO will look beautiful on this big screen, so I got this one without much hesitation.5. The look and build of this laptop is absolutely classy. Plastic used is well polished and durable. Can easily go 5-7 years without any major structural deformation unless you throw the laptop around.6. The mouse pad with 2, 3 and 4 finger gesture support is amazing. I am impressed by the trackpad. I was surprised by how it enables 24 geture combinations. And the gestures can be customized.7. The airflow on this device makes you wonder if this laptop even has fans and do they work or not. It gets hot to about 60¬∞C but that's pretty much about it. Not crossing 70-80¬∞C anyday as per my usage.8. Finally the design is handsome. Everything is so balanced and it does feels worth the money it demandes. I was confused between 2021 HP Pavillion Gaming and 2021 HP VICTUS and I think the design of this machine made me buy Victus.Cons :1. DO NOT BUY THIS LAPTOP FOR GOOD VISUAL QUALITY. The screen is not worth 65 thousands. I upgraded from my 7 years old HP 15 Series notebook and the screen is basically the same. I don't care much about the refresh rate but the screen quality is below standard straight away. Specially it feels off because its big 16 inch. Doesn't feels like FHD. If you use your computer for visual works then stop straight away buy HP Pavallion Gaming 2021 or some other laptop. You can customize screen warmth and color balance from AMD Radeon Software(recommend download, it makes life good) and then you can do well with this screen.2. The Backlit Keyboard is damn too bright for night use and even for dim evenings. Even during the day times it will divert your attention away from screen. It strains your eyes in dark/dim room if you're using the laptop for long hours. HP should have given brightness adjustment for the keyboard. Maybe sometime later it may come as software or driver upgrade but this is must. You can't keep the lights off cause they are beautiful and you can't even keep them on cause they are too bright. Also the keys on the keyboard feels like plastic strips. Not much of a typing laptop.3. Battery life is somewhat on the lower side. It gives about 4 hours of battery life. Also if you keep on default windows and HP settings regarding power usage the device will fare further. Also the extremely bright keyboard lighting does take a toll on the battery. That definately needs a fix.4. The RAM management is not upto the mark cause atleast 5+GBs of RAM is mostly in use while running Chrome(which is a RAM intensive application). Maybe it is because the system is not well calibrated with Windows 11 yet but this needs some fix or some software update. No issues as such. But if there's a way to use the RAM more effectively it should be done.Final conclusion :This laptop is more kinda smart student device. Perfect for coders and people who would be working with digital workstations.If you want a classy looking beast with top performance and handsome looks and if size matters to you(screen size) pick this one. I will advise you to buy the one with better screen characteristics if you can. Otherwise this thing is too beautiful to avoid.If you're a gamer or artist and into refresh rates and visual quality then this is a big no. You've to buy the different variant with the better screen quality.Overall worth buying.
review_title: Victus is a total BEAST but...

review: Damn good product for 47000 rupees. I bought in big billion day sale. Also exchanged my old VAIO for 10000 rupees so effective price was 37k which was outstanding. AAA rating high quality PC games run comfortably under low to mid settings in 1280√ó720p under a safe temparature of 78¬∞C. But if u want to play it in FULL HD and high settings the game will run without any issue but temparature is going beyond 90¬∞C which is very unsafe. So practically play in low/mid settings with 720p resolution. Video/photo editing or rendering 3D designing is not an issue, it controls all those application like a boss. So within 50k budget in Oct 22 this is the best budget alrounder. Built quality, display and speakers are top notch.

Name: Lenovo IdeaPad  Gaming  3 Intel Core i5 10th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS  Gaming  Laptop (8GB/1TB HDD + 256GB SSD/4GB NVIDIA GTX 1650/120Hz/Windows 10/Backlit Keyboard/Onyx Black/2.2Kg), 81Y401ANIN
review: Overall its a great laptop if you are a college student and a casual gamer.Pros- 1) Performance wise its a descent device, AAA tittles run smooth AF without noticeable lag. 2) 120 hz is a bliss, I mean after using this display you just hate the normal laptop and you will notice lag in 60hz.3) Sleek design and minimalist look will give it a nice touch.4) overall a good buy and good gaming laptop, you wont need other anytime soon.Cons-1) Its heats alott, especially if you play AAA tittles it just sounds like its gonna take off, but yeah keyboard is also so hot to touch and forget about touching the back of laptop.2) Display brightness is okayish, it should be more brighter.3) They should provide MS Office along with it but I didnt get it so yeah.Final verdict-If you are a student who plays casually, just buy a good bluetooth mice and thats it.

review: I purchased this laptop for 55k, you can even wait if the price drops to 53 or 54 k also. Literally, this is a beast gaming laptop at this amazing price segment. The battery drains a bit faster but that isn't a big issue untill you are using a gaming laptop for office or college work. The worst part about this is it's speakers. They are just pathetic. I have a six year old lenovo laptop that still has double sound than this one. But yeah, using headphones while gaming would neutralise this untill you are watching movies or web series. Also I have tried premiere pro, blender and after effects, they work fine. Not even a bit lag when used 3 -5 layers. I haven't tried more than this. Fans are impressive and yes the best thing is the single blue colour backlight keyboard.Conclusion: If you want gaming laptop at 55k budget then surely go for this. AMD is surely a beast but not for long term guys. Intel is way more long lasting and good in terms of heat dissipation.

Name: MSI Gaming Bravo 15 AMD Ryzen 7-4800H, 40cm FHD IPS-Level 144Hz Panel Laptop(8GB/512GB/Windows 10 Home/AMD RX5500M/4GB GDDR6/Black/1.86kg), A4DDR-212IN
review: Though it's a gaming laptop, I only use this for my work and have opted for the hardware MSI has bundled together within the price range that I'm looking for.And it was a tough call due to few negative reviews that I came across on youtube but now I do not have to repent looking at the performance and the battery backup I'm getting. And all those reviews are big trash for me now :)CPU & WIFI 6 - With 8 cores and 16 threads, I would say it's a beast considering the price band for this laptop. Its performance is comparable to that of an I7 10750H. And the processing is pretty good and sometimes while working on the web apps it gives me an impression that they are desktop apps.Temperature/Heating: With Room temperature at 25¬∞C CPU temperature is constantly between 34¬∞C and 37¬∞C when the power cable is not plugged in, which is pretty decent. But, when put on charge it is very high at 59¬∞C which is the only cause of concern.Battery - Have set the battery setting to Balanced from Dragon Center and the power mode to "Better Battery" and with this setting, I'm getting a very decent 5+ Hrs from a full charge of 80% charge.Display - With the power mode and battery settings my screen would look a little dull. But Display is much pleasing after adjusting the settings. But then you may have to compromise on the battery.Graphics - I do not use this for gaming at all so I do not have much to comment about the performance of this 5500M Radeon Graphic. Again I saw few reviews not in favor of this graphics card so better cross-check if you are buying this just for Gaming.Future Ready with the following Hardware Upgrades :Comes with 2 SODIMM slots that support up to 64GB DDR4 RAM @3200 MHzAdd on slot available for extending storage capability. You can add either a SATA an NVME M.2 module and extend the storage.ConsThough the display seems to be alright now, I noticed the flickering on the initial two days of use which did not happen later. Did anyone else notice something similar?Also for some reason, I see a color variance and missing clarity while watching the youtube videos.TrackPad: There are no buttons and it's a little tricky it's not like clicking but tapping it hard at the trackpad for left and right clicks. Might be by design but MSI should consider fixing this for their next builds.Keyboard Layout: Comes with a short keyboard layout with big keys. Got used to the long keyboard layout so it's a matter of time that one gets used to it. Till then be aware of what you were typing.Material: Looks like very cheap black plastic all over.Heating: Dragon center shows the presence of two fans. But I never saw the other one working. So better check on that.

Name: MSI Gaming Bravo 15 AMD Ryzen 7-4800H, 40cm FHD IPS-Level 144Hz Panel Laptop(8GB/512GB/Windows 10 Home/AMD RX5500M/4GB GDDR6/Black/1.86kg), A4DDR-212IN
review: I bought this laptop couple of month ago, nice delivery and (double safety) packaging from Amazon. Safely received the product thanks for that.Pros:1. Performance of CPU & GPU is very good and satisfied so far. For this laptop spec this is the best in price from the market.2. There is no over heating or rather very good cooling system. While playing games for longer time there heating which is common in most gaming laptop3. 144Hz display is good for gaming not much flicker or lag observed so far, I am using MSI gaming monitor pairing well and good for gamingCorns:1. Keyboard and trackpad should have been better, not up to the mark. Keyboard is not suitable for gaming since it is gaming laptop but for normal surfing and presentation creating it is good. I am using external Bluetooth keyboard and mouse. You have click multiple times sometime to do clicks2.Battery backup is not what have promised in specs. They have mentioned 6.5 hours Average life, but I got 3 hours average so far. Not sure down the line after some days whether it would be same. But still with new product not satisfied with battery. While playing games it is very worst getting drained very quick, not expecting good battery life for gaming laptop but should provide minimal performanceOverall it is good performing laptop in this price range.Display is good (CPU, GPU is promising)Keyboard, Trackpad and battery is not performing as promised or expected.
review_title: Best product for this price range, 2nd month feedback - satisfied performance, Average battery

Battery life is good, I don‚Äôt expect much from this configuration though.7. Very lightweight and small size, making it very handy.8. Cooling boost feature (dragon centre) can be helpful to dissipate heat quickly.I will update this review in the future if I find anything new.

Name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus M16 (2022), 16-inch (40.64 cms) 2K QHD 165Hz/3ms, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX 3060 6GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/Black/2 Kg), GU603ZM-K8035WS
review: I'm writing this review after using it for about a month. This thing gets really hot to touch really fast. It's not meant to be kept on lap although it's a laptop.Performance is great and games run smooth provided you need to give it good cooling.The software bugs I'm complaining about is due to Asus's pre installed software to control performance I guess.Camera quality is poor, mics are not good sounding, all due to Asus's software maybe.And the battery, oh boy, even after having 90Wh and performance put to battery saver mode at 100% in a new laptop, it turned off within 2 hours of watching movie with ear buds. It drained more than 10% while doing nothing at lowest brightness settings and battery saver mode.--- update -I did some tweaks in the armoury crate (Asus hardware control app) and experimented with different things, now the battery life has improved a little, so added a star back, but still, you have to know what you are doing and how it'll affect you. Not straight forward. But the software is still buggy and hence, no star upgrade as it is very pricey.---What is wrong with Asus???I'm so not happy with the product with such high price tag. I wish I could get a refund üòûI wish I could get a do over with that kind of money.
review_title: Hot. Software bugs. Ok battery life

Name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus M16 (2022), 16-inch (40.64 cms) 2K QHD 165Hz/3ms, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX 3060 6GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/Black/2 Kg), GU603ZM-K8035WS
review: Whether its content createion, gmaing or just for entertainment this laptop is a beast.It is fast, not much heavy and has one of the best displays out there in market.Like most of gamig latop this one get hot when on high intensity work load.The battery backup only about 4-5 hrs max while normal use.This laptop take a  lot of power so before buying this be sure to have a 16A or 32A power plug in home.The microsoft office subscription is all there even the serial number is printed on the main box and its pre installed on the system.

review: It's a good machine with beautiful screen and best performance. Can play all games but the it gets very hot  and that increases fan speeds and fan nosi

Name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus M16 (2022), 16-inch (40.64 cms) 2K QHD 165Hz/3ms, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, RTX 3060 6GB Graphics, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/Black/2 Kg), GU603ZM-K8035WS
review: Go to this link and follow the instructions.https://www.reddit.com/r/ZephyrusM16/comments/th5kce/2022_m16_how_to_tweak_to_improve_battery_life/What it does? Switches off dedicated GPU, enables eco mode(windows silent mode), set screen brightness to 50% and limits watts usage to 45W.(not meant for gaming) set display to 60Hz refresh rate.Do know this will drop performance to almost 60%(45W) of full performance(but is more than sufficient for just casual browsing and daily task and even development ). Unless you want to game or use rendering or photoshop on battery which is still possible, will obviously perform 40% slower and drain more. All laptop excluding mac's will behave the same. This 60% is on par with performance on M1pro 10c-16gc. Extra is for pushing the limits of the chipset to outperform the rest.Try to set different profile for gaming /Stress activities and another profile for day to day uses. 6-7 hours for daily use is sufficient I hope. And do try gaming plugged in(that's what this machine is meant for).Fan and thermal is not the best running loud and hot(keeping chip temp cool where it really matters ). Rather have this setting that burn my chipset inside.All in all it has its drawbacks which can be slightly tweaked and make it an all rounder.PS: Price is too high but cant say no to that bezel less display which makes it look premium to carry around and is light weight(compared to other 16 inch laptops). 3060 is sufficient and enough to satisfy most users.Cheers happy gaming.

review: Writing after 4 months of usePros:-1. Loud speaker with good quality sound.2. Smooth Performance with i5 12gen H service processor.3. Battery life is satisfactory around 4 hours with continuous heavy use.4. Professional design laptop5. No issues in 3D modelling like use of Revit, AutoCad etc.6. Bigger screen size with 144hz panel.7. High speed usb port.8. Fast charging9. No heating at all.10. Good quality keyboard.Cons:-1. Screen Wobbling issue2. Somewhat heavy3. Less number of slots4. Fan noise at peak performance5. Personally I don't like the position of power button.

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: I bought this for work (development, coding, R&D) and not for gaming. I use it mostly on a vertical dock, so do not open the laptop. Boot on Lan with external Keyboard, mouse and display.Enjoying on a daily basis. Update after 4 months of regular useHardware update: bought with 8GB RAM, added 16GB additionalPros:- Powerful processor- Can handle a lot of work - simultaneous running Docker Desktop, multiple instances of Visual Studio, SQL Server- Keeps cool - did not see it heating up- Has dedicated RJ45 for LAN cableCons:- A little bulky to carry along- Power consumption is high at times - comes with 150W charger/adapter- HP support is pathetic, do not call them unless you are stuck completely- BIOS does not have an option for "Boot on Power" - so need to enable Power-on-LAN and use an external app to boot up if you do not want to open the laptop

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: Good and best loptop..

Name: HP Victus  Gaming  Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i5 12450H Processor 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD  Gaming  Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/GTX 1650 4GB Graphics/144Hz/BL KB/Win 11/MSO/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass), 15-fa0070TX
review: Plus points about this laptop are:-1)Powerful latest generation i5 (12450H) processor.2)sleek and professional design. Sturdy build. Comes with a fast 150watt adaptor.3)Fast gen 4 SSD.4)Glare free 144hz display.5)A powerful enough gpu to play games and render videos.6)LOUD speakers. I didn't expected this. Although bass is a bit less.7)Nice keyboard with a separate numpad and powerful enough Back light.8)Latest wifi version 6E is packed in it.9)Office 2021 is included for lifetime.10)Comes at a nice price point.A few cons are:-1)Upgradability. You won't be able to upgrade ram over 16 Gb and no additional SSD/HDD slot provided.2)Ports. Even 2021 version has 3 USB A Ports. This one has only 2.3)Screen wobble is less as compared to 2021 version but is still present. Battery is as much as expected from a gaming laptop.(*) I have an additional complaint against HP. You can't set a maximum charge limit (like 80% or 90%) at which charging would automatically stop. (Asus, lenovo, acer all provide this feature in some way. Even most smartphones support it.) So why a 65k+ laptop can't support it. HP MUST provide that feature if customers want it.FINALLY, How good is it against Asus vivobook pro 15 OLED, as both costs somewhat around the same.->See if you are going to consume alot of movies, web series, videos etc. on your laptop. Buy Asus eyes closed as the difference in display picture quality is same as the difference between day and night.->If you want a more powerful laptop. Asus stands nowhere against HP Victus. Its a nice and power packed laptop for students(coders and casual gamers).->If your main purpose is to play latest game titles on your laptop, then buy HP Pavillion (ryzen 5 5600h, rtx 3050, better 72%ntsc display).
review_title: great for professionals as well as for gamers.
